story:
What is Grim n' Gritty?

My name is James, and I am an aspiring comic's writer, looking to debut my first comic project, Grim n' Gritty.  I am teaming up with the great Luis Chichon to make this comic come to life and I need your help. 

The comic is a combination of two of my favorite things, cartoons and hard-boiled crime noir.  We are hard at work with the first issue of our 8-issue graphic novel and we need your help.

Setting

Animanhattan was once known as the "City of Dreams", but in the last 30 years all Hell has broken loose.  The superheroes are gone (except for the loose cannon Vengeance-Raven), crime is at an all time high and the poverty level is rising to unimaginable heights.

 

Story

Grim n' Gritty follows the life of Sid the Squirrel a homicide detective for Animanhattan. Sid's life is given a sudden change when former kid sidekick Scout is transported to Animanhattan from 30 years in the past.  Now Sid must serve as her guardian while investigating the murder of the great cartoon Goofus Goose. All this and more follows in Grim n' Gritty #1

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise money to help fund Louis's Fantastic Artwork! Luis has done some fantastic work already for the project and is in dire need of money to pay for his artwork.

* $880 dollars goes towards funding the artwork for the book, we cannot successfully complete the book without this amount of money

* The remaining $120 is necessary to pay for the costs of the fantastic prizes for the book.

* Investors can get loads of prizes, from PDFs of the book, a signed copy of the book, T-shirts, coffee mugs and oil paintings 

The Impact

Without funds this book will never see print, Louis and I want to get this comic created and we have plenty more stories to tell after this opening issue.

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that you may not be able to help us financially, but there are many ways you can help:

  • Please post information about this campaign to Facebook, Twitter and any other form of social networking.  Spread the word!
  • We would love to promote the book through any interviews or post on any website, so any interested are more than welcome to contact us.

story:
Homeless Cop is an illustrator and fine artist creating acrylic paintings and crazy cartoon TV commercials. His work has been featured on Adult Swim, and now he's written and produced his own self-titled epic stoner comedy:Homeless Cop.

Set in a futuristic city of monster and humans, it stars Nelson, a hard working nobody with an office job, and Kato, his crazy cool, cat head roommate and childhood pet. Also crashing with them is computerized life coach, Lorenzo.....

In the pilot episode, Kato gets Nelson a lottery ticket to make up for his slacking, and to everyone's surprise, they actually win! After making some new friends and enemies with the rich crowd, Nelson blows his half on bad stock tips, while Kato has cheddar stacked for future adventures!

Think Yellow Submarine meets Seinfeld, only Kato isn't a racist like Kramer. This is a show with great jokes for your ears, and visual craziness to have sex with your eyes! Do you want your mind blown all over your face? Isn't it time to get excited about your life again?

This is a show full of awesome music and talented voice actors like Greg Hollimon (Strangers With Candy) and Mancow. This is really unlike anything on TV right now!

With help from Doejo, ALL of the audio, music, and sound FX has been finished, and now we need YOUR help to make the animation magic happen! (Animators are expensive!)

We have high quality stickers, t-shirts, and prints to give away if you pitch in, and for the high rollers, we've got some special things planned.

The cartoon commercials are already on TV, now it's time for the full length show!

Let's do this!

Homeless Cop
story_txt:
Homeless Cop is an illustrator and fine artist creating acrylic paintings and crazy cartoon TV commercials. His work has been featured on Adult Swim, and now he's written and produced his own self-titled epic stoner comedy:Homeless Cop.
Set in a futuristic city of monster and humans, it stars Nelson, a hard working nobody with an office job, and Kato, his crazy cool, cat head roommate and childhood pet. Also crashing with them is computerized life coach, Lorenzo.....
In the pilot episode, Kato gets Nelson a lottery ticket to make up for his slacking, and to everyone's surprise, they actually win! After making some new friends and enemies with the rich crowd, Nelson blows his half on bad stock tips, while Kato has cheddar stacked for future adventures!

story:
What's going on?

Hi!  I'm Kiera Giordan, comic and all around awesome (and humble) person.  I started performing stand-up 3 years ago with just 3 minutes of jokes.  From there my material became longer, better, stronger.  I've worked so hard and now I have a chance to take my comedy career to the next level by traveling from Seattle to perform in New York City!!  I have been accepted into the She-Devil Comedy Festival October 23-27th.  This festival attracts the best female talent from the U.S. and Canada.  Being a part of this festival means that I will get exposure that can only be found in an entertainment capitol like New York.  It also means that I get to connect with countless comics and other leaders in the entertainment community.  Not to mention that I get to spread the gift of laughter to all new crowds of people.

This is my dream...I can't do it alone.  You can't tell jokes to an empty room and you can't succeed without help and support from others.

 

What I Need

To be able to go to this festival/competition I am trying to raise at least $1,000.  This money will be used to cover my airfare, time off work and some expenses while I'm in The Big Apple.  Please donate what ever you can.  A little can add up to a lot.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know better than a lot of people that sometimes extra money isn't in the budget to help out...that's ok.  You can still help in other ways.  You can spread the word about my fundraising.  You can share the information.  If you have anything from advice to resources that can help me on my journey, I will gladly receive it.  And when the time comes for you to ask for help, you better believe I'll be here waiting to lend a hand.

THANK YOU!!!!

story:
Overview

Hello everyone, my name is John Gallagher,

I am here in representation of our newly created company called White Cat Comics.

After Comicsgate we realize that we have to take matters into our own hands and bring our stories to life without all of the political nonsense and agendas.

We believe that above all comics should be fun! I grew up with them, I love them and I´m passionate about this, so it breaks my heart to see the industry that has brought me so much joy struggle the way it is struggling. Because we love comics so much, we are working on comics which are fun. exciting and above all.. very fun!

We hope you enjoy our first ever project called The Grim Reaper. 

 

What is The Grim Reaper about?

This 35 pages comic tells the story of the Grim Reaper when Azrael, the angel of death, passes on the mantle to a fearless soldier named Manfred.

When he becomes the new reaper, he is faced with many challenges as he learns how to use his powers. His children who also share some of his powers begin to grow out of his control, causing chaos and destruction wherever they go.

Humans believe that they have learned how to bring people back from the dead, but instead end up creating a soulless Frankensteinian monster which will end up terrorizing an entire city.

 

The children of death:

The children of death are supernatural beings, children of the grim reaper who have both supernatural powers and weapons given to them by their father. They will try to stop the mad scientists who are hell-bent on bringing people back from the afterlife, despite their father’s reluctance to get involved.


Characters:

In this first issue, we will have the appearance of some of the most iconic characters in history such as Vlad Tepes, the titans of ancient Greek mythology, the legendary war-pilot known as the "Red Baron", and many more! 

What We Need & What You Will Get:

Here is the deal, this project is almost done, but we need your help to print, distribute and to pay the team of professionals who have worked on it. I myself have written the story, while the illustrations were made by Santiago Gutierrez and the co illustrator, coloring, lettering, and overall editions by Carla Tornielli. 

  • We have some very unique perks for all of the lovers of horror and mystery graphic novels.
  • The funds will go towards inking, coloring, printing and distributing.

 

 

Risks? I don´t think so...

All of my team and I take pride in our work and will go to great lengths to have it delivered to you. We are very serious about deadlines, so please understand that not only do we see this as our responsibility, but also as our biggest dream in life coming true. A happy backer is definitely part of it.  We are packed with planned updates and communications, so you will always be on the know about everything that happens with the project!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand that sometimes you cannot contribute with money. But even if that's the case, you can still help us by spreading the word telling your friends and family, and following us on social media!

Thank you so much, everybody! I truly appreciate your time and support, please feel free to get in touch with us with any other questions regarding this project.

John F. Gallagher,

White Cat Comics.

www.whitecatcomics.com

CONTACT US!

whitecatcomics.staff@gmail.com

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/whitecatcomics/?hl=es-la

Twitter:

ILLUSTRATOR: https://twitter.com/Carla_Tornielli

WRITER: https://twitter.com/JohnGal74923137

story:
VISITATIONS  issue 2 is available digitally now. Print will be sent out April 2017.

VISITATIONS  issue 3 is coming in 2018.  Now taking Pre-Orders. 

 

What is Visitations?

 

Visitations is a story of Chicago, as witnessed through the eyes of characters residing in the city's oldest cemetery. It's part historical fact, part fantasy horror, and part adventure. As the narrative unfolds, the history of Chicago unfolds as well. From the Great Fire of 1871 to the election of President Barack Obama,  Visitations tells a tale of rebirth and the growth of a modern metropolis.

 

Meet Clayton Blackwood, magician and adventurer living in Chicago at the turn of the century . Blackwood and his ghostly group of friends believe they have successfully robbed crime boss Diamond Jim Colosimo of a cursed object. Little do they know they have the wrong talisman. When a mysterious stranger from Blackwood's past unleashes the horror they were trying to prevent throughout the city, this group of apparitions must leave the safe confides of the cemetery in which they reside and face their worst nightmares.

 

 

 

CHECK OUT ISSUE ONE FOR FREE!

The first issue, which is an introduction to the characters and the setting is available right now for free ( that's right...FREE!). Drop us a line at visitationscomicbook@gmail.com for your very own pdf of issue number one. In fact, we INSIST you do this before reading further.
 
Who are these mysterious characters?
Each issue of Visitations will shed light on an individual character and how the menace that is confronted relates to that particular person. 
 
What is issue 2 about?
Issue 2 is titled The Great Balloon Disaster and features the character of Nellie McCullough and her faithful skeletal steed, Kincaid.  Nellie McCullough is a typical Victorian teenage girl who embraces all the changes the new Century promises. Kincaid, her skeletal horse companion has a long history protecting her family.
 
Visitations Issue 2: The Great Balloon Disaster, is a special story that will require the reader to move and twist the comic as the story progresses. It is completely interactive and the  printed copy will have  the ultimate reader experience .
 
 
 

It's the fourth of July and Chicago is hosting The White City Ballon race for contestants around the world. But tragedy strikes when the hot air balloons explode hundreds of feet from the ground.  Nellie and Kincaid  attempt a rescue only to find that preventing  people from falling to their deaths is the LEAST of their problems!

 
What is issue 3 about?
Issue 3 is titled Mayhem At The Levee and features the character of the Piper Boy.  Little is known about the mysterious ghost boy who can reanimate the dead by playing a flute.
 
Visitations Issue 3: Mayhem At The Levee, is a special story in which the reader is the central character of the narrative. Told from the first person perspective of a traveling salesman who visits the infamous Red Light district of Chicago known as the Levee.  See the Chicago underworld of the turn of the century as if YOU are there. 
 

 

Madame Byrd's "La Plume Coloree" is the most famous high-class brothel In Chicago. When it's patrons begin to be brutally murdered by an unseen killer, the ghost Piper Boy must uncover the secret before it's too late.  

 

The most important thing

    To us, the most important thing about this project is that you enjoy it and want to see more. If you like what you are reading spread the word. Here's how: 

     

    • Share the book ( or books) you have. Email the digital copies to people. Loan, or give away the printed ones. Don't let the comic sit lonely on your computer or locked up in a comic box.
    • Let people know about Visitations. Tell your friends, your enemies, the guy at the coffee shop. 
    • Contribute to the campaign and mention it on social media.

    Follow us:

    • Facebook https://www.facebook.com/ScottLarsonIllustration/
    • Twitter https://twitter.com/scottjlarsonart 
    • Instagram https://www.instagram.com/scottjlarsonart/
    • Google+ https://plus.google.com/u/0/100238839086932795882

    Thanks for everything. We hope you have fun with the series!

Instagram https://www.instagram.com/scottjlarsonart/

Google+ https://plus.google.com/u/0/100238839086932795882


Thanks for everything. We hope you have fun with the series!

story:
ENGLISH VERSION (VERSION EN CASTELLANO MAS ABAJO)

Hello Everyone! My name is Adrian Minkowicz. I’m an Argentinean comedian performing stand-up in two languages-English and Spanish. I have had the privilege of performing in 3 different continents.

In 2007, I wrote and performed my first solo stand-up comedy show in Buenos Aires’ Foro Gandhi Theatre on the famous Corrientes Avenue in Spanish called “Uno solo, rapidito y de parado”. In 2008, I  continued to perform this show in Argentina and internationally in Spain.

Soon after I started performing stand-up in English as well, and in 2011 I was “passed” at the legendary “Comic Strip Live” in New York. I was also the first Argentinean to ever win “The Lottery Show” at this legendary Comic mecca. This allowed me to perform at the most important clubs in New York and LA, such as “Gotham Comedy Club” and the “Improv” among other iconic clubs. I also started performing stand up in English in Europe; the UK, Spain, Belgium, Holland, Norway, Finland, France, Germany and Bulgaria, and a tour in Asia including China, Japan, and Hong Kong. I also performed in Festivals like the “Just for Laughs” and the “Fringe” in Edinburgh.

Now, 8 years after of my first solo show, I’m proud to announce that I will have my first solo stand up comedy show in English “The Argentinean in Edinburgh” at the Fringe Festival in Scotland. I’m very excited and happy about this, but the competition here is wild! “The Fringe” is one of the biggest festivals in the world with more than 3,000 shows in a little over 3 weeks. It’s not a typo. More than 3k of shows in 20 something days.

I would never have been able to do any of this without the help of family, friends and fans supporting my dreams. That’s why, for the first time, I am starting a crowdfunding campaign to support my Scottish adventure. 

I think Stand-up needs International comedians with a different point of view and perspective. I’m positive that I have a unique viewpoint to share with the World.

In the same tone as my first show, I’m the only producer. I have made all the applications, flyers, info, website, etc. All with help of friends and family to whom I am forever grateful!

Since it’s a very tight budget, the money will be used for rent, general living expenses and basic promotion of the show. If there is a surplus, it will be used to cover the totality of the production costs, to buy more flyers and posters for the Fringe, and to promote the future performances of the show in the UK and the US.

I hope you decide to financially support the show. And, please support me on social media!! I trust in the “word of mouth” to get people to come to the show. You can follow me on Instagram, Twitter and Youtube: @adrianminkowicz and on Facebook as The Argentinean.

Thank you and see you around!

Adrian


VERSION EN CASTELLANO

Hola gente. Mi nombre es Adrian Minkowicz. Soy un comediante argentino haciendo stand-up en dos idiomas, Inglés y Castellano. He tenido el privilegio de actuar en tres continentes.

En 2007 escribí y actúe mi primer solo show de stand-up comedy en castellano en el Foro Gandhi de la famosa Avenida Corrientes en Buenos Aires en llamado "Uno solo, rapidito y de parado". En 2008 seguí haciendo funciones de este show en Argentina e internacionalmente, en España.

Poco después empecé a hacer stand-up en Inglés. En 2011 me "pasaron” en el legendario "Comic Strip Live" en Nueva York. También soy el único argentino en ganar el "Lotery Show" en esta mecca de la comedia. Esto me llevó a actuar en los clubes más importantes de Nueva York y Los Ángeles como "Gotham Comedy Club" e “Improv”, entre otros clubes icónicos. También empecé a hacer stand-up en inglés en Europa; España, Bélgica, Holanda, Noruega, Finlandia, Francia, Alemania Reino Unido y Bulgaria, y una gira en Asia, incluyendo China, Japón y Hong Kong. También actué en festivales como el "Just for Laughs" y el "Fringe" de Edimburgo.

Ahora, 8 años después de mi primer show, estoy orgulloso de anunciar que voy a tener mi primer solo de stand-up comedy en Inglés en el “Fringe Festival” de Escocia llamado “The Argentinean in Edinburgh” (El argentino en Edimburgo). Estoy muy contento con esto, pero la competencia aquí es salvaje! El ”Fringe" es uno de los festivales más grandes del mundo, con más de 3.000 espectáculos en un poco más de 3 semanas. No es un error de tipeo. Más de 3 k de espectáculos en un poco mas de 20 días.

Nunca hubiera sido nunca capaz de hacer nada de esto sin la ayuda de familia, amigos y fans que apoyan mis sueños. Es por eso que, por primera vez empiezo esta campaña de fondos para apoyar mi aventura escocesa.

Creo que el stand-up necesita nutrirse the comediantes internacionales con diferentes puntos de vista y que estoy seguro de que yo tengo una perspectiva única que puedo compartir con el mundo.

En el mismo tono que mi primer show, yo soy el único productor. He hecho todos las presentaciones, folletos, información, página web, etc. Todo ello con ayuda de amigos y familiares a los que estoy eternamente agradecido!

Puesto que es un presupuesto ajustado el dinero será utilizado para el alquiler, los gastos generales del día a día y la promoción básica del espectáculo. Si hay un excedente será utilizado para cubrir la totalidad de los costos de producción, para comprar más volantes y carteles para el “Fringe”, y promover las futuras actuaciones del show en el Reino Unido y los EE.UU..

Espero que Ustedes decidan apoyar financieramente el show. Y, por favor siganme en las redes sociales !! Confío en el "boca a boca" para que la gente venga al show. Me pueden seguir en Instagram, Twitter y Youtube: @adrianminkowicz y en Facebook como “The Argentinean”.

Gracias y nos vemos!

Adrian

También empecé a hacer stand-up en inglés en Europa; España, Bélgica, Holanda, Noruega, Finlandia, Francia, Alemania Reino Unido y Bulgaria, y una gira en Asia, incluyendo China, Japón y Hong Kong. También actué en festivales como el "Just for Laughs" y el "Fringe" de Edimburgo.

Ahora, 8 años después de mi primer show, estoy orgulloso de anunciar que voy a tener mi primer solo de stand-up comedy en Inglés en el “Fringe Festival” de Escocia llamado “The Argentinean in Edinburgh” (El argentino en Edimburgo). Estoy muy contento con esto, pero la competencia aquí es salvaje! El ”Fringe" es uno de los festivales más grandes del mundo, con más de 3.000 espectáculos en un poco más de 3 semanas. No es un error de tipeo. Más de 3 k de espectáculos en un poco mas de 20 días.

Nunca hubiera sido nunca capaz de hacer nada de esto sin la ayuda de familia, amigos y fans que apoyan mis sueños. Es por eso que, por primera vez empiezo esta campaña de fondos para apoyar mi aventura escocesa.

Creo que el stand-up necesita nutrirse the comediantes internacionales con diferentes puntos de vista y que estoy seguro de que yo tengo una perspectiva única que puedo compartir con el mundo.

En el mismo tono que mi primer show, yo soy el único productor. He hecho todos las presentaciones, folletos, información, página web, etc. Todo ello con ayuda de amigos y familiares a los que estoy eternamente agradecido!

Puesto que es un presupuesto ajustado el dinero será utilizado para el alquiler, los gastos generales del día a día y la promoción básica del espectáculo. Si hay un excedente será utilizado para cubrir la totalidad de los costos de producción, para comprar más volantes y carteles para el “Fringe”, y promover las futuras actuaciones del show en el Reino Unido y los EE.UU..

Espero que Ustedes decidan apoyar financieramente el show. Y, por favor siganme en las redes sociales !! Confío en el "boca a boca" para que la gente venga al show. Me pueden seguir en Instagram, Twitter y Youtube: @adrianminkowicz y en Facebook como “The Argentinean”.

Gracias y nos vemos!Adrian

story:
Short Summary

This comic has been in the works for over a year now, the story alone has ben done for a year. We currently are asking for funding so that we may self-publish the comic and send to you! the interested readers. Writing stories and designing new worlds is something we both enjoy. So please follow the story of Xavier Robinson as he comes out of his secure shelter as he goes against the treacherous nuclear wasteland above. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to hit our goal of 500$ So we can print and publish our comic for your pleasure to read.

  • 1$ - A small donation
  • 4$ - Get an issue of the comic ( the comic would be sold for 3$ but we need the extra dollar for shipping
  • 6$ - get a signed issue of the comic 
  • 10$ - Get your name in the issue as thanks plus the rest of the perks
  • 30$ - The last following perks PLUS GET YOUR OWN DESIGN HAND DRAW BY AARON!

The Impact

This is something that Aaron and Drew wish to pursue in their lives, They wish to continue to tell stories and bring enjoyment to others.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share the video to whomever you believe may help!

Thank you for your time!

story:
I've had some issues with people donating instead of choosing a perk, as of today people who donate instead of buying a perk aren't guaranteed a book. I'm sorry, I know the site is confusing, and if I could turn off donations I would, but I'm losing money on these mistakes. Please select and buy a perk with appropriate shipping. 

Short Summary

I'm known online as Commander Hot Pants and I make Mass Effect fan content. For nearly the past year, this has included the production of a webcomic called Chasing the Sun. 

The comic started as a five page proof of concept I made on a lark over one weekend, but the reception was so positive I created more and more. Right now, there's 130 pages and counting, with no end in sight. The production of this comic has become important to me in many ways and seeing my work in print is a dream.

What I Need & What You Get

I currently have a printing quote where I can get 25 books printed at $15 a piece, two of these books are already spoken for. I'm looking to sell these books at cost plus shipping to anyone who wants to support my work. If you purchase a pre-order of this, not only will you get the book at cost, you'll also get your name (or username) on the thank you page of the print. If you'd like me to sign the copy, or write a note please indicate and I will do so. 

The book itself will be 120 pages, full colour, 8*10*, 'perfect' bound with a glossy soft cover. This book will include a page of exclusive-to-print content which has never, and will never, be shared online. 

I'm not expecting to ever do a second print, so this might be your only chance to acquire a physical copy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word for me! Share this project with friends, post it into Mass Effect groups you're a part of, tell people about it. And of course, I'm also happy to take donations towards the printing if the price is too steep.

If you're new here, glance at the comic here

story:
All Perks have free shipping

The next 12 backer to get back at the $45 level perk or higher will get a free print of the John Dillard cover 5 of 12 claimed

First person to back $300 perk get a double page spread original art from the Buckler ashcan - claimed

Ashcan can be added to tiers that don't have them $5 as an add on.

The Canadian Shield is family friendly, John Dillard's ashcan for the Buckler is rated about pg13

Hey all, I am thrilled to bring you the first character in my roster of characters that will be part of Cross Comics. He is built like a brick house and given powers beyond those of mortal men. He is where the past, present and future collide. He is the Canadian Shield.

My name is Rick and my comic company of Cross Comics has been 30 years in the making. The launching of this project will hopefully not only fund this comic for printing but also pay for the other books to be drawn as several more issue of the Canadian Shield have been written as well as other characters.

 

The Canadian Shield #1 is a 24 page color story of his origins . It deals with him getting his powers and learning to use them and setting up for issue 2 and beyond for him to battle the threats that come at him and he is brought to.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

The money will go to printing up the Canadian Shield #1 as well as shipping it all covered in the costs as all tiers have the shipping costs so no extra money what you see is what you pay. It will also cover paying the colorist. There are perks where you get figurine as well as one where I will hand deliver the book to you in person 

The Impact

 

In a dying industry I bring comics back to where you can tell the good guys from the bad guys, back when the good guy know right from wrong. With Cross Comics you will get the best of all ages of comics

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Although I have been preparing to bring Cross Comics to the world at large for the past 30 years there is the risk in that very few know of me and things do not fund. One other challenge is that we are a Christian company and hold to that belief and will be reflexed in the comics although will not be pushed down one's throat. We love God first, people second and comics third

 

Stretch Goals

$3000   -     bookmark

$4000   -     4 x 6 print

$5000   -    sticker

$6000   -    button

$7000    -    key chain

$8000   -     lapel pin

$9000   -    11 x 17 print

$10000  -    trading cards of Canadian Shield versions by fans

$15000  -   8 page back up story

$20000  -  New trading cards of The Holy Warriors

$25000  -  cover upgrade

$30000  - paper upgrade

$35000  - patch

$40000  - 

$45000  -

$50000 -   Canadian Shield #2

and more to come

 

 

some pics from the Buckler

Other Ways You Can Help

 

And if you are unable to by and want to do something spread the word of my campaign and contact me is you wish to have me on your YouTube or other social media

story:
READ FIRST: From sales, I am temporarily out of stock of: Flying Sparks Vol 1've ordered another print run it should be in soon.

 

The greatest readers on the planet can enjoy some of the greatest books!  

I'm pleased to open up a store for the holidays (and perhaps beyond) to be able to get you the books you love from all of my incredible series. We've got steampunk books, we've got sci-fi, and we've got a ton of comics to read! 

All books and comics are available solo, as bundles, or as add-ons! 

NOVELS: 

The Adventures of Baron Von Monocle - Steampunk Novels (5 Books!) 

Zaira's inherited the world's only airship and must fly it to save her kingdom from an invading empire! Read this coming of age drama where she fills her adventurer father's shoes, and her friend James becomes one of the prestigious Steam Knights of the Crystal Spire! 

The Aryshan War + Colony Launch - Sci-Fi Novels (3 Books)

If you love Star Trek or Babylon 5, you're going to be enamored with this series following Sean Barrows, a spy who gets genetically modified to become a mysterious alien Aryshan in the middle of a brewing war. Also follow in Colony Launch, as a human group who opposes the war forms a colony far away from the conflict! 

The Saga of the Nano Templar - Military Sci-Fi Novels 

Star Wars fans this one is for you! It's Deus Vult in space, as the NanoTemplars crusade against the evil Sekaran empire in hopes of recapturing their home planet of Eloria and bringing about the end times! 

Make Science Fiction Fun Again (EXCLUSIVE!) 

Jon's short stories set in different universes. This book is NOT available anywhere else and is exclusive for you. Read an incredible assortment of fun stories from Jon's wondrous ideas.  

Star Realms Rescue Run (EXCLUSIVE!)

This out of print novel is based on the card game, Star Realms, which s a fun science fiction setting -- JDA's first published novel. Limited quantities left!

COMICS: 

Flying Sparks (4 Graphic Novels + 3 Single Issue Side Stories!)

"The kind of stuff that made me fall in love with early Marvel comics" - CBR.com. Get what readers are saying is the best indie superhero book of the last decade! The Romeo + Juliet of superhero stories! 

The Cosmic Warrior (2 Issues) 

JDA's cosmic saga begins in this action-adventure comic which brings back the golden age great feel like Flash Gordon and John Carter! 

The Clockwork Dancer (1 Issue) 

Love Steampunk and want more from Jon's comics? This is Jon's story set in Victorian era with a clockwork automaton on the run from the government and church! 

Dyanmite Thor (Graphic Novel + Classic Golden Age Restored Book!)

The wackiest of all golden age superheroes returns - the explosion man! There's nothing he can't solve without a little dynamite. 

Spectacular Comics (2 Issues)

Jon's Anthology comic with a whole smattering of stories from Sci-Fi, to Horror, Westerns and more! A great collection of the wild ideas from JDA's mind.

Robotoad: Rekt Manlet (1 issue)

The greatest super-amphibian book of them all! It's going to change the way you read comics forever! 

Get any or all books in any combination! 

The Impact

These great books are done, printed, ready to get into your hands for the holiday season. You can enjoy the best books in indie comics, ones Chuck Dixon calls "worthy of your support." Books Ethan Van Sciver (Cyberfrog: Blood Honey, Comicsgate, Cyberfrog: Rekt Planet) said, "looks great!" Fans of Clint Stoker, Red Rooster, Preston Poulter, Doug TenNapel, Bigfoot Bill, Mike S. Miller, Lonestar Heart of the Hero, Lonestar Soul of the Soldier, White Widow, Cyberfrog Ribbitcoin, Cyberfrog: Unforgettable Tales, Kamen America, Timothy Lim, Mark Pellegrini, That Star Wars Girl Presents Vampirella, Richard C. Meyer, PANdemic, Jawbreakers Lost Souls, Jawbreakers God-King, Shadow Sentry, Cash Grab, Cecil, Jon Malin, Graveyard Shift, Super Harem, Wenger, Bigfoot Bill 2, Earthworm Jim, Jawbreakers Grand Bizarre, Tim Lim, Mark Pellegrini, MAGA-nificent 7, Billy Tucci, Shi Haikyu, The Mermaids Book, Adam Post, Sovereign Wolf, Asyl, Nasser, Daym Drops, Black Hops, Soulfinder, Doug Ernst, Kamen America, FragaBoom's Black Flag, The Lucent, Graveyard Shift Vol III, Six-Gun Gorilla, The Littlest Umbrella, Another Case for the Littlest Umbrella, Reignbow The Brute, Reignbow Brute, The Plot Holes, Sean Gordon Murphy, That Umbrella Guy, Rainbow Brute, Rainbow the Brute, ThatUmbrellaGuy, will love this book!

Risks & Challenges

Hey, I could get the Rona and drop dead but I've delivered 9 successful crowdfunds on time and these are ready to go and done! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Make sure to share on social media so folk can read great books by a creator who doesn't hate you!

Miller, Lonestar Heart of the Hero, Lonestar Soul of the Soldier, White Widow, Cyberfrog Ribbitcoin, Cyberfrog: Unforgettable Tales, Kamen America, Timothy Lim, Mark Pellegrini, That Star Wars Girl Presents Vampirella, Richard C. Meyer, PANdemic, Jawbreakers Lost Souls, Jawbreakers God-King, Shadow Sentry, Cash Grab, Cecil, Jon Malin, Graveyard Shift, Super Harem, Wenger, Bigfoot Bill 2, Earthworm Jim, Jawbreakers Grand Bizarre, Tim Lim, Mark Pellegrini, MAGA-nificent 7, Billy Tucci, Shi Haikyu, The Mermaids Book, Adam Post, Sovereign Wolf, Asyl, Nasser, Daym Drops, Black Hops, Soulfinder, Doug Ernst, Kamen America, FragaBoom's Black Flag, The Lucent, Graveyard Shift Vol III, Six-Gun Gorilla, The Littlest Umbrella, Another Case for the Littlest Umbrella, Reignbow The Brute, Reignbow Brute, The Plot Holes, Sean Gordon Murphy, That Umbrella Guy, Rainbow Brute, Rainbow the Brute, ThatUmbrellaGuy, will love this book!
Risks & Challenges
Hey, I could get the Rona and drop dead but I've delivered 9 successful crowdfunds on time and these are ready to go and done! 
Other Ways You Can Help
Make sure to share on social media so folk can read great books by a creator who doesn't hate you!

story:
Hey everyone, my name is Brendan Hykes. I've been writing and self-publishing comics since about 2011, and I'm hoping to generate funds to complete my latest comic, Campaigners. campaignersblog.tumblr.com

Campaigners is a five-issue mini series about two high school girls who get caught up in a social uprising after a public rant against the government goes viral. Set in the year 2076, presidential debates have been replaced with a no-holds-barred fight to the death. Kydra Franks, who turns 18 on Election Day, hates the debate and thinks the government is falling apart,

When Kyd's rant against the system goes viral her best friend, a transgender girl named Bianca Faye (Bee for short), uses the sudden notoriety to build her own social profile, accidentally creating a large youth movement in support of Kyd and against the debate. 


The series will be released in short, black and white, digital-only issues, with art by MJ Barros. This campaign is to produce the first 12-page issue.

We're asking for $1200, which will cover the art, lettering and production of the first issue. If we can get to $2500, that will cover the first two issues, which would give us a great head-start on getting through all five issues.

This story is extremely important to me, and I'm incredibly proud of the work I've done on this, as well as the incredible art MJ has already put together, and the work letterer/designer Sean Rinehart has done.
The story explores such varied themes as violence, coming-of-age, friendship, standing up for your beliefs, politics, youth versus establishment, and many others.

This was initially proposed as a graphic novel and an unsuccesful Kickstarter campaign was run. We have since rethought our strategy and done some rewriting to break the book up into more manageable parts (both story-wise and as far as funding is concerned) and we are confident that, once we have the necessary funds, we will have no problems getting these issues out quickly.

We hope you'll contribute and share our project with your friends! Thank you!

story:
STRETCH GOALS!

• $10,000 - Upgrade the comic from saddle stitch to a thicker book, with higher quality pages.

 

• $18,000 - Art contributions from talented artists for the back of the book gallery. 

 

• $32,000 - Another Bum Song.  

 

• $40,000 - Custom Bomber Patches with Every Contribution.

 

• $50,000 - I'll shave my head bald.  

Read REQUIEM OF THE CRAZIES Part 1

 

Requiem of the Crazies tells the story of a man named Dante, who after losing his job and home, is cast out of his mundane life and into the strange underground world of the homeless. Being mentored by a veteran bum named Vernon, our two protagonists begin to uncover a dark reality about the homeless community in which they live. 

IN PART 2 

The true motivation behind the creation of the 'City of Bums' is revealed...    

A corrupt city politician. A dark deal between devilish people. War between drug dealers. 

As the mayor's run for re-election approaches, his secret police begin to infiltrate the homeless community. Every vote counts, and their numbers are high.  The bums are starving, but thankfully charity organizations like SAFE HAVEN provide them with canned food and fresh water.  God bless them! Unfortunately for our protagonist, Dante stumbles upon the truth about safe haven.  About their true motivations and the gut-wrenching ingredients of their canned food...  This is where the true story of Requiem of the Crazies begins. 

I've already begun drawing pages for part 2:

A few pages from part 1:

READ PART 1 HERE

 

My name is Rusty Cage. I’m a musician, artist, beef jerky connoisseur, and YouTuber. I gained notoriety for the “five finger fillet” video I made called “The Knife Game Song”, which helped to launch my career in music (https://rustycage.bandcamp.com/), as well as my youtube channel (https://www.youtube.com/rustycage).  I’m probably best known for making songs and videos that dwell in the realm of insanity, dark themes, and macabre subject matters. 

 

Here's a video of me reviewing the first issue. I'll be printing part 2 the same. 

 

DEPENDING ON YOUR PERK TIER:

All tiers will get a copy of Requiem of the Crazies Issue #2, 35-40 pages, printed on high quality paper. Additional perks include:

• $15 - Copy of Requiem of the Crazies, Issue #2

• $30 - SIGNED copy of RotC #2 + Fold-out 11x17" Poster + Sticker 

• $60 - RotC issues #1 & #2 (signed) + Poster + Sticker

• $100 - RotC #1 & #2 + Poster + Sticker + 5x7" Hand drawn sketch

• $150 - All other rewards + Get your name printed in the back of the comic!

 

 

**PLEASE** PLEASE** PLEASE**

* Double check your shipping address to make sure it is complete and accurate.  This includes apartment number, building number, etc...  

* If you choose to donate and want the perks, do so by actually clicking on the perks.  Last campaign, many people donated to the campaign but didn't actually select a perk, so it didn't show up on the reports. 

* FOR EVERYONE WHO WANTS THEIR NAME IN THE BACK OF THE BOOK, make the name on your contribution the name you want printed in the book.  You don't have to do this for your shipping address, but for your contribution name.  This way I know how you want to be recognized.  THANK YOU.
story_txt:
STRETCH GOALS!

• $10,000 - Upgrade the comic from saddle stitch to a thicker book, with higher quality pages.
 
• $18,000 - Art contributions from talented artists for the back of the book gallery. 
 
• $32,000 - Another Bum Song.  
 
• $40,000 - Custom Bomber Patches with Every Contribution.
 
• $50,000 - I'll shave my head bald.  

Read REQUIEM OF THE CRAZIES Part 1
 

Requiem of the Crazies tells the story of a man named Dante, who after losing his job and home, is cast out of his mundane life and into the strange underground world of the homeless. Being mentored by a veteran bum named Vernon, our two protagonists begin to uncover a dark reality about the homeless community in which they live. 
IN PART 2 
The true motivation behind the creation of the 'City of Bums' is revealed...    
A corrupt city politician. A dark deal between devilish people. War between drug dealers. 
As the mayor's run for re-election approaches, his secret police begin to infiltrate the homeless community. Every vote counts, and their numbers are high.  The bums are starving, but thankfully charity organizations like SAFE HAVEN provide them with canned food and fresh water.  God bless them! Unfortunately for our protagonist, Dante stumbles upon the truth about safe haven.  About their true motivations and the gut-wrenching ingredients of their canned food...  This is where the true story of Requiem of the Crazies begins. 

I've already begun drawing pages for part 2:

A few pages from part 1:




READ PART 1 HERE
 

My name is Rusty Cage. I’m a musician, artist, beef jerky connoisseur, and YouTuber. I gained notoriety for the “five finger fillet” video I made called “The Knife Game Song”, which helped to launch my career in music (https://rustycage.bandcamp.com/), as well as my youtube channel (https://www.youtube.com/rustycage).  I’m probably best known for making songs and videos that dwell in the realm of insanity, dark themes, and macabre subject matters. 


 


Here's a video of me reviewing the first issue. I'll be printing part 2 the same. 


 

DEPENDING ON YOUR PERK TIER:
All tiers will get a copy of Requiem of the Crazies Issue #2, 35-40 pages, printed on high quality paper. Additional perks include:
• $15 - Copy of Requiem of the Crazies, Issue #2
• $30 - SIGNED copy of RotC #2 + Fold-out 11x17" Poster + Sticker 
• $60 - RotC issues #1 & #2 (signed) + Poster + Sticker
• $100 - RotC #1 & #2 + Poster + Sticker + 5x7" Hand drawn sketch
• $150 - All other rewards + Get your name printed in the back of the comic!


 

 

**PLEASE** PLEASE** PLEASE**
* Double check your shipping address to make sure it is complete and accurate.  This includes apartment number, building number, etc...  
* If you choose to donate and want the perks, do so by actually clicking on the perks.  Last campaign, many people donated to the campaign but didn't actually select a perk, so it didn't show up on the reports. 
* FOR EVERYONE WHO WANTS THEIR NAME IN THE BACK OF THE BOOK, make the name on your contribution the name you want printed in the book.  You don't have to do this for your shipping address, but for your contribution name.  This way I know how you want to be recognized.  THANK YOU.

story:
Short Summary

When Universes Collide: Vendetta For Victory "Let The Games Begin"

Two powerful warriors from DC Universe and the world of Dragonball Z have been unleashed upon each other & only one will emerge the victor.


We have been looking to create versus film for a long time and now a lot factors are coming together for us to do one.  Our goal of $500 will be used to cover the costs of costumes.  Of course the more money we are able to put in the project the more energetic this video will be.

Location of the shoot will be around the Middle Georgia area.  It is scheduled to take place around August 2014.  A few things have already been locked down such as locations, costume builders are set and ready to go and fighting coordinator as we have been doing some pre-planning since February.  Therefore we have implemented all of the aspects we could that could be done with no budget.  If we do not meet our goal we continue, but to deliver a completed film we need have funds in place.


Who We Are

In world of film there many people in much bigger places doing this.  However, we just so happen to be located in the middle of nothing shooting short films & feature films.  We are very passionate about the work we are doing and wish to share our work with the world.  Hopefully, we can inspire others to pick up a camera and create a world of their own.


What We Need & What You Get

This is a 100% NON-PROFIT photo shoot/video.  All the people involved in this project are giving their talent and time free of charge.  All funds will directly fund the costumes builds, food, any location fees, accommodation for the actresses and post work.    


The Impact

After completing this and if we have the support we plan to make other versus films.  Perhaps even a sequel to this, but we need your help for that :)


Who's in it?

Here's a few of the talented actors & crew we've already cast! More to come!

Cast

1.

2.



Crew:

Co-Producer, Co-Director, and Writer: Troy Hencely 
Troy studied theatre at Georgia College and State University. Under the tutelage of Karen Berman, Amy Pinney, Eric Griffis, and Beate Czagolla Troy built his stage and film endeavors.  Troy is now the Executive Producer and Director of Meadow Wolf Films. He has produced and directed many Web Series and Short Films. He is also the Artistic Director of Robin and Goodfellow Players, which tours fringe festivals all over the United States. He has written macabre plays which have been performed at many different theatres. His newest will be touring the Summer of 2014.

http://www.troyhencely.com/


Co-Producer & Co-Director: Mista Martel
Mista Martel is an actor and producer.  After seeing his first stage production he the acting bug got a hold of him.   From that point he on he was a part of his high school drama class for four years.   Stage production he has been a part include "A Midsummer Night's Dream" and "Twelve Angry Men."  Setting his sights higher from there he started working on as background on various television and movie sets learning the industry.   One his roles include playing 'Young John' in a production called "Church of Redemption" and "Fighting Angels" where he plays one the main villain in the series.  However, his passion to create as led to produce a few projects such as "The Campaign Game."

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4194518


Fighting Coordinator: Robert S.
Green belt in the Praxis system of martial arts under Cam Mchargue, martial arts instructor for 4 years, parkour coach for 1, 3-4 amateur MMA record. 

http://youtu.be/uYDZ8-peP-s


What You Get

For all of those reasons we have some really great perks for you all!  If you always wanted to be a part of the comic book theme film here’s your chance.  Therefore, no matter what you are fans of comic books, anime or the movies we have perks that will fit anyone.


Equipment We Are Working With

Canon 7D Tascam dr40 I also have a boom mic, tripod, a couple of lenses, green screen, dolly, slider, A couple of wireless mics and RodeVideoMic.  We also have Canon T2I & T3I(Possibly B cam as well)  to capture BTS shots.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can share this page with you family and friends that would be awesome!  Since we need to find as many sources of funding for this project as possible you can help by spreading this link around.  

*THIS IS A NON-PROFIT FAN MADE SHORT FILM, THAT IS IN NO WAY ENDORSED BY WARNER BROTHERS OR DC COMICS, Akira Toriyama, Toei, Shueisha, FUNimation, 20th Century Fox or any of their respective affiliates or licensees.  NOR IS IT INTENDED TO COMPETE WITH ANY EXISTING OR FORTH COMING MATERIAL*

story:
Thank You!

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank all the contributors to the Camus and Simone Bid to Rule the World Campaign. While we didn't we didn't meet our goal, we did manage to extend the life of the webcomic by about 30% to about 130 strips, so you should see more strips in the upcoming  year. For those who donated, we are fervently working on getting the perks out to you, so please bear with us as we struggle to get these out to you, and still produce comic strips. If you have any questions, please contact me through the indiegogo site.  

Also, contributions will still be accepted. Contact me here first, for more info and for availability of certain perks. We can't promise anything but if you're aiming to get a certain perk, it doesn't hurt to ask!

Who Are We?:

Artist DomNX is a graphic artist, illustrator and all around good guy. No matter what his friends say.

What We Need & What You Get:

  • This campaign is to help expose more people to Camus and Simone! It'll go toward advertising, merchandising and possibly bigger projects in the future. Remember, ALL donations are accepted, even if we don't meet our goal and will go toward extending the life of the strip.

  • Part of the funding will go to the perks, but mostly it will go toward art supplies, upgrading our computer programs, and other items needed to create the strip as well as the numerous manhours needed to create this strip for the public! 
    •  
  • As incentive, we're giving away original artwork/comic covers, stickers, buttons, greeting card sets, t-shirts, limited edition sketchbooks, and even a special appearance in a comic strip (what?). Here's a quick breakdown. Write us if you have questions! We'll be posting images of the various items here and on our Facebook page.
  • PERK LIST:
  • $5 - CITY HALL ADMINISTRATOR LEVEL: Thank you on our Facebook page (but really, the cool stuff happens at $20 and up)
  • $10 - CITY COUNCIL MEMBER LEVEL: Downloadable Desktop Wallpaper
  • $25- MAYOR LEVEL: Digital download of a special online .pdf book (content TBA) + everything on the lower donation levels (City Council and City Hall)
  • $35- GOVERNOR LEVEL: High quality vinyl sticker pack. + everything on the lower levels.  (Mayor Level and down)
  • $50- AMBASSADOR LEVEL: Expose your flair! 5 button set of Camus and Simone mini buttons +  everything on the lower donation level (Governor Level and down)
  • $75- SENATOR LEVEL: Greeting Card set of 5 with envelopes to send thank yous, or to mail to convince people who didn't donate + everything on the lower donation levels.
  • $100- PRESIDENTIAL LEVEL: Special Sibling Rivalry Crowdfunding version T-shirt + everything on the lower donation levels.
  • $150- RULER OF AFRICA: Three 6x9 signed (bottom right) prints with sketch on the back of one. Plus, everything on the lower donation levels.
  • $250- RULER OF ASIA: comic variant cover. In 2013, Comic companies print blank covers for artists to draw on at conventions, now you can own original  cartoon superheroes with a comic book to read as well. Because this is original artwork, and 15 different titles, it's a first come first served basis. Tentative list (all 2013 titles): Walking Dead #109, Iron Man #1, Guardians of the Galaxy #1, Batman Detective Comics #20, Superman Action #18, X-men #1, Savage Wolverine #1, Avengers #1, Wonder Woman #18, Batman #0, Justice League #16, Uncanny Avengers #1, Uncanny X-Force #1, Indestructible Hulk #1
  • $1234- RULER OF EUROPE: Signed and Limited edition Camus and Simone Recipe and Sketchbook. Go behind the scenes to learn about the thoughts behind some of the strips. This includes unseen sketches, a "director's cut" of the artwork and changed punchlines not revealed previously. Maybe even an original sketch in the book?
  • $2000- RULER OF AUSTRALIA: Are you considered a character? Would you like to be? The artist will work with you to develop a character named after you with your likeness. (artist gets final say) This gets you a starring role in a minimum of one (1)comic strip with a chance of it being a possible recurring role. You get to keep the black and white original artwork from that intro strip. Suitable for framing or just bragging rights. Plus, everything on the lower donation levels. See description for int'l shipping costs.


SHIPPING INFO: 


For Governor levels to Ruler of Africa: USA (50 states): shipping included, CANADA/MEXICO: add $10 US, everywhere else, please add $20 for shipping.

For Ruler of Asia and higher, please double.

  • For those who think it's a lot, just remember you're getting everything in the lower amount categories as well (while supplies last)

Spread the Word!

If you can't contribute now, please consider retweeting or posting to friends on your favorite social media outlets. Get the word out to fellow fans of Camus and Simone and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools on this page as well!

Aloha and Mahalo!

See description for int'l shipping costs.

Spread the Word!

If you can't contribute now, please consider retweeting or posting to friends on your favorite social media outlets. Get the word out to fellow fans of Camus and Simone and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools on this page as well!
Aloha and Mahalo!

story:
An entertaining giggle-tastic tome! * Brilliantly written! Humour that goes where most dare not tread, and worth every page! * A LOL on every page! * Top notch work!

These were just a handful of the comments I received on my 2009 comic book "Glory Be!" - the refreshingly funny "Christian satire" book that will literally make you LOL (laugh out loud). It's biting humour aimed at everyday (and every Sunday) church folk also extends to everyday secular folk - so nobody is left out in the cold. Glory Be! crosses all boundaries and no matter what you believe, believe me - you'll chortle, guffaw or snigger. Perhaps even a combination of all three.

My Story

My love of comics began back in the 70s. Books like Mr Men, The Munch Bunch and The Blobs all inspired me, so I doodled cartoons for much of my childhood, and at every available opportunity... which was often frowned upon in Maths lessons.

Being skinny and ginger circa 1985 had me at a disadvantage, and I'd often come home from school and cry over the dog. Thankfully my fantasy land got me through. I bought comics by the dozen and found myself enchanted by this fictional wonderland. So I'd create my own characters and lead them on their own zany adventures. Perhaps my proudest moment was winning first prize for a poster I designed in Science (of all lessons). It depicted crazy characters getting up to all sorts of tomfoolery in the classroom, and my teacher thought it could run and run. That day my existence had been justified, and my destiny beckoned.

Today I'm launching the second of my Glory Be! comic books. The reviews of the first book were better than I could have wished for, so writing another was never going to be easy. I'm delighted that I now have an altogether more 'focused' book than the first. In fact it metaphorically rocks. While Glory Be! is certainly not a children's comic, it's no Viz either. Much of the content is far too highbrow, sarcastic, or tongue-in-cheek for younger audiences to understand â€“ which is why it carries the "mature readers" tag. Besides, even if younger readers don't fully appreciate the irony, I'm sure they'll delight in perusing the pictures.

Glory Be! also features the adventures of Norton Mouse, the loveable little rodent with a penchant for purple sweaters and tweeting. He's followed by a wide variety of people, including Jonathan Ross, Phillip Schofield and Lisa Faulkner (to namedrop just a few). In his eponymous(e) comic you'll also get to meet a few of his mousey pals and nephew, Nelson, as they partake in hilarious antics.

So what is Glory Be?

In a nutshell - it's a comic based around a dysfunctional church by the name of Riverdale. Straight away you may hear church bells and assume it's "religious" or "preachy" but it's neither. It's just a book about a modern, charismatic church community and all the characters within that community. Of course like any cartoon it's a distorted, vastly exaggerated representation of real life. So it's also really funny.

We have characters like Judgemental Jonah â€“ who lunges his sword of judgement into his fellow Christians but fails to see his own short-comings, Barry Boaster - who does good deeds, only to boast about it for praise from his fellow man - and Steve O'Grady, a man who wears a sheet over his face because he's too ashamed to be seen as a Christian. Meanwhile, Pastor Peter Loftus endures lots of "face palm" moments as he struggles to lead his Machiavellian and troublesome flock down the narrow path.

Book 2: Chariots of Ire focuses on Riverdale's preparations for the Christian Olympics, but all is not well in camp. There's bickering, in-fighting, personal pride and resentment throughout - and that's before the enemy really sticks its claws in. The enemy being the Satanist church around the corner who plot to derail the Olympics and bring about the downfall of the pesky Christians. Meanwhile Pastor Peter enlists Norton Mouse to be the Riverdale team mascot, but this brings disquiet within the ranks, mostly from Judgemental Jonah, who believes Norton is a "demon" from the ninth circle of hell.

You can pigeon-hole Glory Be! as a "Christian" comic but that's not strictly true. Yes, it has an underlying Christian ethos, but it's mostly about a group of people from all walks of life (who may not even like each other) who are thrown together for a greater good. A non-believer/non-churchgoer would actually garner as much from Glory Be! as a devout Christian. In fact for some Christians, this sails far too close to the wind for their liking. This is church life - warts and all.

There really isn't a comic book out there like Glory Be! We've had comics about the dysfunctional family, workplace, school, etc over the years but none (to my knowledge) that focuses on a church congregation. We've had comedies like "The Vicar of Dibley" and "Rev", but they're different animals altogether.

I believe Glory Be! will open a lot of doors and change peoples perceptions of Christians and church on the whole. Everyday (mostly on Twitter) I read something aimed at Christians which is built upon sheer ignorance. Usually some cringe inducing dross they've seen on TV or a Bible scripture they've glanced at and taken out of all context. I suspect Judgemental Jonah will ruffle lots of feathers, but here's one of those characters who you laugh at and not with. I'm sure people will appreciate the irony...

Glory Be! isn't going to save your soul â€“ and nor will it convert you to atheism. It's simply unconventional (and rather un-PC) entertainment that is designed to make you laugh - or at least chortle.

What I Need & What You Get

I'm aiming to print 2,000 copies of a 68 page "Glory Be! Book 2" which will include a 16 page "Norton Mouse" comic - in total 84 pages. This will cost just over Â£3000 alone. Your money will go directly to the printing costs of this book. Advertising and distribution could cost another Â£1,000, but I will be advertising with great care. I'll also be using my own money for printing/promotion, but if I raise MORE than I need I certainly won't waste it by adding an extra 16 pages of nonsense. Additional funds will rollover to the next book.

So what happens if I don't raise my target?

In this case the page count will just have to decrease, and I'll be spending sleepless nights deliberating over what pages should be left on the bedroom floor. 36 and 48 page editions are also a possibility, it's just that 68 pages have been written. Failure to reach the target may also result in the Norton Mouse comic being put on the back-burner.

As Book 2: Chariots of Ire is based upon the 2012 Olympics, launching it any later than July would be akin to locking the gate once the horse has bolted. Therefore the provisional release date is July 7th 2012, when I will be appearing at the London Film and Comic Con at Olympia (which seems apt). Although I will be taking pre-orders once I know the page count.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've read this far you obviously care enough about this project to want it to succeed - so if funds don't permit please share this page with the world, his wife and the cat on the porch. Share it with your friends, family, and those "friends" on Facebook you never speak to. You can even share it with your enemies.

If you do have a bit of spare cash please check out the perks of donating (to your right) and choose one that works for you. Believe me, your money won't go to waste. Creating comic books is my passion, and has been for most of my life. Nobody in the world wants this to succeed more than I do.

Look at me. I'm 37 years old, single and living with my parents. I've been trying to do this alone for too long and I've suffered for my art. It's cost me time, money, possibly relationships - and that's how much I love doing it, and that's why I'll still be doing it for as long as my mind and body permit. One day all the blood, sweat, tears, frustration and angst will be worth it.

Thank you for your time.

David C Hill
story_txt:
An entertaining giggle-tastic tome! * Brilliantly written! Humour that goes where most dare not tread, and worth every page! * A LOL on every page! * Top notch work! These were just a handful of the comments I received on my 2009 comic book "Glory Be!" - the refreshingly funny "Christian satire" book that will literally make you LOL (laugh out loud). It's biting humour aimed at everyday (and every Sunday) church folk also extends to everyday secular folk - so nobody is left out in the cold. Glory Be! crosses all boundaries and no matter what you believe, believe me - you'll chortle, guffaw or snigger. Perhaps even a combination of all three.


My StoryMy love of comics began back in the 70s. Books like Mr Men, The Munch Bunch and The Blobs all inspired me, so I doodled cartoons for much of my childhood, and at every available opportunity... which was often frowned upon in Maths lessons.Being skinny and ginger circa 1985 had me at a disadvantage, and I'd often come home from school and cry over the dog. Thankfully my fantasy land got me through. I bought comics by the dozen and found myself enchanted by this fictional wonderland. So I'd create my own characters and lead them on their own zany adventures. Perhaps my proudest moment was winning first prize for a poster I designed in Science (of all lessons). It depicted crazy characters getting up to all sorts of tomfoolery in the classroom, and my teacher thought it could run and run. That day my existence had been justified, and my destiny beckoned.Today I'm launching the second of my Glory Be! comic books. The reviews of the first book were better than I could have wished for, so writing another was never going to be easy. I'm delighted that I now have an altogether more 'focused' book than the first. In fact it metaphorically rocks. While Glory Be! is certainly not a children's comic, it's no Viz either. Much of the content is far too highbrow, sarcastic, or tongue-in-cheek for younger audiences to understand â€“ which is why it carries the "mature readers" tag. Besides, even if younger readers don't fully appreciate the irony, I'm sure they'll delight in perusing the pictures.Glory Be! also features the adventures of Norton Mouse, the loveable little rodent with a penchant for purple sweaters and tweeting. He's followed by a wide variety of people, including Jonathan Ross, Phillip Schofield and Lisa Faulkner (to namedrop just a few). In his eponymous(e) comic you'll also get to meet a few of his mousey pals and nephew, Nelson, as they partake in hilarious antics.So what is Glory Be?In a nutshell - it's a comic based around a dysfunctional church by the name of Riverdale. Straight away you may hear church bells and assume it's "religious" or "preachy" but it's neither. It's just a book about a modern, charismatic church community and all the characters within that community. Of course like any cartoon it's a distorted, vastly exaggerated representation of real life. So it's also really funny. We have characters like Judgemental Jonah â€“ who lunges his sword of judgement into his fellow Christians but fails to see his own short-comings, Barry Boaster - who does good deeds, only to boast about it for praise from his fellow man - and Steve O'Grady, a man who wears a sheet over his face because he's too ashamed to be seen as a Christian. Meanwhile, Pastor Peter Loftus endures lots of "face palm" moments as he struggles to lead his Machiavellian and troublesome flock down the narrow path.Book 2: Chariots of Ire focuses on Riverdale's preparations for the Christian Olympics, but all is not well in camp. There's bickering, in-fighting, personal pride and resentment throughout - and that's before the enemy really sticks its claws in. The enemy being the Satanist church around the corner who plot to derail the Olympics and bring about the downfall of the pesky Christians. Meanwhile Pastor Peter enlists Norton Mouse to be the Riverdale team mascot, but this brings disquiet within the ranks, mostly from Judgemental Jonah, who believes Norton is a "demon" from the ninth circle of hell.You can pigeon-hole Glory Be! as a "Christian" comic but that's not strictly true. Yes, it has an underlying Christian ethos, but it's mostly about a group of people from all walks of life (who may not even like each other) who are thrown together for a greater good. A non-believer/non-churchgoer would actually garner as much from Glory Be! as a devout Christian. In fact for some Christians, this sails far too close to the wind for their liking. This is church life - warts and all. There really isn't a comic book out there like Glory Be! We've had comics about the dysfunctional family, workplace, school, etc over the years but none (to my knowledge) that focuses on a church congregation. We've had comedies like "The Vicar of Dibley" and "Rev", but they're different animals altogether. I believe Glory Be! will open a lot of doors and change peoples perceptions of Christians and church on the whole. Everyday (mostly on Twitter) I read something aimed at Christians which is built upon sheer ignorance. Usually some cringe inducing dross they've seen on TV or a Bible scripture they've glanced at and taken out of all context. I suspect Judgemental Jonah will ruffle lots of feathers, but here's one of those characters who you laugh at and not with. I'm sure people will appreciate the irony...Glory Be! isn't going to save your soul â€“ and nor will it convert you to atheism. It's simply unconventional (and rather un-PC) entertainment that is designed to make you laugh - or at least chortle.What I Need & What You GetI'm aiming to print 2,000 copies of a 68 page "Glory Be! Book 2" which will include a 16 page "Norton Mouse" comic - in total 84 pages. This will cost just over Â£3000 alone. Your money will go directly to the printing costs of this book. Advertising and distribution could cost another Â£1,000, but I will be advertising with great care. I'll also be using my own money for printing/promotion, but if I raise MORE than I need I certainly won't waste it by adding an extra 16 pages of nonsense. Additional funds will rollover to the next book.So what happens if I don't raise my target?In this case the page count will just have to decrease, and I'll be spending sleepless nights deliberating over what pages should be left on the bedroom floor. 36 and 48 page editions are also a possibility, it's just that 68 pages have been written. Failure to reach the target may also result in the Norton Mouse comic being put on the back-burner. As Book 2: Chariots of Ire is based upon the 2012 Olympics, launching it any later than July would be akin to locking the gate once the horse has bolted. Therefore the provisional release date is July 7th 2012, when I will be appearing at the London Film and Comic Con at Olympia (which seems apt). Although I will be taking pre-orders once I know the page count.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you've read this far you obviously care enough about this project to want it to succeed - so if funds don't permit please share this page with the world, his wife and the cat on the porch. Share it with your friends, family, and those "friends" on Facebook you never speak to. You can even share it with your enemies.If you do have a bit of spare cash please check out the perks of donating (to your right) and choose one that works for you. Believe me, your money won't go to waste. Creating comic books is my passion, and has been for most of my life. Nobody in the world wants this to succeed more than I do. Look at me. I'm 37 years old, single and living with my parents. I've been trying to do this alone for too long and I've suffered for my art. It's cost me time, money, possibly relationships - and that's how much I love doing it, and that's why I'll still be doing it for as long as my mind and body permit. One day all the blood, sweat, tears, frustration and angst will be worth it. Thank you for your time.David C Hill

story:
Short Summary

Voluntaryist is the tale of a superhuman hero who finds himself pitted against the government as the government tries to enslave humanity once and for all.  He is a young man with extraordinary powers created through a chance encounter with cosmic radiation. His personal mission is to rescue his parents from government agents, but that objective is often frustrated with the likes of giant monsters, super-villains, and even the armed forces.

The comic takes a contemporary look at the question, "What does it mean to be truly free?"

HISTORY: Voluntaryist was created by liberty fanatic and costumer Jamie  Sherman, whose passion for liberty is only matched by his passion for cosplay photography. He began the long process of creating the series while trudging through his graduate studies.

The Voluntaryist comic series was in a prototyping process for 6 years and is now showcasing  the canon origins story. The script for this issue has been written and the characters have been established through several future-verse comic issues available at www.volcomic.com

GOAL: To get the Voluntaryist Origins story fully finished to share with you, and, eventually, the world!

PAGE COUNT: 22 new pages estimated for a 100% funded campaign.

We will produce as much of the comic as we can get funded for! The storyline may set with “to be continued” to tailor to the funding level.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise about $4,500 to get this comic issue's potential fully going.

The expenses are largely for the cost of hiring artists to produce the comic and the expenses associated with putting the comic into print format. 

You can support us by making a contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card or Paypal.

In addition, you can redeem perks for your support such as:

The digital early release ($10)

Prototype Card Game Card ($35)

The signed graphic novel. ($50)

In-comic and mailer advertisement. (Starting at $85)

An action figure in packaging. ($300)

Variant Cover Art Cameo. ($350)

A Voluntaryist supersuit. ($500)

AND MUCH MORE!

LAST PAGE OF THE PREVIOUS VOLUNTARYIST ORIGINS ISSUE:

STRETCH GOALS!

If we raise above funding we will continue working on the story with new pages. Those who support this campaign with physical perk purchases will receive a special print from the next pages creation process. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't have pocket change to spare, you can still help us get the message out by sharing our campaign and sharing our videos on YouTube.

Use the Indiegogo.com share tools to let others know and visit our pages here:

WEBSITE: http://volcomic.com

FACEBOOK: http://www.facebook.com/volcomics

YOUTUBE: http://youtube.com/thevoluntaryists

Share Tweets about the campaign with: #voluntaryist

ALSO! Please make sure you give us your proper address for whatever perk you redeem. If you have any questions, please direct them to Jamie at mr.voluntary@gmail.com. 

And that’s all there is to it. ( :

story:
Pour français, voyez au-dessous.

Por esperanto, vidu sube.

Who am I and what is Scaffold World?

I am an artist and writer.

I've worked as a technical writer and illustrator, and I also have experience with printing and colour management.

So what am I doing with a comic? That's the other side of things. All my life I've drawn. A couple of years ago, Shawn Shepheard saw my introduction to Scaffoldworld and asked me to do a comic for him. These days I'm practising drawing people, and learning to design stories too.

I would like to get my Scaffold World story out into the world. This campaign will give me the resources to build a good story to serve as the heart of the comic, before doing the drawings and printing the books to carry the story out ino the world.

More.
The English Facebook page for Scaffold World

Qui suis-je et qu'est-ce que c'est Monde d'Échafaudage?

Je suis un écrivain et artiste.

J'ai travaillé comme un redacteur technique et illustrateur dans le domaine d'informatique. J'ai aussi travaillé avec l'imprimerie et la gestion des couleurs.

Pourquoi je fais une bande dessinée? C'est l'autre côté de l'affaire. Pendant tout la vie, je dessinais. Il y a quelques ans, Shawn Shepheard a vu mon introduction à la BD "Scaffold World", et il m'a demandé faire une autre BD en anglais pour lui. Maintenant je pratique la dessinage des hommes, et j'apprends concevoir les histoires aussi.

Je veux enlever Monde d'Échafaudage de ses difficultés d'intrigue, et faire une bonne conconclusion pour l'histoire. Cette campagne de publicité me donnerai les ressources pour construire une bonne histoire, faire les dessins et imprimer les livres.

Plus.
La page français Facebook du projet Monde d'Échafaudage

Kiu mi estas kaj kio estas Skafalda Mondo?

Mi estas artisto kaj redaktisto.

Mi laboris kiel aŭtoro kaj desegnisto en la fako de komputiloj, kaj mi ankaŭ laboris je presado kaj la traktado de koloroj.

Do... kion mi faras je komikson? Tiu ĉi estas la alia flanko de la afero. Dum mia tuta vivo, mi desegnis. Antaŭ kelkaj jaroj, Shawn Shepheard vidis mian enkondukon al SkafaldaMondo, kaj li petis min fari komikson angle por li. Nuntempe, mi praktikas desegni homojn, kaj lernas desegni rakontojn.

Mi volus liberi Skafaldan Mondon de ĝiaj rakontintrigaj malfacilaĵoj kaj fini ĝian rakonton bone. Tiu ĉi kampanjo donos al mi la rimedojn por konstrui bonan rakonton, antaŭ mi faros la desegnojn kaj presigos la librojn porti la rakonton en la mondon.

Pli.
La esperanta Facebook-pago de Skafalda Mondo

story:
Life is fucking hard.  I have a job, a great girlfriend, and I do my best to contribute to the community.  Unfortunately my own sense of self worth isn't enough anymore.   No, I've decided I cannot be happy unless I also have your money.   I know what you are thinking, why give me your money?   Well, think about it.   There are at least a billion worse ways you could use it.   I know you can think of at least one.

So hopefully you will give me money so that I can have more money than that at least one other thing you are thinking of.   If you don't give me money, that's fine.  But you should. 

What I hope to bring to this project is an extreme sense of entitlement.   In a nutshell, your money is rightfully mine to just waste.   Perhaps I will throw  it in a toilet, or burn it.  Perhaps I will use the money to hire somebody else who claims to want your money to come to your house and clean your gutters or remove some spray paint or something. 

On second thought, no.   That would be providing gainful employment for somebody which is the opposite of wasting your money.   So that's out. 

Maybe I'll use it to throw a free event for people. 

Hm, no,   Then you'd just be giving me money for something you would enjoy later on.   Basically you would be exchanging money for services which is basically like hiring me to throw an event.  So that's out , because that isnt exactly a complete waste of money.

Maybe I'll "make it rain" off the Space Needle, or out of a helicopter.

Oh, and by the way, fuck your potato salad.

story:
Update, 20-04-2013

Hey! The remainder of the print run (a couple hundred books) is now for sale at

http://www.jaybird-comic.com 

The books ended up being rather big, 12 by 8.7 inches. I don't think there is a single page where I'm not happy with the print quality. The printer, Jelgavas tipogrāfija did their job really well!

Update, 02-01-2013

We've reached the goal, just hours before the deadline. Phew! Thank you everyone! You are awesome! Now, it'll take a couple of weeks to get the books to print, and then two more for printing. So everyone who ordered a book can expect theirs sometime in march. 

After the books have shipped, the comic book will be for sale on www.jaybird-comic.com

Thank you again for making this possible. 

 

Background

Hello, my name is Lauri Ahonen. I'm an illustrator from Finland. Me and my brother Jaakko made a comic book, "Jaybird", that tells the story of a very small and very scared little bird, who lives alone in a great big house with his mother. He's never been outside the house, and won't, as long as his mother has a say about it. 

 

 

The comic

You can read the first 60 pages of the comic here: http://www.jaybird-comic.com

What's unusual about this comic book is that it's nearly silent. There are a few lines of dialogue, but mostly the narrative relies on images. It is our first comic book, and we're pretty excited about it. 

 

 

Printing the book

We're doing this project on indiegogo to fund a print run of 1500 copies. The run will be printed and distributed in north america, and is intended for american audiences. 

The price estimate for printing is $10,500, and it's based on the average of two price quotes from separate printers. We estimate the costs for storage and distribution to be around $500. The book will be shipped directly to the Amazon Fulfillment central warehouse, and distributed from there.

 

 

Perks!

For $1, you'll get a digital wallpaper of the Bad Birds (as seen above). Any image ratio or monitor resolution will be available. 

$5 will get you the contents of the book in an easy to read .pdf file. And the digital wallpaper.

 

 

And $15 will get you 20 choice strips from an earlier comic of mine, dr. badger (sample above). These aren't and won't be made available anywhere else. Also, you'll get all of the above.

 

For $40 you will get the hardcover book (6x9 in, or possibly slightly larger). The book will have 128 full color pages and your name recognized as a backer. You'll get the other perks mentioned above, as well. 

The $100 perk will get you any page of the book you want as a signed, medium-sized (16.5x11.7in) poster. Just pick a page (or spread) in the .pdf file, and I'll get on it. And you'll get the book, the strip comic, the .pdf and the wallpaper as well.

 

The biggest, $250 perk is quite unique - you'll get a portrait of yourself as a Jaybird, and the portrait will be included in the actual comic as a painting on the wall of the Jaybirds house. I will need a photo of you to paint your likeness. This option will of course include all the rewards of the other perks.

 

Update, 05-10-2012

Wow! More than a thousand dollars on the first day! I'm speechless. You guys rock.

Also, I noticed that I hadn't included shipping information in the perks. Yikes! So, if you are not in the United States and had already claimed any of the following perks: "The Jaybird comic book", "Poster of your choice" or "Your portrait, in the comic", you'll get free shipping for them. My bad. 

I edited the relevant perks to include a reminder to add $10 for shipping if you're outside the US.
