story:
Short Summary

I am a powerlifter who used to weigh 500lbs. I lost all of my weight through powerlifting and MMA.  This is something fun that I can do for everyone in the fitocracy community that I love so much.

I want to show people that no matter what you face in life you can make a change and power through almost anything.

My friend will dress up like ash.. when he cannot deadlift the weight he will throw his pokeball and thus.. I will come in.

What We Need & What You Get

Materials for costumes, Time at the gym where I will not bother anyone, and editing of the video.

 

You get a video that is just going to be epic and hilarious at the same time.

The Impact

This will just be a fun fitness related video that will make people laugh, hopefully it can show people that fitness is not always super serious and there will be times where it's also incredibly fun.

Other Ways You Can Help

Send materials, make a custome?  anything really.
story_txt:
Short Summary
I am a powerlifter who used to weigh 500lbs. I lost all of my weight through powerlifting and MMA.  This is something fun that I can do for everyone in the fitocracy community that I love so much.
I want to show people that no matter what you face in life you can make a change and power through almost anything.
My friend will dress up like ash.. when he cannot deadlift the weight he will throw his pokeball and thus.. I will come in.


What We Need & What You Get
Materials for costumes, Time at the gym where I will not bother anyone, and editing of the video.
 
You get a video that is just going to be epic and hilarious at the same time.


The Impact
This will just be a fun fitness related video that will make people laugh, hopefully it can show people that fitness is not always super serious and there will be times where it's also incredibly fun.


Other Ways You Can Help
Send materials, make a custome?  anything really.

story:
The Contraptor #2 is ready to launch!!! We had such a successful "The Contraptor #1" that we decided to make this a "presale" campaign. It's to get the supporters of issue #1 the same customer service and love from the LFDF Comics team. This way, you can continue reading our book while having the convenience of home delivery!!!

The Contraptor #2 continues the story of Gideon Fisher as he searches for his brothers killer in 1890's steampunk society. Watch as he fights his way out of the most dangerous guild in Europe... The Marms of Phoenix Ridge!!!

This issue get's more exciting as pages flip and this issue will introduce 2 main characters that will change EVERYTHING!!!

We are asking for $500 because the production and shipping cost about $350 and the rest will go to promotions and...well, pizza!

This is a project that is close to my heart. It's the first book to come from LFDF Comics and I get to work with friends (Jeremy Lassner, Richard King, and the ACC Artists here in LV).

Please support our project by finding the level that fits your needs and budget!!! If you can't support us by pledging to a perks level then PLEASE tell a few friends...

THANK YOU EVERYONE!!!

story:
About the show

'Introducing...The Dung Beatles' is a musical sketch show following Adam and Scott’s epic journey through the music industry. As the two reflect on their questionable back catalogue - the songs, the controversies, the frequent break ups - we try to see beyond the smut to their incredibly well-hidden genius.

We'll be on daily 21:20-22:20 6th-17th of August (except 11th) at Silk Nightclub | Fringe Venue 444! 

What We Need & What You Get

While we've been accepted to PBH's Free Fringe, the Edinburgh Fringe is anything but free! We'll need as much support as possible to help with our travel, accommodation, flyers and living costs while we're up at the festival.

As well as demonstrably proving what excellent human beings you are, the more you donate entitles you to the increasingly awesome perks (to your right). Give £50+ and we'll even write a song for you! 

Risks & Challenges

We anticipate avoiding Sir Paul McCartney and Ringo Starr's lawyers for 2 weeks will be a huge obstacle - your money can help secure us a blanket and/or a box in which to hide as they scour the surrounding area. 

About us

Variously described over numerous events in Bath and Bristol as 'hilarious' (Milk Magazine) and 'I particularly enjoyed the Dung...What?...Beatles' (The Mayor of Bath), The Dung Beatles are excited to be debuting their first Edinburgh Show. Catch an early Dung Beatles gig here at Komedia, Bath.

Adam Way, Scott Wilson and Ros Beeson are all Idle Playthings graduates and still being silly on stage with The VA (a Bristol-based sketch and improv troupe). Catch a bit of their work here!

Oh, and money can't buy me love isn't the only way you can help! Please do like / follow our social media pages and help spread the word!


The Dung Beatles Fan Page

@TheDungBeatles

story:
What is Fallen?

Fallen is a 22 page, full colour issue that will be part of an ongoing series. Fallen's first print will be standard American sized comic format on high quality paper.  Fallen will blend the genres of mystery, thriller and fantasy by creating a thrilling mythological detective story. The story takes place in the vibrant, synth-pop filled era of the 1980's in the loud, crowded streets of New York City. Created and written by myself, and art done by Henry Ponciano ( Alterna Comics Tinsel Town, The Devil Within, Seven Legions), and lettered by Toben Racicot.

 

Who Will Like Fallen?

If you like any of these things, you're going to love Fallen;

80's Pop Culture - Fallen is inspired by and infused with a lot of the 80's classics from music,  movies and style. 

Mythology - Doesn't matter if you're a fan of Greek, Norse or any other mythology, Fallen is going to touch on it all.

Crime Thriller - If you're intrigued by stories of crime, murder and mystery. It's like if a mash up of John Wick and Clash of the Titans.

Fallen is inspired by neo-noire stories like Blade Runner, Blade Runner 2049 and fantasy stories like Fables and The Wolf Among Us.


 

So what's the story? Here's a little Teaser;

Over a millennia ago, gods spanning from many different ancient religions were cast down to Earth from their ethereal realms in an event they called The Descent. Cut off from many their divine powers and their godly kin, they walked the world as immortals. The Greek, Norse , Shinto, and Aztec gods maintained a tenuous alliance for many years before descending into conflict. Eventually a ceasefire was reached and rules were set in place to prevent another conflict. One of the primary rules was that the gods could no longer directly influence the mortal world but many found a workaround. Several gods chose wards, a human that they bestowed with vigor, immortality so that the ward could do their bidding in the world without drawing attention to the gods.

Flash forward to 1986’s New York City, the divine clans of the gods have become crime families controlling the lawless underworld. When Zeus is murdered at the hands of a mysterious killer. Casper Clay, Zeus’ ward and ancient soldier turned private detective must find the answers. Who killed Zeus and how did they kill a god? Casper will have to navigate those same lawless underworlds he was once part of but this time without the support of the Olympian family behind him. As he gets closer to the truth, he learns that there may be more at stake than finding justice for Zeus, the realms of man and god may hang in the balance. 


 

The Team

Matt: Creator and Writer of Fallen. Matt has been working on the concept for the story for over 2 years. It was originally developed for a comic format and then  considered making it a novel. As Matt continued writing, the imagery that he wanted to convey would only be given justice in the colourful pages of a comic. In his off time, Matt plays D&D and co-hosts a podcast called Nerdium. 

Henry: Henry is a talented and professional artist based out of the Philippines. He is a published Graphic Novel Artist on books like Children's Vampire Hunting Brigade volume 1&2, Alterna Comics Tinsel Town, The Devil Within, Seven Legions and various contributions on anthologies. To see more of his work visit:  https://www.artstation.com/henryponciano 

Toben:  Toben Racicot writes and letters comics. He’s worked on Beastlands The Wild Cosmos, Thorn Squadron, Menagerie, and Rumble Kings. Together with his wife, Alaire Racicot they created Crown & Anchor, the fantasy sci-fi pirate adventure. He also runs multiple Dungeons & Dragons campaigns and continues the hunt in Bloodborne, and is taking parenting lessons from Kratos as he plays God of War (2018). He’s also working on a PhD in Role Playing Games and Adaptation Theory at the University of Waterloo. To see more of his work visit: artstation.com/letterdrone 

Timelines

Here is the projected timeline for the project;

Kickstarter Campaign: July 9th- August 7th

Kickstarter funds received: August 21st

Artwork completed: Mid-October

Book manufacturing and freight: November

Shipping of rewards: Early December

Risks and challenges

The project is already 160% funded! The script is 100% complete and the artwork is over 25% completed. My artist and letterer is eagerly awaiting their funds to finish up. This is my first campaign so the only real wild card is the shipping costs. Whatever short comings from the budget will be made up out of pocket to ensure everyone gets their copies!

story:
Hello

Welcome to the Phuzzy Comics fundraiser!

Phuzzy Comics is a slice of life webcomic overflowing with vibrant colors and eccentric characters. The comics are about video games, friendships, college life, and fun drinking times. You can read it all online at phuzzycomics.monicaray.com! This is a fundraiser to put the classic gags, currently only found online, into a neat little book.

The theme of this book is growth, and anyone who's seen the first Phuzzy Comics knows how far the art has come since the comic began in 2007. This book will be a handheld time capsule of all the small changes over the years that lead to the most current style.

Seriously

2007

2013

What is this all for

The funds will be paying for the print run of 200 full-color books, some extra mini comics, and original prints.

The majority of the old comics will be touched up for print, original posters will be made, commissions will be drawn, and special exclusive mini comics will be printed that you can only get HERE or at TCAF! 

 The Stuff

*For international orders, I will need to sort out the additional shipping costs via email!

The Book

Around 130 pages of your classic Phuzzy Comics in full color. You get the full experience of charting my progress through the years as the comics evolve from dirty Photoshop chicken scratches to the pristine chicken scratches you see today.

The Prints

Three original 8.5 x 11 prints.

Balloons

The Anime Wolf Returns

Third Print (it's a surprise)

 

The Mini Comics

Totally new content. Not Phuzzy Comics related, these mini comics are from another comic series I’d like to resume someday. Redone in Manga Studio with full color, Animania makes a return as 13 glorified mini comics!

 

Commissions

I am offering a limited amount of Black/White and color commissions in addition to the entire swag package for this fundraiser. They will be digital and 100% specially handcrafted for you!

Black and White Commission

 

Color Commission

In Conclusion

If you like Phuzzy Comics and have always wanted them to adorn your bookshelf, you've come to the right place!

story:
What was this all about?

I’m Michael Jantze. I’ve worked in animation, journalism and publishing, but I’m probably known most for my comic strip “The Norm”.

“Knocked Out Loaded” is (now) finished, folks!

In 2013, I asked for contributions to fund my effort to finish a full-color ebook/book "Knocked Out Loaded" (KOL), contributors came through with early donations for KNOCKED OUT LOADED with process pages as well as Norm-related sketches from other professionals and young professionals.

Who’s on board, you ask? Sergio Aragones, Jim Borgman, Chris Eliopoulos, Norman Feuti, Paul Gilligan, Rick Kirkman, Kelly McNutt, Joe Murray, Mark Parisi, Lincoln Peirce, Jerry Scott, and many more!

The campaign also helped reboot the comic strip weekly on GoComics.com/jantze. And sometimes I turn them into Comic Readeos:

Here's how far we got on the stretch goals in 2013: 365% funded! 

 

Perk details and INTL shipping

Perks will be delivered as described in the perk descriptions. For those of you living outside the United States, $10 for Canada and $15 for all other countries will be added at check out.

 

Your Impact

Here's how your contribution made a difference in 2013:

  • Allow me the time this year to finish this book: Editing, drawing, design, fulfilling orders.
  • Allow me the resources and people needed to make this ebook (iBookstore, Kindle, Comixology and Nook editions) and make the print edition a real piece of art.
  • Get me focused on writing and creating -- I've spent the last nine years helping make others' work fantastic, now I want to finish my own work!
  • Put "The Norm" back in your hands -- as an ebook and a print book. And with the stretch goals...put "The Norm" comic in your life again...weekly! WHICH YOU DID! THANK YOU!

 

Other Ways To Help

If you can’t contribute, you can still help me:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about my campaign and rewards.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to link up with your social media friends.
  • Donate time or services.

 

The Stretch Goals Are Here!

Thank you so much. I’m so excited and humbled that so many people have helped me... 

STRETCH GOAL NO. 1: BIGGER, UNCUT AND LOADED
UNLOCKED! The first stretch goal raised an extra $3,500 for a total of $11,000 to expand the KOL book and ebook. Along with the book you'll receive an ebook titled “Be Do Have” on how to be successful AND happy at anything you do in life. You're going to really dig it. The money for this stretch goal will go to supplies, shipping, design fees and printing fees.

STRETCH GOAL NO. 2: BACK IN THE SADDLE
UNLOCKED! ($23K total) unlocked  “The Norm” strips weekly and an ebook “Our Comics Future” and a short ebook of "Sketches and Process". The money for this stretch goal will pay to reboot the website and update any code, replace aging equipment, and design and coloring expenses. I start on August 12, 2013 ... the 17th anniversary of when THE NORM started in newspapers! Here's a YouTube video of me working on the first new comic: http://youtu.be/LbXNX3Fywxo

STRETCH GOAL NO. 3: THE BIG KANORMA
Beyond $23K, extra monies will be used to color "The Norm" comic strip archive. This helps you -- how? Oh yeah, that's right...as we finish coloring a set of strips you will receive a free eBook of those strips. One after another...we're promising at least 9 ebooks! 
If we raise an additional $35,000 for a grand total of $58,000 I will color all THE NORM daily strips EVER.  

"The Color of Norm" would go like this:
$1,000 - ($24K total) I'll color "The Norm" strips about holidays and unlock The Holidaze" ebook
$2,500- ($25.5K total) I'll color strips with Boy Norm in them and unlock “Boy Norm: Full Mental Jacket” ebook
$4,000 - Chris strips with Chris the Wookiee and unlock “Night of the Wookiee" in full color for the first time! ($27K)

AND THESE WILL BE USED FOR A NEW CAMPAIGN IN THE FUTURE!
$7,500- Unlock “My Friend Reine” the year of strips where Norm and Reine fell in love ($30.5K)
$9,000 - Unlock “The X-GFs: Mistakes Were Made” ($32K)
$12,000 - Unlock “Wonk Me Up” ($35K)
$15,000 - Unlock “He-folks and She-folks” ($38K)
$20,000 - Unlock “Ford: Understanding the Bro Code” ($43K)
$35,000 - Unlock “The Color of Norm:The Boxed eBook Collection” ($58K)

If we unlock all of them, you’ll get ALL nine years of the "The Norm" (and "Knocked Out Loaded", of course), including Sundays, as an ebook collection.

The contributions will be used to pay colorists as well as a designer to collect and assemble the ebooks. eBooks will be ready as they're finished, probably well into 2014. A schedule will be created once the book is finished (early 2014).

 

A Bit of History of my graphic novel

“Knocked Out Loaded” is a story I pitched and sold to DC Comics in 1990 -- along with another graphic novel titled “Rave On” -- but when DC went through a rough patch in the early 1990’s, I retreived my rights and we parted ways. KOL sat in a file folder until 2006 when I decided to make it a storyline for “The Norm”.

Ten months and 250 strips into "Knocked Out Loaded", life imitated art when my wife was diagnosed with breast cancer, beginning a journey so many women and their families are familiar with. In 2009, my wife and I decided to give her a break to heal properly and I accepted a position teaching at the Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD).

My wife  is now healthy and we’re back to the norm again. Ha. (see what I did there?).

I want to finish this book this year and I’ve cleared the decks to do it -- I resigned from teaching, I'm not consulting with any companies and I'll get back to writing comics -- but I need your help.

I want to raise money to fund not only the production of the ebook, but also the design and production of a limited edition print book.

Original pitch video is here (yes, it's still embarrassing): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Waunv_zHYRM 

 

What's Cool About This Project

First off, "Knocked Out Loaded" is 80% done...

In 2007 I published "Knocked Out Loaded" to jantze.com five days a week as a color daily comic strip; I wrote it daily with only an outline and theme in mind. In other words, I let the characters take the story where they felt it should go, knowing only where everyone needed to meet at the end of the story. Kind of like jazz or improv.

Another way to describe the process is I wrote a long-form story using short-form techniques. Each three strips make up a page in the book. And each six strips make up a layout in a book spread. In 1989 the presumptive 20-something version of me called it a comic art novel...because it was meant to be a mix of the comics and the novel forms.

“Knocked Out Loaded” is about fear. After his wife’s miscarriage, Norm doesn’t want to move forward, he’s afraid of anything new. He’s stuck in his life, his relationships, his job. So he runs away from it all for a day of skiing, where he’s knocked out loaded. Literally. Short-term memory loss. So when Norm stumbles back to his life, love and job with no strings attached, man, does it drive everyone nuts! "Knocked Out Loaded" is about the fear to grow up, grow strong, grow wise and, ultimately, grow old.

What Will The Funds Be Used For?

Here's a breakdown in more detail, the first two items will be the bulk of my expenses:

  • Pay for eBook production.
  • Pay for the exclusive Indiegogo print book -- a FULL COLOR softback with French folded covers. It will be an objet d'art.
  • Pay for shipping and shipping materials.
  • Pay for any production and design needs above my own expertise.
  • Finish drawing, inking, coloring more than 50 new strips to augment the story.
  • Pay any and all Indiegogo, Paypal and other partner fees

The funds will NOT be used for lifestyle purchases (I pay for my own coffee, etc.). So share and contribute and know your donation will make the world a better place to laugh in.

Thank you for contributing for the "Knocked Out Loaded" book. I'm blown away with your generosity and kindness.

Do what Norm would do...come on, tell all your friends!

– Michael Jantze
Jantze.com

The Norm™: It's a Serious World, Someone Has To Make Fun Of It!

You're going to really dig it. The money for this stretch goal will go to supplies, shipping, design fees and printing fees.STRETCH GOAL NO. 2: BACK IN THE SADDLEUNLOCKED! ($23K total) unlocked  “The Norm” strips weekly and an ebook “Our Comics Future” and a short ebook of "Sketches and Process". The money for this stretch goal will pay to reboot the website and update any code, replace aging equipment, and design and coloring expenses. I start on August 12, 2013 ... the 17th anniversary of when THE NORM started in newspapers! Here's a YouTube video of me working on the first new comic: http://youtu.be/LbXNX3FywxoSTRETCH GOAL NO. 3: THE BIG KANORMABeyond $23K, extra monies will be used to color "The Norm" comic strip archive. This helps you -- how? Oh yeah, that's right...as we finish coloring a set of strips you will receive a free eBook of those strips. One after another...we're promising at least 9 ebooks! If we raise an additional $35,000 for a grand total of $58,000 I will color all THE NORM daily strips EVER.  "The Color of Norm" would go like this:$1,000 - ($24K total) I'll color "The Norm" strips about holidays and unlock The Holidaze" ebook$2,500- ($25.5K total) I'll color strips with Boy Norm in them and unlock “Boy Norm: Full Mental Jacket” ebook$4,000 - Chris strips with Chris the Wookiee and unlock “Night of the Wookiee" in full color for the first time! ($27K)AND THESE WILL BE USED FOR A NEW CAMPAIGN IN THE FUTURE!$7,500- Unlock “My Friend Reine” the year of strips where Norm and Reine fell in love ($30.5K)$9,000 - Unlock “The X-GFs: Mistakes Were Made” ($32K)$12,000 - Unlock “Wonk Me Up” ($35K)$15,000 - Unlock “He-folks and She-folks” ($38K)$20,000 - Unlock “Ford: Understanding the Bro Code” ($43K)$35,000 - Unlock “The Color of Norm:The Boxed eBook Collection” ($58K)If we unlock all of them, you’ll get ALL nine years of the "The Norm" (and "Knocked Out Loaded", of course), including Sundays, as an ebook collection.The contributions will be used to pay colorists as well as a designer to collect and assemble the ebooks. eBooks will be ready as they're finished, probably well into 2014. A schedule will be created once the book is finished (early 2014). A Bit of History of my graphic novel“Knocked Out Loaded” is a story I pitched and sold to DC Comics in 1990 -- along with another graphic novel titled “Rave On” -- but when DC went through a rough patch in the early 1990’s, I retreived my rights and we parted ways. KOL sat in a file folder until 2006 when I decided to make it a storyline for “The Norm”.Ten months and 250 strips into "Knocked Out Loaded", life imitated art when my wife was diagnosed with breast cancer, beginning a journey so many women and their families are familiar with. In 2009, my wife and I decided to give her a break to heal properly and I accepted a position teaching at the Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD).My wife  is now healthy and we’re back to the norm again. Ha. (see what I did there?).I want to finish this book this year and I’ve cleared the decks to do it -- I resigned from teaching, I'm not consulting with any companies and I'll get back to writing comics -- but I need your help.I want to raise money to fund not only the production of the ebook, but also the design and production of a limited edition print book.Original pitch video is here (yes, it's still embarrassing): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Waunv_zHYRM  What's Cool About This ProjectFirst off, "Knocked Out Loaded" is 80% done...In 2007 I published "Knocked Out Loaded" to jantze.com five days a week as a color daily comic strip; I wrote it daily with only an outline and theme in mind. In other words, I let the characters take the story where they felt it should go, knowing only where everyone needed to meet at the end of the story. Kind of like jazz or improv.Another way to describe the process is I wrote a long-form story using short-form techniques. Each three strips make up a page in the book. And each six strips make up a layout in a book spread. In 1989 the presumptive 20-something version of me called it a comic art novel...because it was meant to be a mix of the comics and the novel forms.“Knocked Out Loaded” is about fear. After his wife’s miscarriage, Norm doesn’t want to move forward, he’s afraid of anything new. He’s stuck in his life, his relationships, his job. So he runs away from it all for a day of skiing, where he’s knocked out loaded. Literally. Short-term memory loss. So when Norm stumbles back to his life, love and job with no strings attached, man, does it drive everyone nuts! "Knocked Out Loaded" is about the fear to grow up, grow strong, grow wise and, ultimately, grow old.What Will The Funds Be Used For?Here's a breakdown in more detail, the first two items will be the bulk of my expenses:
Pay for eBook production.
Pay for the exclusive Indiegogo print book -- a FULL COLOR softback with French folded covers. It will be an objet d'art.
Pay for shipping and shipping materials.
Pay for any production and design needs above my own expertise.
Finish drawing, inking, coloring more than 50 new strips to augment the story.
Pay any and all Indiegogo, Paypal and other partner fees
The funds will NOT be used for lifestyle purchases (I pay for my own coffee, etc.). So share and contribute and know your donation will make the world a better place to laugh in.Thank you for contributing for the "Knocked Out Loaded" book. I'm blown away with your generosity and kindness. Do what Norm would do...come on, tell all your friends!– Michael JantzeJantze.comThe Norm™: It's a Serious World, Someone Has To Make Fun Of It!

story:
My Story

Hi, my name is Igor Noronha and I'm a comic book artist and animator. I was born in Brazil, and I came to Denmark about two and a half years ago to study life drawing. I decided to stay here in the environment of this school and started a company, the animation and comics studio Amazu.tv (former Tlob Studios).

 

I have started the Light Apprentice project as a graduation project back in Brazil, and I took it here with me to develop it further. Right now, you can see the first animated episode on the website, as well as read the four first chapters of the comic, all for free.

 

My policy is to let the content for free on the website for anyone, from anywhere, to enjoy it (I'm planning on translating the comic to Portuguese, Spanish and French in the future).

 

But unfortunately, to make this kind of work costs me an incredible amount of time, and I'd like to make this my main source of income, so I can release new chapters ona regular basis, like every month. And not every six months, as it has been so far.

 

What I Need & What You Get

The money will basically go to pay my bills. $500 is my rent for December, so at least I have a place to sleep, but the full cost of my monthly living (including food, materials for the comic, etc) is $2000. The close to this amount I get, the more love I can put into the comic. I'm being sincere here and I'm not shy about it, as it's the only way I found to deliver the comic soon without having to worry about the financial side of my private life.

 

If the goal isn't reached on time, I'll probably have to work on someting else than the comic to pay the bills and you'll only be able to read it in March or April 2011, at least, depending on how difficult it will be to find work (this is how things are and how it's been with the other chapters, unfortunately). Even if the goal isn't reached, all the money will be used to help me pay my bills to develop the comic.

 

If you like my work and believe it can go somewhere, please support this project. I think not only you, but all the fans the comic has gathered since the first time I published it on the web in 2008 deserve a regular release of the chapters and I'm very eager to continue the story. I still have a lot to tell.

 

- If you donate $5 or $10, you'll have your name on the (upcoming) "credits" section on the website and Facebook wall.

 

- If you donate $30, you get the above and an issue of the first colllected volume of the comic (chapters 1 to 3) and Facebook wall.

 

- If you donate $50, you get an autographed comic instead (shipping included), plus your name on the website and Facebook wall.

 

 - If you donate $70, you get an autographed comic (shipping included), plus a sketch of any one character you like! (plus your name on the website and Facebook wall)

 

- If you donate $125, you can create a character (or use one of your own) that will appear on the background in chapter 5, when Nate & Co. go to a carnival festival. Your character will be there forever! (plus your name on the website and Facebook wall)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate or you'd like to do even more, you can spread the word on Facebook (www.facebook.com/lightapprentice) or Twitter (if you'd like to follow me, I'm @iggynore).

And whatever else you can think of ;D

 

Thank you all!

story:
A Comic, A Passion, and a Dream to Make it Happen

Hello!  It’s very nice to meet you!  My name is Casey Knoll, and I’m an indie comic book creator, who’s working to try and go professional.  Ever since I could pick up a pencil, I’ve been drawing pictures and writing stories, in the hopes that someday, I could publish one of my very own. Comic books became the perfect outlet for both of my passions, and today, I’m working to make my dream come true.  I was always bullied at school, and found it hard to make friends; people thought I was weird for getting lost in my imagination. But comics, and the superheroes and adventures within them greatly comforted me, teaching me lessons of friendship and to see the good in people.  So I now hope that my own comics can help others the same way they helped me.

You can see my artwork portfolio here--> http://kartoon12.deviantart.com/

And “Jamie Jupiter” is currently a webcomic here--> http://jamiejupiter.thecomicseries.com/

And be sure to check out the gallery HERE, for plenty of preview images and videos!

So what is “Jamie Jupiter” about? Well, without spoiling too much, it's basically about an alien space cop disguised as a human high school student. Only two of the students know her true identity, and now the trio must defend the Earth from alien invaders.  A good portion of it was inspired by Star Trek, magical girl anime, and “high school drama mixed with sci-fi” series like Smallville. Batman: The Animated Series and The Powerpuff Girls were the two shows that inspired me to become an artist, so if any of these genres interest you, I think this book will be a nice treat.

(This comic is rated/suggested for audiences 10 years and up for mild swearing and violence.)

As of right now, I'm doing EVERYTHING. The writing, character development, drawing, coloring; it's all me. I've got five major story arcs planned for this series, and I think, no matter what, I'm going to see this story through to the very end. I'd love for it to do very well, and I'm working to get it published, in any and all forms. So every night, I pray and thank all the higher powers that be that I've gotten as far as I have, and pray to continue to help me in the future. And of course, I've got to thank all the fans, their critiques and support, and the lovely fan art I've gotten. A book is nothing without the fans.

So really, what I’d like to achieve is to eventually have the entire series printed, and be able to sell the book at conventions.  But that’s a BIG goal. So for now, I just work on tiny goals like this.  Just being able to see the first issue at a convention table, and selling it to fans would be a dream come true.  And it can only happen with YOUR help!

 

The Nitty Gritty

Okay, so on to the question you’re asking: where’s the money going?

This campaign is to help fund the short print run of the first trade paperback of “Jamie Jupiter”. Contained within 70, full color pages, are issues one and two, which serve as the two part “pilot episode” of the series.

I initially only had a small goal of $200, but IndieGoGo has a minimum of $500 to start a campaign, so really, if I could at least reach $200, that’d be great, and I would be forever thankful.  And every single penny goes strictly for the printing and convention table costs.  I was hoping to get at least 10 copies printed, but that might change depending on how well this campaign goes.

As for perks, you can see all of them listed right on the right hand side of your screen.  From sketches to wearable buttons/pins, I’ll draw/create anything you request of me, in the cartoony style many people have come to know me for.  And plus, what’s better than reading a good comic or book in your hands, in a comfy chair, rather than a glaring computer screen?

Also, thanks to critiques and suggestions from my comic’s watchers, I went back and fixed a lot of the old artwork, so the print version you’ll be seeing will have much more updated artwork compared to the original version on the website.  And when the next episodes go to print, you can have a chance to have your name included in the credits, as a big thank you for supporting me!

As for possible stretch goals, it’s hard to say for right now. But you can be assured that the more funds that are collected, the more bonus artwork and perks I can provide in future campaigns.

And even if the $500 goal isn’t reached, that’s okay. Every little bit is still going to help this book come to convention circuits.

The Impact

So what difference does this all make?

Well, this whole comic-making business has been nothing but one big learning experience, and I've met so many funny and kind people that I never would have met otherwise.  And other people have been coming to me for advice, saying they have their own stories they want to publish, and asking what should they do. I’m still very much in a beginner’s shoes, but it makes me so happy that my own dream is aspiring others to achieve theirs too.

I know I'm not writing Shakespeare, but I try my hardest to make a decent story with entertaining characters. If the readers come out of an episode liking/loving the characters, or learned some kind of lesson, or are just excited to want to know what happens next, then I've succeeded. More than anything, I just want the audience to get enjoyment out of reading an adventure. If I can make even one person happy, then I'm happy.

I think if you dig deeper, "JJ" has an underlying theme of discovering your true self, doing things you never thought you could before, and just trying to be a decent person. Pretty much all the characters have issues with either bullies, or their own self esteem, or both, but the trio of main characters eventually find companionship in one another. If there's one thing I want the readers to take away from all this, it's to never let bullies and mean words get to you, and to never give up on your dreams. If you just be a good person, and more importantly, just BE YOURSELF, you'll find people who are just like you, and are going through the same hardships as you. Don't be afraid to let the light inside you shine!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate? That’s perfectly okay. If you can, you can still be a big help by simply spreading the word! Tell your friends! Your family! Have pages on Facebook? DeviantArt? YouTube? Tumblr? Tell everyone there too! The more people who know, the better!  And do you have a page here on IndieGoGo? Be sure to use the share tools too!

And most of all, thanks everyone!!!  I can’t wait to bring “Jamie Jupiter” to all of you!  Join the adventure, and meet the girl who's out of this world, literally!

You can also find me here:

TUMBLR: http://kartoon12.tumblr.com/

YOUTUBE: http://www.youtube.com/user/ToonGal12?feature=mhee                                                  

Look up “KarToonComics” on Facebook!

story:
Hi! My name is Lauren Jordan and I love food! And illustrations! And comics! And in my experience, some of the best food is made by people who also happen to make illustrations and comics. I wanted to make a zine that celebrates food and gives artists the opportunity to express their love of food by sharing their favorite recipes and food-related memories. And so Food Zine! came to be!

Food Zine! will debut at Small Press Expo (SPX) 2013 and will feature the work of the following artists: Adriana Blake, Anthony Clark, Aubrey Aiese, Becca Tobin, Brandon Eaker, Burt Durand, crashsuit, Dale O'Flaherty and Jessi Zabarsky, Daviann "Divi" Morris, Hannah Lee Stockdale, Ian Lawrence, Jenny Lees, Jenny Guan, Jon Marchione, Calamity Jon Morris, Lucie Ebrey, Lyndsey Raney, Matt Cummings, Melissa Shields, Mika Bacani, Mike Horowitz, Morgan Shandro, Natalie Nelson, Noella Whitney, Pam Wishbow, Rachel Dukes, Stephanie Cox, Stevie Wilson, Victoria Grace Elliot, Win Evans, and Zachary Sterling!

What We Need

All funding provided by pre-orders made through this campaign will go towards the printing of the zine itself. All artists receive a free copy of the book regardless, but my ultimate goal is to supply the artists with multiple copies of the zine for them to give away or sell as they wish! 

What You'll Get

Food Zine! will feature 60 pages of content from 32 artists! Thats a lot of content and a lot of food love!

  • For $5 you get a PDF version of the entire zine.
  • For $15 you'll get a physical copy of the zine, to be picked up at SPX, or delivered right to your door if you live in the US or Canada.
  • For those of you who reside elsewhere, you can get a copy of Food Zine! mailed to you for an additional $5 (for a total of $20).
  • For $50 you will receive not only a copy of Food Zine! but also four food-themed minis: I Want To Eat Everything, I Want To Eat Everything 2, and Stupid Food by Jessi Zabarsky, and No More Canned Biscuits, by yours truly.

When You'll Get It

Food Zine! will debut at SPX 2013 in Bethesda, MD, this September 14th & 15th. Pre-ordered copies will be available there for pick-up, or will be mailed out afterwards. PDF copies will be sent via email immediately after the con.

What Else Can I Do?

So you can't contribute to the campaign, but you love food! That's awesome! You can also help out by posting on twitter, tumblr, Facebook, anywhere! Get the word out!



*Campaign avatar art is by Burt Durand!

So you can't contribute to the campaign, but you love food! That's awesome! You can also help out by posting on twitter, tumblr, Facebook, anywhere! Get the word out!


*Campaign avatar art is by Burt Durand!

story:
Our Story

A competition to create the funniest computer ever.  The challenge is for a robot to be funnier than the best human standup comedian in front of a live audience by 2020. We're raising prize funds for the 2013 edition of our annual computer versus computer contest with human judges, similar to the Loebner prize.  The first contest was held in 2012.   More details at: http://funniestcomputerever.com

All this inspired by chats at, and trips to the pub after, the London Stanford AI/ML class meetups

 

The Impact

We're hoping to make computers more fun to interact with, and have a laugh during the process.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to get a small amount of funding (£500) as prize money and administration costs for the competition.  The majority of the money should go to the prize money to be awarded to the funniest computer, but we'd love to have £50 or so cover incidental costs such as domain name registration, paying grad students to help process some of the data etc.


Funders will get first access to the computer generated jokes as well as jokes created in their honour, and top funders will get the right to sit on the judges panel for the funniest computer.  And of course there's the chance to get FCE logo branded underwear!





 


Other Ways You Can Help

We hope to start slowly and build up.  In the first instance we'd love your input on format, approaches etc.  What we'd love the most is entries into the competition to be the funniest computer ever!

  

Logo by Kat Reeder

story:
Welcome to Project Nefas. If you're looking for an exciting and imaginative world with unique characters and a captivating story then you've come to the right place! We're so thrilled to have you here and taking time to look over our project and certainly hope that you enjoy it as much as we do!

The Project Project Nefas is an undertaking to bring a new and thrilling story to life as well as provide an ever-changing world full of endless possibilities to the mind of readers everywhere. Initially starting it's time in the mind of it's creators as a Novel, Project Nefas evolved into it's current graphic format. Full of deep and complex characters, races, and extended lore, the world of Nefas could better be seen in visual form as opposed to text. This, of course, involves much more time and dedication as well as more hands on board thus extending a simple writing endeavor into a series of planning, writing, story-boarding, and so on.

Project Nefas has been undergoing it's process of creation for over a decade! In this time Characters, Locations, Creatures, Races, Lore, and much more have been compiled and stored up specifically in the hopes of delivering a full and immersive world for readers who will eventually be exposed to it. The key goal through everything is to simply bring an exciting world to life for readers to enjoy with the highest quality available to them. We don't believe in taking shortcuts and only want to present this story in the highest quality way possible!

The first leg of this project is to assemble, finalize, and complete the very first chapter of this story in visual format. Any additional funding (which we will talk about below) will be used to further following releases!


As with any project that has it's focus on high quality, funding is needed. We already have individuals set and ready to handle the required ends to bring this story to life including full-time story-boarding, visual design, writing, and so on. The only thing is to ensure that these talents are met with the proper funding to achieve the highest quality possible. Monetary gain isn't what's driving everyone, however, but we feel that those involved should be rightfully compensated for the hard work and dedication that they will be and have already been putting in on Project Nefas!

All funding will be used directly for the project and in it's best interest. These funds cover everything from hands on board to printing and releasing! Of course we have special perks in place for contributors as well as stretch goals just in case we reach our goal and beyond. If we happen to move beyond our initial goal then additional funding will be put in play to work towards the next chapters. We want to be able to bring as much to the table as possible and we're asking for your help in order to do this!


Nefas is a story which takes place in an age of Iron. Divine laws have been shredded and the very existence of Life itself has fallen prey to the danger of being consumed. Earth has shifted into the shadows of it's darkest hours without knowing what dangers it truly faces. While the empires carry on, powerful figures work in the shadows, combating for their place upon a throne of change. The fate of the world is truly unknown.

It all falls on the shoulders of two men. From very different backgrounds and very different trials, their burdens are strangely similar and their destinies are tightly laced together. One wishes to reclaim what was lost and right the wrongs which have led to the state of decay which threatens to crush the world. His actions, however, may not be the best in design and press the boundaries of what is right and what is wrong. The other seeks answers for his tortured mind as well as the justification for a great sin committed against him and those linked with him, urging him towards an oblivious urge for revenge. Little does he know that his actions will help define the outcome of the worlds' fate nor that deep within him lies a terrifying secret, locked away by unspeakable forces.

The story follows one of these characters as he goes about his travels, encountering dangerous foes, forming unforgettable bonds, and struggling through unimaginable sacrifices. Will his actions serve to better the world or will they doom it and put everything that has been struggled for in jeopardy? The true meaning of Life is tested and defined as events unfold and ageless questions are brought forth.



Keiya


Keiya is one of the main characters of the story. His past is riddled in suffering and loss as well as unforgettable tragedies. Nightmares plague his mind which hint at untold secrets which he can't hope to understand. He journeys in search of these answers in the hopes of lifting his burdens and righting that which was wronged.



Haohmaru


Haohmaru is an Angel of Heaven, sent to purify the world and bring salvation to those who would otherwise be trapped in the corrupted darkness of pride and greed. He seeks to bring order and stability to the world despite the struggles he has come to undergo in the pursuit of such a dream.

(Expect to see more character teasers as we move along!)



Alex Foster – Project Director

Being the original creator behind the world of Nefas, he brings a vast horde of information to the project which he has accumulated through creative process over the past decade of his life. He can often be found spending any and all of his free time writing events, ideas, and researching all in the effort to better the story to any degree possible. It's safe to say he's a bit obsessed with getting it completed – call it a life goal. Alex has spent much of his life writing, collaborating over creative projects, and even occasionally built/fixed a car or two. When he's not busy working on a client's PC or Network he's hard at work keeping his mind alive by creating what he can or appreciating works of art by other individuals.

Kayla Humes – Artistic Director/Artist

(Otherwise known as "Lalasosu")

Species: Human, we think. To spot her, you can find her hunched over a tablet, drawing in the corner of a room. Kayla is a recent graduate of Full Sail University. Worked on several projects with others, such as the upcoming CRYNIME. She enjoys doing digital and canvas painted commissions on the side. Art has been a part of her life ever since she was small. It became something she grew up with as she moved from state to state with her family and has become a part of her and how she sees the world. Taking a story and bringing it to life is one of the biggest goals that she has, and this story is something she is willing to invest a lot of time into to see that goal finally happen. Basically, the Kayla creature finds this story worth her time and thinks it will be worth yours too.




For our contributors we are arranging perks in order to show our appreciation to those who wish to help us in driving this project forward!

(NOTE : Please include your email address in one of the "Address" fields when contributing!

All Perks now include the contributors name being listed among the credits as well! Even so much as a dollar!)

====

  • $1 - Contributors will receive a 'Thank You' Email for supporting the project as well as be attributed in the credits!

  • $5 - Contributors will receive a 'Thank You' Email for supporting the project as well as be attributed in the credits!

  • $10 - Contributors will receive a 'Thank You' Email for supporting the project as well as be attributed in the credits

  • $20 - Contributors will receive a Thank you email and be given Early Access to the First Release for supporting the project.

  • $50 - Contributors will receive a Thank you email, an Art Card, 1 Character Button, a Keychain, and Given Early Access to the first release for supporting the project.
  • $100 - Contributors will receive a Thank you email, an Art Card - 2 Character Buttons, A Keychain, Given Early Access to the First Release, A Nefas T-Shirt, and be Attributed in Credits for supporting the project.

  • $200 - Contributors will receive a Thank you email, an Art card, 2 Character Buttons, A Keychain, Given Early Access to the First Release, A Nefas T-Shirt Attributed in Credits, and receive a Mini Signed Nefas Poster for supporting the project.

  • $500 - Contributors will receive a Thank you email, an Art Card, Given Early Access to the First Release, A Nefas T-Shirt – A Keychain, Be Attributed in Credits, be Attributed in Credits, and receive a Large Signed Nefas Poster for supporting the project

  • $1000 - Contributors will receive a Thank you email, an Art Card, Given Early Access to the First Release, A Nefas T-Shirt, 3 Character Buttons, A Keychain, Be Attributed in Credits, A Large Signed Nefas Poster, Early Access to Future Releases, and a Personal Skype Call with the project team for supporting the project. 


In the event we streak right past our goal of funding the first issue we have a few more goals in mind that will only further the project and press it even deeper towards it's total completion. What with this being the funding for the first issue, we want to see as many issues funded as possible. Of course we hope that the first issue will make the funding to move on into the second, if these issues are already pre-funded then we can continue working on them as each issue is completed. So in other words, these are perks that will keep us hunched over our desks continuously. You slave drivers!

$5000 - Nefas First Issue Funded

$7000 - Nefas Second Issue Funded

$9000 - Nefas Third Issue Funded

$10000 - Special “Book of Art” Funded

$11000 - Nefas Fourth Issue Funded

$13000 – Nefas Fifth Issue Funded

$25000 – Nefas Complete Series Funded

$30000 – Nefas Novel Format Funded

Other Ways to Help

We most certainly understand that not everyone has the availability to contribute money into this project. If it were that simple for everyone then we wouldn't need to seek the backing of supporters to get this project into it's finishing stages and we'd all be zooming around on Jet-Ski's! However, for those that would like to see this story come to life but can't financially back it, we simply ask that you spread the word. In the end word of mouth is the best method of getting a project known and passed around. We would like to see as many people as excited about this project as we are and would highly appreciate and respect any contributions in the way of spreading the word about Project Nefas!


Current Art Attribution -

Character Art : Lalasosu
Creature Art : S.Rheannon Terran

story:
Thanks for your interest in JH COMICS. My name is Joseph Haas I want to write, draw and create cartoons and comics. Creativity is my greatest strength and I was to share it with the world to make people laugh, amaze them and inspire them to use their own imaginations.  By contributing to this campaign you'll help me print comics, start a website and eventually start creating animated shorts. As a graduating Digital Media & Design Major I have all the training I'll need to start right away all that's missing is some start up funds.

                                            

In order to gain more viewers and followers I would like to release printed copies of 2 brand new original comic book characters.  The donations would help cover the costs of printing and binding the comic books, as well as software for creating a completely new and unique website for JH COMICS. At the moment the cheapest price I have found for the production of the books is slightly under $3.75 per book. Even if we don't reach the goal of $5,000 all of the money raised will go towards the printing of the books and the creation of the website. The more money raised the more books that can be printed. By contributing at least $10 you'll receive a signed copy of Beacon's or Jolt's first adventure. And any donation will get your name featured in a special thanks section in both books and on the website.  And with higher donations you can get anywhere from characters named after you to a brand new super hero or super villain based off of you, or even being able to write your own adventure for a super hero of your choice!

There are plenty of comic book characters out there and plenty of people want to write comic books for Marvel or DC. But how often are whole new lines of comic book characters created?  I want to create a whole new world of characters and allow other people to join in and create characters and storylines as well. Creativity is my greatest strength and I want to share it with the world, and inspire others to use their imaginations and create as well.

story:
Short Summary

My name is John Baker, but you all may know me as J.B or even better Spoken reasons. 2013 was a Fantastic year for me. You all have witnessed the growth of my career since 2008 (The day I logged on YouTube.). In the year of 2013 alone I released 5 Short Films.. "Relationship Games 1-4" (Over 6 Million Views Total) & "Adopted White Girl" (Over 3.6 Million Views), and a debut Big Screen Movie "THE HEAT" w/ Sandra Bullock & Melissa McCarthy.

As an independent guy, I've worked insanely hard to get to this point of my Career.  Hollywood and I just don't see eye to eye on my creative visions. For years, I have preached #FCHW "Faith, Consistency, & Hard Work".. And even though people may still think I'm "Doing It BIG", I myself disagree. That is just the self discipline of my character.

Last year I felt as though I gave too much of my time to Hollywood auditioning for Movies and ended up losing the important energy to my Engine... THE PEOPLE! Even though my status has risen, I wanna break bread (make money) with my people and show the World what dynamic Independent greatness I can provide to the World as a FILM MAKER, without any Hollywood Political Restrictions being involved. You all have been begging me to do more Movie-like content. Now this is your time to help be apart of History!

I wanna give you all Movies from here on out! I'm tired of doing skits! I want to show the World what I can really do! And it WILL BE DONE!! #FCHW

What We Need & What You Get

I'm an Entertainer, I have bills just like you.. Usually I would put out 10-20mins shorts.. Now we are talking an actual Movie so professional production is  mandatorily needed. For this Movie to be done I will need a Director, director of photography, camera operators, lighting techs, audio recorders, editors and actors.

  • $15,000 will cover production (director, DP, lights, audio, editor)
  • $10,000 will cover actors (More $ will go into Celebrity Appearances if $35K is Exceeded)
  • $10,000 will cover location fees, transportation, food, wardrobe, and a production assistant(s). 

The Impact

My Goal is to give you a Movie every single year. This Generation needs strong leaders, and I feel as though we are lacking that to keep the kids positively informed. As an independent creator I have the car to evolve the culture to the next level. Now all I need is the Fuel.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help in various of ways, 1 way is by donating whatever your heart desires and spread the word to a Family Member/Friend. To make this film $35,000 will be the exact cost to shoot. However, any donations exceeding the $35,000 will go towards better production of the Movie and Celebrity Appearances. The rest of the money will also go towards Meet & Greets in a city near you and Premiere Events. After the video is finished I will release this on YouTube. I want to begin this shoot ASAP.. The quicker we raise money, the sooner I can start. I wanna begin this film the beginning of September 2014!

For this Movie to be done I will need a Director, director of photography, camera operators, lighting techs, audio recorders, editors and actors. 
$15,000 will cover production (director, DP, lights, audio, editor)  $10,000 will cover actors (More $ will go into Celebrity Appearances if $35K is Exceeded)
 $10,000 will cover location fees, transportation, food, wardrobe, and a production assistant(s).  
  The ImpactMy Goal is to give you a Movie every single year. This Generation needs strong leaders, and I feel as though we are lacking that to keep the kids positively informed. As an independent creator I have the car to evolve the culture to the next level. Now all I need is the Fuel. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
You can help in various of ways, 1 way is by donating whatever your heart desires and spread the word to a Family Member/Friend. To make this film $35,000 will be the exact cost to shoot. However, any donations exceeding the $35,000 will go towards better production of the Movie and Celebrity Appearances. The rest of the money will also go towards Meet & Greets in a city near you and Premiere Events. After the video is finished I will release this on YouTube. I want to begin this shoot ASAP.. The quicker we raise money, the sooner I can start. I wanna begin this film the beginning of September 2014!

story:
Hello! I'm Lauren Jordan, an artist from Chicago who loves food. I love cooking and baking, I love eating, and most of all I love sharing food with people I care about. In 2013, I took the plunge into self-publishing and put out a call for submissions for a zine celebrating all things food. Over thirty artists answered the call with beautiful and thoughtful recipe comics and illustrations. With funding through Indiegogo, Food Zine came to exist!

This spring, I'm thrilled to bring you Comfort Food Zine, the successor to Food Zine! Comfort Food Zine will feature even more delicious recipes and tantalizing food illustrations, with subjects ranging from cookies and grilled cheese to Chinese Hot-Pot. Contributing artists include Beatriz Bravo, Simon Brown, Kevin Budnik, Silvia Carrus, Jennifer Chan, Sophia Parsons Cope, Jenny Couture, Shannon Dybvig, Ejiwa Ebenebe, Win Evans,  Ashley "Ash" Fleming, Noni Garcia, Shauna J. Grant, Johanna Gustafsson, Miranda Harmon, James Howard, Sanjay Kulkaček, Elliot Lange, Véronique L., Ian Lawrence, Jade Feng Lee, Jessica Lim, Joseph Luster, Sam Dean Lynn, Rica March, Ryan McDiarmid, Christian Marie McGowan, Amanda Moody, Daksheeta Pattni, Cathy Schmeichel, Morgan Shandro, Jennifer Weber, xtina, and Jessi Zabarsky!



What We Need

All funding provided through this campaign will go towards the creation and distribution of Comfort Food Zine. Costs include ordering proofs, printing, and shipping zines to artists and backers. All contributing artists will receive a copy of the zine, but my goal is to supply the artists with multiple copies of Comfort Food Zine for them to sell or give away as they wish! The more funding we receive, the more copies I will be able to provide contributing artists!

What You'll Get

Comfort Food Zine is 92-pages of perfect-bound black-and-white food-positive comics and illustrations by thirty-five artists! That is a lot of content to consume with your eyes!

  • For $1 or more you'll receive our sincere thanks for helping make Comfort Food Zine a reality!
  • For $5 and above you'll receive a PDF version of Comfort Food Zine delivered via email!
  • For $15 you'll receive a physical copy of Comfort Food Zine, to be picked up at Toronto Comic Arts Festival (TCAF, May 9-10) or at Vancouver Comic Arts Festival (VanCAF, May 23-24). Please note that both of these events are free to attend, so if you live in Vancouver or Toronto, this is the tier for you!*
  • For $25, residents of the United States can have a physical copy of Comfort Food Zine delivered to them via USPS Priority Mail!
  • Don't live in the US? No problem! For $30 you can have a physical copy of Comfort Food Zine shipped internationally via USPS First-Class Mail International.**
  • For $40, international residents can have a physical copy of Comfort Food Zine shipped via USPS Priority Mail International. This tier is recommended for international backers! 
  • If you'd like to order more than one copy of Comfort Food Zine, simply add $15 per copy to your pledge total. Maximum ten copies per backer. Please be sure to select the correct rewards tier!
  • For wholesale inquiries, please contact me at laurenmichelejordan@gmail.com!

Want to Help Even More?

So you've already contributed to the campaign but want to help even more? Spread the word about Comfort Food Zine by posting on twitter, tumblr, Facebook, anywhere! Tell your friends, family and coworkers! If there's one thing that everyone has in common, it's an appreciation for good food!

And remember! You can still download the original Food Zine on Gumroad for free, but any dollar amount you give is donated to the Chicago Food Bank. 

Thank you for your interest in Comfort Food Zine!

And now! Even more sneak peeks at the interior art!

Jessi Zabarsky

Miranda Harmon

Ian Lawrence

Jade Feng Lee

Morgan Shandro

Elliot Lange

*Please note that shipping costs are not included in the TCAF and VanCAF pre-order tiers, and by selecting these tiers you agree to pick up your copies of the zine at these events. Failure to pick up your copies will result in additional shipping fees required to mail them to you. Failure to pay these fees will not ensure a refund of your pledge amount nor a delivery of your zines.

** Please note that USPS First-Class Mail International does not have tracking/insurance and can take up to 8 weeks to arrive. It is recommended that international backers upgrade to the CFZ: International Priority tier.

***Featured spot illustrations above are by James Howard, Johanna Gustafsson, Sam Dean Lynn, Kevin Budnik, Jennifer Weber, Rica March, Noni Garcia, and Sophia Parsons Cope, in order.

story:
What you see above is Our current video game promo Video for GALTOW put together by KALANI Games the video game  Developement studios in collaboration Xmoor Studios 

http://kalanigames.com/

Our Story

Xmoor Studios:

Founded in 2004 by Robert Garrett, Xmoor Studios is a publishing house specializing in comics and other diverse multimedia outlets. It all started with the creation of the comic named GALTOW created by Robert Garrett, and illustrated by Patrick David. Over the first years Robert and Patrick published several issues and also created the concept Seize Asylum of which a preview book was completed. In 2006 Patrick left Xmoor to pursue other opportunities, and was replaced by Co/publisher and Sculptor Eric Nocella who has brought his amazing style and guidance to Xmoor fulfilling our dreams with his knowledge and craft that has given an advantage to Xmoor Studios over a good deal of rival independent publishing houses in the area of merchandising and structure.

The goal to create comics was actualized following the debut of GALTOW which garnered excellent reviews and attention from major distributions such as Diamond.

Xmoor Studios is now producing and releasing innovative comic titles, merchandise, and multimedia properties, our main goal is to enter and expand into many other fields of literature and entertainment, and to impact on all these areas by creating concepts and intellectual properties.

 

 

 

  Right now, 4 issues exists and a trade paperback has been selling in limited distribution solely available when we attend conventions, but with your help, hopefully I can realize my goal of  finishing off the issues 5-6 and publishing the collected story arc as a Collected trade Edition in time for the upcoming New York Comic Con in October.

First, let me tell you a little bit about GALTOW.

GALTOW is a serial, sci-fi adventure:

Setting: 

GALTOW

Set in the year 2015, GALTOW centers upon four characters: The silent master JIYA, The massive warrior KEYLON JAKES, the flamboyant Ninja WU REYMOS, and the psychotic LADY CAFA as they fight to survive a post-apocalyptic . The main story takes place almost twenty-five years since the conclusion of The Second Vietnam War. The cities of the once proud United States are in constant turmoil, the result of conflicts fought over the years between the Great Clan Houses now acting as the ruling bodies after a disastrous civil uprising, from the ashes of the broken government Warrior Clans are now social classes, enlisting men and women who have embraced the codes of warriors from ancient Credos of the Ninja, Samurai, and Yakuza.


Fighters from all walks of life wage violent battles in the streets hoping to gain the attention and respect of the elite fighters. Duels Known as the “GALTOWS” are fought in the great arena’s across the continent seeking the highest echelon of the martial masters… these warriors will go to any length to become a GALTOW master, including genetic enhancements, and cyborg augmentations. . For to rule the GALTOWS is to be a living god on earth.

 

 

 

 

The GALTOW property wants to be something new in a saturated market. Epic in scope, GALTOW is explosive, the ultimate intellectual property due to it’s potential to it’s ability to be developed into everything from a special FX-packed feature film, console game, TV series, action figures, a novel, and anything else that the entertainment world can dish up.

 

 

 

 

An EPIC SCI-FI ACTION ADVENTURE SERIES BASED ON A POST APOCALYPTIC WORLD OF FOUR WARING CLANS: SAMURAI, NINJA, YAKUZA and SUMO.

 

 

CONCEPT STYLE: GALTOW as it has been conceptualized has a wide variety of characters, with the potential for a vast universe of new characters that can be created. GALTOW is a unique world in terms of themes of loyalty and honor with physical elements and action from both the East and West. The Samurai Clan embodies honor with the sword, the Ninja Clan represents the mystery and stealth in terms of secrecy, weapons and cybernetic enhancements, the Yakuza believes in honor and strength by enforcing its laws through violence and guns, and the Sumo represents the merging of East and West through genetic manipulation of human and animal to enhance physical strength and size. All the Clans and its warriors are guided through GALTOW, a new code of ethics among warriors.

 

 

 

This Indiegogo project was started out of my desire to raise the funds to finish the first story arc and raise the funds to print the issue into one collection.  The book will also feature bonus material, such as production sketches, layouts and an introduction by   Stunt Coordination/Actor LARNELL STOVALL Mortal Kombat: Legacy (The Viral series: fight choreographer, fight coordinator, stunt coordinator) The interiors will be in full color. Part of the Indiegogo funds will also be used to pay for the artists illustrations and to a new painted cover illustrated by a fan fave comic artist!


wwww.xmoorstudios.com

X


hEEric's page:  http://argonautsresin.blogspot.com/

 

 http://www.facebook.com/pages/Xmoor-Studios/192...


 

Here's the pencils for the upcoming GALTOW #1 INDIEGOGO SPEICAL EDITION, illustrated by my uber-talented partner Eric Nocella Diaz :http://argonautsresin.blogspot.com/

As well as the New upcoming GALTOW KEYLON JAKES T-SHIRT

& the pencils for the GREY GATEFOLD COVER: 

  • http://www.carbon-fibre.me
  • http://www.greypublishing.com

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for checking out our project, The Big Sexy. This is a book of pin-ups and nude artworks inspired by the women of the real world. The intent of this book is to offer a different perspective of the female form that is sorely lacking in modern pop art forms, speaking particularly to pop-art in the United States. The objective is simple and clear: let's show women, who are indeed beautiful, in every shape, form and shade that actually exists in our world. 

One thing that makes this unique compared to another pin-up book is that it will be, in part, participant generated. Meaning, certain pledge levels have been created so that the unique perspective of this book will be generated by a woman's perspective instead of merely being my own thoughts on the subject. 


What We Need & What You Get

While all of the artwork will be my own, major contributions will be from the public who pledge as well. From being drawn into the book, to contributing text or, the big deal: being on the cover, all contributions will lead to the betterment of the book as a whole. This is what has me more excited about the project. The audience itself will dictate what they want to see and read. 

Initially, the project will be self-published through Kablam! If anything further happens, I will make sure to keep contributors updated. Self-publishing is an expensive ordeal. So while the profits may not be high, to break even on a project like this makes it totally worthwhile. 


    The Impact

    I think the impact of the project is self-evident. While I'm personally OK with erotica in comics and allowing artists to draw whatever they like and not be censored by the medium or any other factor, at the same time the other side (reality) is sorely under-represented. So I would say that this is just an attempt at equilibrium. I think this will be the first step in bringing balance to the force that has been decidedly one sided for too long.


    Risks & Challenges

    As always, the biggest risk is just looking like an idiot who cares about something that no one else gives a crap about. I can own that. But before I leave this planet I'd like to do something that affects the world in a positive way. I think this project is one of many ways I can accomplish that. I hope, from what you have read so far, you may agree. 


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Please don't forget, if you just don't have the dollar to contribute, you can help in other ways. Posting on your outlets is a great help. Also, you can write to relevant websites and blogs of any kind to recommend coverage of this book. Podcasts are particularly helpful as well as editorial write ups. Spreading the word is a great and FREE way to make this book happen if you cannot directly contribute financially.

story:
Danger Dan the Detecting Man takes place in the city of Darkopolis - a city behind its time, wrought with absurd villains and criminal activity. Danger runs his own PI firm, The Danger Squad, with the help of his aging father Harold, sharp tongued assistant Mary Beth and spirited sidekick Spud.

Danger had dreams of becoming a cop when he was young, but was found physically unfit for duty by the police force due to a pervasive case of chronic bronchitis, which is equally phlegmy as it is debilitating. Undeterred in his hopes to fight crime, he opens his own PI firm and is content with his life, falling in love with a beautiful school teacher named Alice. Fate is not on Danger’s side though. During an investigation involving the abduction of Ms. Dupont’s prized cherry tomatoes, Dan interrupts one of Mr. Zonzo’s performances and turns him into the laughing stock in front of an audience of preschoolers. A class-A sociopath and classic over-reactor, Mr. Zonzo takes this as an act of war and exacts his revenge by murdering Danger’s wife while the two were wine tasting in Tuscany.

An extreme overreaction? Yes. But it sets the stage for a dynamic and perpetual game of cat and mouse in which Danger exhausts all of his energy trying to capture Mr. Zonzo. The death of Danger’s wife changes his outlook on the world. She was his anchor, and without her, the world is a much bleaker place. Her death turns Danger into a cold, unemotional man, but only strengthens his resolve to find the madman Zonzo and bring him to the “ball busting” justice he deserves.

As a group composed of fourth year media production students Crispy Gibberish will be producing one, 12 minute episode that will be distributed on the web and possibly through various interactive comic reading applications as our practicum project. 

Danger Dan is a dark dramedy, centered around the theme that it’s alright to not be okay, as long as you’re working on getting better. Not every ending can be a happy one. If every ending is happy, then happy just becomes normal and loses its appeal. Without sadness we’d forget what happiness feels like and that contrast of feelings is central to the plot of Danger Dan.

Danger Dan is a low budget student thesis project aspiring touch the hearts of its viewers through laughter. By contributing to our campaign you are helping this goal come into fruition. All contributions will be going towards production, post-production, feeding the cast, marketing, distribution and every bit helps.

 

           Facebook         Instagram

story:
Short Summary

1928, northern Greece

Three armed horsemen enter a village and take hostages a whole gendarmerie's station. Their goal is to secure a deal that their captain and notorious brigand, Kardaras, secretly made with the authorities, to get an amnesty for him and his two closest sidekicks, by delivering the severed head of another brigand to the state. But Kardaras had one more demand: to let him join the gendarmerie in order to exterminate the most famous and dangerous brigand of all, the legendary Pengos, that, years ago, was his closest friend and mentor.

      

 

 

 

The Team

 

Vassilis Chilas: Writer, artist, translator, editor, publisher in the greek comics' scene since 1990.

This is the writer.

Panagiotis Tsaousis: Artist and creator of many greek indie comics in the last decade.

This is the artist.

 

Dion Tzavaras: Writer, translator, collector and comics' historian. 

This is the english language translator.

Olga Papadimitriou:  Exotic dance teacher, comics' aficionado.

This is technical advisor and project's coordinator.

Our main goal is to complete our 5 issue limited series of this exciting story that's 120 pages long. To do this, we decided to produce the first issue (24 pages of pure thrill) and start a campaign for the money needed to print it. You must understand that the greek comics' scene is too small to financially sustain but a handful of indie comics (almost all greek comics are indie -or indie originated- and they are dozens of them) each year. The most local creators are romantic people that do everything for little, or no money. We want to expand our readers by this campaign. We believe that we have great stuff for you, exotic maybe, strange surely, extraordinary altogether. If we succeed with this first effort, we'll continue with the rest 4 issues. Every one of the contributors will have benefits for at least the next book. We believe in Brigands and we want you with us all the way. If we make this a classic, it will be only by your support and encouragement..!          

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least 1150$ in order to print the book, the posters, the bookmarks etc. If we get lucky, we'll save some money for the next issue, that already is in the making. We work first for our reader and then to make a decent profit. That can follow. Everyone of the backers will be mentioned inside the book and, if they contribute for the second issue, they 'll get an extra special  gift! You can even be a character in the series, starting from the first story! You can be a brigand or a gendarme (ex-brigands included) and participate in the whole series -if, of course, you choose the tough guy, that won't get shot, or stabbed, or decapitated real quick! (We can't tell the man!) All issues will be numbered and signed by the creators, the posters signed by the artist, the script by the writer. We'll make sure that every perk will come to you in perfect shape and packing, to make the unfolding a real excitement! Of course, the lucky Greek backers can have their shipping money back, if they choose to get their perks from the Phase Productions' office, here in Athens!          

The Impact

We think that Brigands is an extraordinary piece of art. It speaks about a period and a place that are almost unknown, uncharted for most people in the world. Introducing these historical facts to a larger audience is for us something like a duty. We did a large research in our way to tell the story faithfully and we kind of got enthralled by the atmosphere and characters that we used as starting material to mold our own. We tried to recreate the same atmosphere for you and, we think, we managed it! Your support is crucial! It makes a dream real, it makes a dream-reality come to life, it opens new ways of storytelling by introducing a background of pure harsh nature, similar only to the barren lands of american western films. We give you that power and we dare you to use it!

Risks & Challenges

We have completed the first book, there is no way we get behind. We only have left some people's heads unfinished, waiting for the real heroes among you that, hopefully, will fill up the gaps! We already work for the second issue, so don't worry about the future of the strip! The Brigands are here to stay, if your support allows it, of course! Our artist is Kirby-like prolific, a real penciling -and inking, and colouring, and lettering- machine! And motivated by pure artistic instinct! We only need two months to finish each book, so, if everything goes as planned, you'll listen from as very soon for our second issue campaign!  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the time or the money to back us up, that's okay! You still can help us by sharing our campaign with your friends! It's a great help and we appreciate it!! So, don't hesitate, spread the word, people!

story:
HI, I'M BEN BISHOP.

You may know me from the original AGGREGATE Kickstarter campaign back in 2015, or DRAWING BLOOD with Kevin Eastman, or my book, NATHAN THE CAVEMAN, or my work on the TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES, or maybe you don’t know me at all!

I came to Kickstarter in 2015 with a dream to once again get back to writing and drawing stories that were all my own, and you all showed me with your support that you wanted that too. The amazing part was, because of Kickstarter and the crowdfunding structure, so many of you helped shape what the story actually became, lots of you, and your CATS, were actually IN the book. I didn’t want to just make my comics alone... 

I wanted to make them with all of you. ♥

With your support, through Kickstarter pre-order pledges and social media shares, I was able to once again, successfully fund THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2! Now, while I'm hunkered down drawing the thing, you can PRE-ORDER the book HERE on INDIEGOGO. When it's all done, I'll print, self-publish and ship out this epic 200 plus page sequel, THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2, Right to your door. 

Check out all the awesome rewards and ways that you can not only get the book, but be a part of it, by being some of the very first to get your hands on THE AGGREGATE BOOK 2.

Here are some of my favorite...

 See all the guest artist originals and prints HERE.

I’ll never be able to adequately thank you all enough for once again helping me to tell this story, but I CAN use your enthusiasm, and support to make the best damn book I’m capable of and deliver it directly to you, the ones who showed up to the party early and made the whole thing possible.
