story:
UPDATE:

Check out a preview of the Lady Gaga video below. ONE WEEK LEFT TO DONATE!

 

Hi! I'm Eliza!

And I'm here to tell you that while pop stars are objectively dumb, it's OK to admit we love them. See, I believe that pop music is the greatest music of all time because it's dumb. I took a course in college called 'The Value of Music', so I know what I'm talking about.

I'm a comedy writer, musician, actor, and I'm decent at photoshop. I perform regularly at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre, NY on Maude Night and in various sketch shows. I wrote and performed my one woman show, "Pop Stars Are Dumb (But We Love Them)" which ran at UCB and toured Montréal and LA. 

In the show, I do original characters that poke fun at different genres of music, as well as impressions of existing pop stars, like Ariana Grande, Justin Bieber, Kesha, and Lady Gaga. 

I wrote all of the original music for this show. Not only did I want to do awesome vocal impressions, but I wanted to take parody even further by composing music that sounds similar to each artist, roasting the music industry itself. We're really getting to the heart of what pop music means, guys.

Listen to the music from 'Pop Star Are Dumb' on Spotify now!

After our successful 8 month run at UCB, we're making these songs into music videos for the world to enjoy for all eternity (after all, these sketches are evergreen). Plus, I look young and hot right now so I'd like to film them as soon as possible. 

Watch 'Pop Star Are Dumb' Sketch Show Live @ UCB!

Directed by: Michael Hartney (UCB Artistic Director, JFL, School of Rock on Broadway)

Featuring: Daniel Lempert (Harold/Maude Night UCB) and Douglas Widick (North Coast, Toxic Masculinity: The Musical)

The Power of Love

  • We need $2000 to make these videos. This covers the cost of renting rehearsal spaces and equipment, transportation, and most importantly, paying the cast and crew for their time, talent, and energy. I will personally not be profiting from this campaign: all donations go directly to the cost of creating the videos.
  • Our "Become A Pop Star" perk means you will get a custom pop song written for you - guaranteed to top the charts - plus a big poster of YOU as a pop star! Live your Britney fantasy!
  • For a smaller contribution, you'll get an mp3 download of a new NEVER HEARD BEFORE Lady Gaga Parody song!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll still make the videos, but I'll be in (more) debt. No pressure!

God is A Woman

By contributing to this project, you'll be supporting

  • Women in comedy
  • Women in filmmaking, production, music, and writing
  • Women who have too many wigs and need to something with them

The Edge of Glory

Our biggest challenge is making at least 3 videos within this budget:

It means that we only have access to filming locations for a brief period of time, which means we need to be extremely organized and use our time wisely. 

It means our costumes and props will be hand made.

It means that our cast members' compensation is pending completely on the success of this campaign.

Self-producing and editing is an enormous task, but I'm up for it. I self-produced a webseries called 'Dom and Tamantha' in 2014, which gave me the tools to be able to say "hell yeah! I can do that again!". It's a labor of love and requires a lot of patience and planning. 

Thank U, Next

Can't donate right now?

  • Share this campaign! 
  • Share this campaign!!
  • ... share this campaign

story:
Kat is a vet from a failed rebellion down and out on her luck. A mutual friend calls her about a bounty hunter named Tusk that needs help with a case.  This case takes them down a path that they didn't want to go. 

What Are You Backing?

  • A cyberpunk space western comic
  • This is the first issue of an ongoing series
  • This a full color 32 page comic

story:
The Ghostly Manor on Howling Hill 

 This is a family fun children's book from creators /brothers Frankie and Vinnie Tartamella  (creative team from the comic series Through the Woods. And City of Venus: Dead City.. still in demand now!)  

The Ghostly Manor on Howling Hill is for anyone that loves Halloween, classic movie monsters, and a fun time! This is an all ages comic book about 3 little monsters that break the rules on Halloween night, they have way to much fun, and run into some trouble! There's a lesson to be learned and new friendships that are made!   

  • This is a very short campaign, because this Completed 28 page book will be shipping BEFORE Halloween, so all backers can read this to their kids/family members or just enjoy this fun cartoony take on beloved characters on the spookiest night of the year! 

 

  • The funding for these comic books will cover the high quality printing costs, paper and thick glossy cover!!




  






 

  • This is the 4th campaign from Vinnie Tartamella and Mella Art World, all backers have been fulfilled on previous campaigns. The newest campaign "City of Venus: Dead City" is currently shipping now! (only days after the campaign ended) &  has made over 10k to date! 
     
  • Professional quality! Vinnie has worked in the comic book, toy, and entertainment industry for such companies as McFarlane Toys, Toybiz, Image comics, Diamond Select, Devil's Due, blue Water comics, Capcom, and Randy Bowen just to name a few. 
     
  • Frankie is the writer of Through the Woods, a 3 issue mini series that has been getting much praises from fans and backers all over the world! Through the Woods will also be re-released in 2020 as a collected edition for those who have missed it on the first run.


  


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! Share on social media!

story:
Caught in a deadly affair of the heart, Robin comes to find he has entered too deep to pull out easily.  Apparent to the risk to his own life (not to mention those around him), he can't help but fall for her deadly charm.  What will Robin do, rid the world of this dangerous device or give in to Beauty No. 2's passion?

Strangelove: I Want to be Chrome is a 40 page (or 60 if stretch goal is met) comic rated older teens and up for fans of horror, robot girls, and the bizarre.  It is a one off story, so it's always the best time to jump in.  Brought to you by Brenden Swan, an aspiring comic creator who dreams of the day my comic is in your hands . . . hey, you can make that dream come true.

Here are pages 5, 14, 20, 25, and 30 to sink your teeth into-

 

"original comic page" perk:

will let you take home 2 original inked pages from the comic.  As an extra addition, this perk will also get a bonus drawing used in the sketchbook mentioned below.   "Lucky!"

"sketchbook" perk:

you can have a printed mini-book of 30 black and white inked images.  Titled "Beauty #2," it contains images of said robot made as I was getting to know the character. As well as early images before I had her look narrowed down.  Some examples-


Stretch Goals:
$8,000 - *LOCKED* Page total increased to 60 pages
$15,000- *LOCKED* All pages colored.


If the opportunity allows, I'd like to tell an expanded ending that sheds more light on scientist A. Stone and his previous creation Beauty No. 1.  It also increases the amount of content you will receive.  Of course, also having the chance to color all the pages would only make an already stellar story even better.

 

As of the time of the start of this campaign, the script is finish, and I'm working on penciling the pages.  Inks done only on the above pages so far.  Shipping date is based on all stretch goals being met.


Thank you for your support.

story:
Villainous Press

Villainous Press is a comic, graphic novel, and fiction publisher. Their latest project is the dark graphic novel, Behind These Eyes.

The graphic novel was authored by Peter J. Wacks (member of the HWA) and Guy Anthony De Marco (member of the HWA, SFWA, and SFPA), with the interior artwork supplied by art nouveau artist Chaz Kemp and the cover drawn by FairyPunk Studios artist Zoe Frazer.

The authors have many professional projects completed, including novels, short stories, game designs, and studio management. The artists have many professional gigs behind them, including cover designs, posters, and steampunk fairy tale books.

Funding

The funding will be used for the following purposes. Note we're not asking for excessive amounts like $5,000, we're just looking to cover what is needed to finish the project.

  • The cover creation, including design, inking, and coloring.
  • The initial print run for the physical graphic novel.
  • The fees to set up the distribution through multiple channels, including Diamond.
  • Conversion of the graphic novel to a digital format.

Perks

To thank you for supporting this project, we've provided several rewards for your generosity. 

  • Tweets, a person's name or corporate name and link added to the website's Patron Page
  • A person, website, or company name added to the back of the digital and physical editions of the graphic novel
  • Digital copies
  • Physical copies
  • Extras such as signed books from the authors in addition to signed copies of the graphic novel
  • One benefactor can get the name, business, or product of their choice Tuckerized in the next graphic novel project as a major character. Villainous Press has four projects scheduled for 2013, with two in progress now.

Perks


To thank you for supporting this project, we've provided several rewards for your generosity. 

Tweets, a person's name or corporate name and link added to the website's Patron Page
A person, website, or company name added to the back of the digital and physical editions of the graphic novel
Digital copies
Physical copies
Extras such as signed books from the authors in addition to signed copies of the graphic novel
One benefactor can get the name, business, or product of their choice Tuckerized in the next graphic novel project as a major character. Villainous Press has four projects scheduled for 2013, with two in progress now.

story:
UPDATE 1!

If this pre-order fundraiser reaches its target goal of $5000, everyone who contributed $20 or more(Book pre-order tier and up) will recieve a PDF copy of the book completely FREE! This offer will only be availble for this Fundraiser and only if we hit the goal. Spread the word!

I am ARG! is a semi-autobiographical gag-a-day comic about a Toronto based animator and his bride-to-be. From Monday to Friday I am ARG entertains and delights readers online at IamARG.com

I'm Andrew Gregoire, an Animator/Illustrator/Cartoonist based in Toronto Canada.

In May of 2011, I went to TCAF, The Toronto Comic Arts Festival and came out of there inspired to create my own webcomic. That night I posted the first I am ARG comic to facebook. A month later I opened a website, and after a year the comic has grown beyond anything I could have imagined. One of my initial goals was to self publish my first book.  

There's tons of extra content packed into this book. Besides the 200 strips, there's creator commentary, bonus production artwork, fanart from other webcomic artists and an exclusive set of strips written specifically for this book.

Here's the details at a glance!

  • 152-164 pages
  • Perfect bound color cover with B&W interior pages.
  • 8" x 8" dimensions
  • Contains the first 200 I am ARG strips 
  • An all new set of strips exclusive to this book!
  • Bonus artwork and a collection fan artwork from various other webcomic artists!

The costs involved with publishing a book are high. This fundraiser is acting as a pre-order. I'm asking for $5000 to print 1000 books. This money covers the printing costs, the shipping costs to get the books to me and to print up the various rewards. This ensures that everyone that donates $20 or more gets a book and gives me a stock that I can sell at conventions and online. There is an added cost of $8 for shipping on all pre-orders. 
 

Any extra funding gathered will be put right back into the comic. Whether that be hosting costs, advertising, convention appearances, new merch or anything else ARG related.

I've also got some extra surprises planned if this fundraiser reaches certain milestones.

In addition to a preorder of the book itself and your name in the back of the book as a "Supporter of I am ARG!", there are various incentives for helping to get this book printed!

For donating a single dollar you'll get a PDF sampler of the book containing 20 comics selected by Lynn, Myself and readers! (This tier is not a pre-order)

For $10 for get an 8x12 Print of the book's cover art featuring all the lovable and detestable characters from the comics! (Please add an additional $8 for shipping)

For your contribution of $20 or more you'll receive a signed copy of the book (Please add an additional $8 for shipping)

For $35 you'll receive a signed Artist Edition of the book where I will draw a b&w drawing of any character from the comic (your choice) inside the cover of the book. (Please add an additional $8 for shipping)
 
For $45 you'll get the Artist Edition and you'll get an 12x18 print copy of the cover. Only a limited amount of these will be available. (Please add an additional $8 for shipping)

For $75 you'll get the Artist Edition, the 12x18 print of the cover and a comissioned piece of artwork. Comissioned artwork is a full colour digital drawing of your chosing! Printed at 12x18! (Please add an additional $8 for shipping)
 
For $150 you'll get the Artist Edition, a 12x18 print of the cover and a you'll get a guest spot in a future I am ARG strip! I'll draw your likeness into a comic and send you a 8x12 print of it after it goes up on the site! (Please add an additional $8 for shipping) Limited to 5 
 
For $200 you get the Artist Edition, a print of the cover, a commissioned piece of art and a guest spot in a comic! (Please add an additional $8 for shipping) Limit of 5
 
For $300 you'll get an Artist edition of the book, a print of the cover and I'll draw your very own I am ARG strip! That's right you'll get your very own strip, you can even help write it if you want to! Limit 3 (Please add an additional $8 for shipping)
 
For $1000 You get the artist edition, the print of the cover, a comissioned piece and an ARG Plushie about 10-12 inches tall hand crocheted by the very Lynn in the comic. Only 1 available so act fast. (Please add an additional $8 for shipping)

Can't support this fundraiser with money? That's okay! There are many other ways to help spread the word and get as many people involved. Indiegogo has included handy social media tools that you can use to promote this fundraiser! Every link helps!

I've created the flat rate of $8 no matter where you live on earth! Please make sure to include this cost in your contribution, or your order can't be shipped to you!

You can add the extra $8 at the bottom when you select your tier reward.

If you've accidentally pledged without adding the shipping you can just pledge again at the "The Supporter" tier and make your pledge $8 at the bottom.

ALL REWARDS ARE ESTIMATED TO SHIP BY OR AROUND JULY 15th

Artists take time to personalize and Comissioned works and comics take even longer. I will work tirelessly to get you your books and rewards as soon as humanly possible.

Thank you for supporting this endeavour and making this book possible. This has been a long time in the making and would not be possible without your help. From the bottom of my heart, I thank you for supporting this project and making a dream of mine come true.

Comissioned artwork:

For comissioned artwork I will pretty much draw anything that isn't explictly pornogrpahic or violent. It's open to discussion and up to my discretion. 

Guest appearances:

All contributors that purchase a guest spot will be required to provide photo reference for their likeness to appear in the comic.

Personalised Comics:

This one is open, but like the comissions I will not draw anything explicitly pornographic or violent. This perk is meant as a collaborative effort, you can write the comic and I'll draw if that's what you want or you can pick a topic and I will write a comic about that.

You can add the extra $8 at the bottom when you select your tier reward. 
If you've accidentally pledged without adding the shipping you can just pledge again at the "The Supporter" tier and make your pledge $8 at the bottom.
ALL REWARDS ARE ESTIMATED TO SHIP BY OR AROUND JULY 15th
Artists take time to personalize and Comissioned works and comics take even longer. I will work tirelessly to get you your books and rewards as soon as humanly possible.

Thank you for supporting this endeavour and making this book possible. This has been a long time in the making and would not be possible without your help. From the bottom of my heart, I thank you for supporting this project and making a dream of mine come true.

For comissioned artwork I will pretty much draw anything that isn't explictly pornogrpahic or violent. It's open to discussion and up to my discretion.

story:
** Time is winding down! Please support the project Today! **

Please also check out the alternate (original) promotional video at the below link.

http://vimeo.com/57748756

TALK! is an anthology of short graphic stories with the defining premise that each story will focus solely on a conversation between two people.  It attempts to break the 'fourth wall' by directing portions of the conversation directly at the reader.  The intention is to make the reader feel like they are  eavesdropping on a conversation between characters they are seated beside. TALK! is the product of eight months of toiling away in a basement and countless cups of coffee.  I am extremely proud of this book and excited for you to read it!

TALK! will be printed as a 52-page hard-cover.  Every copy of TALK! purchased through Indiegogo will come signed and numbered.  I have sourced an excellent printer and have personally inspected the quality of their books.  The above image is a 'mock-up' of the finished product.

They are generally "real-life" conversations.  They all include exaggerated comedic elements but are all based on or adapted from actual conversations.

100% of the funds that are raised will go towards printing costs.  Based on the format and quality of the book, printing simply isn't cheap!  Your support will go directly towards making sure this book is printed and in the highest of quality.   

I've always been an avid comic book fan but as I grow older and more decrepit, I've tended towards non-hero style comics.  I have always found that creating a story through the non-verbal elements of a conversation to be just as critical as the dialogue itself.  TALK! attempts to highlight the changing facial expressions and body language to convey the conversation visually as much as through the text.

The idea of a comic entirely of conversation appealed to me and I believe well suits my artistic style. 

I wrote TALK! with the hope of having it appeal to traditional comic fans as well as readers skeptical of comics generally.  

Every page in TALK! is drawn and inked by hand in pen & ink.  Not that I have anything against digital art, I just don't know how to do it!  TALK! is predominantly in black and white but utilizes bold colour contrasts in certain panels/stories.  This is a stylistic choice and not due to printing costs, which are equivalent.  Check out the gallery for more examples of artwork including a step by step detail of a panel from pencil to ink.

My name is Stephen Burger and I am an independent writer and artist working out of Toronto, Canada.  TALK! represents my first solo comic project.  More examples of my artwork can be found at -> http://stephenburger.deviantart.com

The book is done.  Let me stress this again.  It's DONE.  The artwork is complete and I have the printer all lined up and I'm ready to go.  The only pieces left to complete are any original commissions that are purchased as rewards.  Also, the 'Thank you' page will be completed after the campaign has finished.  I anticipate that the finished product will be sent to the printers 1 week after the end of the campaign.

Absolutely.  The "note from the author" above are pages from the book (the text has been modified to fit the campaign page).  Two of the incentives feature interior artwork (see below) and more can be seen in the Gallery section of this page.

* ALL prices include shipping to anywhere in Canada and the continental United States.  For international orders (including Hawaii... sorry, Hawaii), please add the amount as noted in each individual perk.

* Want an additional copy of TALK! for yourself or as a gift?  Add a second book to any perk for $20.  NO additional shipping required.

* EVERY copy of TALK! comes SIGNED and NUMBERED (except digital copies, of course!)

* EVERY supporter of $50 or more will have their name featured in the Thank You section of the book. 

"THE GENTLEMAN" Limited Print!

While "The Gentleman" only makes a cameo appearance in TALK! He has become the book's mascot and will surely have a recurring role in a follow-up to TALK!  This print will only be available through Indiegogo and will be limited to the number of rewards sold.  

This print is included in the "PREMIUM SUPPORTER" reward level but can be added to any reward level by including an additional $10.  Please make a note when making payment.

 

PENCIL SKETCHES AND INK PERKS - What should I expect? 

Having difficulty deciding between a pencil and an ink illustration?  The pencil sketch is a great way to get some original artwork at a very affordable price while the the ink illustrations have much more detail.  Each illustration, both pencil or ink, will be of a character in the style of TALK!

"ART COMMISSION PACKAGE" PERK

Want some original pen & ink artwork of your choosing?   This is the perk for you!  Send me your request and I will custom illustrate your request.  I take on a small number of private commissions so you will be among the very few to own custom original art.     I have included a few examples in the 'Gallery' section as well.  Please send your commission request before purchasing as there are a few things that I won't draw.  

The "Zombie Marilyn Monroe" image to the left is an example of a commission I have done in the past to give you an idea of the quality you can expect. 

 

 

 

 

 

More examples of my artwork can be found by clicking the button below.

"BOOK + PORTRAIT" PERK

This is your chance to be immortalized in a comic book illustration!  Your likeness will in the style of TALK!  Just send me a few reference photos and we're all set (please send to stephen_burger@yahoo.ca).  Be as fun and quirky in the reference shots as you like!  (Almost) Anything goes!  PLUS, you get to keep the original pen & ink illustrations and get a signed and numbered copy of the book to show off to your friends.  

"COLLABORATE!" PERK

Do you have a script but have been struggling to find an artist to pair it with? With this perk, you can have your script professionally illustrated in pen & ink.  PLUS, you get to keep all of the original artwork.  The script can be a maximum of 5 pages long.  Please send the script BEFORE purchasing this perk so I can give the OK.  This is necessary as I will not illustrate certain things, for example anything hateful/racist.

** All other perk information is contained within the individual perk in the right panel.  Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

 

Funding TALK! isn't the only way you can help this project succeed!  Help us spread the word through Facebook, Twitter and other social media networks.  The direct link to this page is http://www.indiegogo.com/TALK 

   

 

I am honestly and truly grateful to everyone who supports TALK!  Creating this book will help fulfil a dream.  I am very proud of this book and cannot wait for you to read it!

A special thanks goes out to Michael Meehan, who directed the TALK! pitch video above.  Please check out his website at http://michaelmeehan.tumblr.com

story:
Short Summary

MEGATON CRUSH (MTC) is a sci fi/fantasy comic anthology that deals with twisting stories like:

  • An escaped con finding himself in a strange diner where he is confronted with a (literal) bottomless cup of coffee
  • Fate playing a game with Elvis Presley and his twin Jesse Garon in the womb 
  • An alternate year 1999 where dueling never went out of style and high school students take history classes to get there snuff licenses. 

We've been coming out annually for the past couple of years but are looking to up that count to 2 issues a year.  MTC3 would be our Spring issue.

MTC is all out of love.  All of us are either work full time or are trying keep our heads afloat doing freelance.  I'd venture to say with all the craziness in this world, we might have gone a wee bit insane if we didn't this creative outlet.  And we most definitely want to keep this train running from issue to issue to ever-loving issue.  "What better place than here?  What better time than now?"

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to print at least 350 copies of MTC3.  More would be doper.  We plan on getting them out comic stores and sell them at several conventions this year.  Every dollar earned goes right back into this beast. The remainder of the donations from this campaign will go to funding future issues and, of course, the perks!

Including: 

  • Getting your likeness in a story in the comic!
  • Original art and commission pieces!
  • T-shirts and the MEGATON CRUSH soundtrack!
  • We'll work with you to create a story for MTC4!
  • Get the next 10 issues of MTC FREE!  Yup.  You're in for the long haul with us!
  • For whatever reason if don't hit our goal, we'll use the donations to satisfy the promised perks and onto printing.

The Impact

It is a financial and personal goal this year to have MEGATON CRUSH self-funding.  We are doing a very small print run just to have a handful of copies for C2E2 (a Chicago comic convention) this year.  This along with the past 2 issues were done from out of pocket.  Which, again, was out of love for what we do but definitely a strain. Your contributions would bless our hard work and allow us to continue:

  • Telling atypical stories that you don't see often but comics do so well.
  • Display diverse characters in strange worlds but that are not too different from our own.
  • Upping the production value for future issues
  • Setting up even better perks for future funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you haven't watched the video, please do.  We feel it's important to let you know who we are especially if you plan on donating to the cause.   Feel free to check us out:

  • Like us on Facebook "MEGATON CRUSH" page
  • Find/share our music trailers on Youtube. Search "MEGATON CRUSH presents"
  • Our website: megatoncrush.squarespace.com

And that’s all there is to it.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Sky Pirates of Valendor is a steampunk comic book series written by Everett Soares and illustrated by Brian Brinlee. Published under the flag of Jolly Rogue Studios since 2007, we are embarking on our third volume and a war is brewing. 

In July of 2012, we ran an IndieGoGo campaign and it was very successful. However, unlike many campaigns, our lowest tier went unfunded except for a few brave souls. We CANNOT have a war without casualties.

What We Need & What You Get

Our needs are simple here...we need folks willing to appear in a comic book and have their character killed. The best part is you get to choose which one of our crew offs you and how!

In return for your sacrifice, you will receive a copy of the issue you appear in and your demise occurs, signed by the creator Everett Soares.

Further, we will have a page of recognition in each issue to give credit to all of our guest characters. If you have a website or Facebook page you'd like to promote, we will feature it on this page.

To check out Sky Pirates of Valendor, feel free to visit our website, where you will find our books for sale. Or you can download them at DriveThruComics.

 

Update as of 7/28/2013

Ladies & Gentleman! Lend me your ears!

22 very brave and generous souls just received in their email boxes a download link to Volume 1 & 2 of Sky Pirates of Valendor! This act was precipitated by the momentous occasion of....oh hell....WE MADE OUR GOAL! For the first time ever, we ran a successful crowdfunding campaign thanks to the generosity of others!

But we are not done yet! We have 17 days and 3 cover spots left to fill as well as the epic battle cover of Volume 3 trade! 

Let it be known right now - if all 6 issue covers sell, each contributor will receive a Valendor prize package consisting of a 6-oz. flask with our jolly roger engraved upon it, a shot cup and a dog tag all stored within one of awesome and popular tote bags! Remember - only three more to go!

Thank you to EVERYONE for your patience, generosity and support!

story:
VIEW THE LADYSTAR JESSICA HOSHI AND THE AJAN WARRIORS TRAILER!

Welcome to LadyStar!

Hello, folks! Cat here. I'm the scriptwriter for the LadyStar comic series.  On behalf of my team:  Bug, Cube, Gammyun, Kez, Mayshing, Emily, Anna and Animetor, I'd like to introduce you to a project that we've all had quite a bit of fun putting together. 

Short History of the Project

LadyStar has been in development since 1999. We've made games, novels, iPad apps and manga. But of all the projects we've ever done, the comics we started drawing in 2008 were the ones that people really enjoyed the most.

Our Plan

We need your help to update our comic series for mobile devices.  We're going all-out to make LadyStar one of the best digital comics available!

We really want you to be able to take our stories with you on your favorite mobile platform and share them with your friends.  If you've been looking for a story where the girls get a chance to fight evil, believe me.  You've found it!

We need to rework our pages and artwork to fit an e-book format, and we need to write a new introduction and story for the mini-artbook and the new e-book format special edition.  We have a team of 12 artists ready to help with this important work, and your contribution will help us cover the costs of their time if we need it.

How you Can Help

If you make any contribution, you will get a copy of either the Kindle version or a DRM-free PDF of the new LadyStar: Jessica Hoshi and the Ajan Warriors Comic #1 Special Edition.  If you make the higher level contribution, you will also get a free copy of LadyStar: Fury of the Venom Legion Comic #1 in your choice of the same formats.

What you Get

That's two complete color comics and a mini-artbook and a preview of LadyStar: Jessica Hoshi and the Ajan Warriors Comic Issue #2 for $5.00!  If you want a lot for your contribution, you found the right campaign! 

But I Don't Have a Kindle!

That's okay! There is free Kindle software for iPad, iPhone, Android Phones and Tablets, Blackberry, Mac and PC! You can read the Kindle editions of our comics on almost any platform!

Everyone Can Join In!

Our studio team spent nearly two years writing, illustrating, inking, coloring and shading these pages.  We're very happy with our work and we can't wait to share it with you and all of our new readers. LadyStar is a story about friendship and courage with lots of action and adventure, and I think Jessica Hoshi and her adventures will inspire many new readers.

Be sure to check back, because if this campaign is a success, you won't believe what we've got in store for you next!

Please share our campaign with everyone you know, and be sure to visit us on Twitter and Facebook and help us spread the word.  Prepare to do battle, LadyStar fans!

Here are some examples of the great comics we're going to bring to your mobile devices and computers with this project:

Jessica Hoshi and the Ajan Warriors and Fury of the Venom Legion Example Comic Pages

Special Edition Mini-Artbook Samples

story:
The Siren's Calling Indiegogo campaign may be over (and successful, all thanks to 120 backers during our 21-day run from September 29th until October 20th, 2015), but we are still selling print copies of Issue #1 exclusively at Indiegogo with its Shipping Now feature.

Because, well, we're shipping. Now!

Just go to the column on the right, click "Buy Now" and you're all set!

There are currently two options –– a regular option, which adds shipping & handling charges ($2 domestic, $5 for international) to your order at checkout, and a "Pick-Up" option for those who are local and don't mind picking up their copy in either Jersey City or Tribeca (NYC). 

Thanks for all the support folks! We can't wait to hear what you think of our first issue!

Here's what some folks have been saying about our six-page preview of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1:

Monday, 10/26/2015:

The SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR Indiegogo (and InDemand page) is officially (and successfully) finished! 

Because of 112 amazing backers who have sung wind into the sails of this ship, Lauren & I will be able to:

• Print SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1
• Write, illustrate, and print SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #2
• Included in issue #2 will be a bonus 8-PAGE ORIGIN STORY 
• Produce and print SIREN'S ODYSSEY: AN ILLUSTRATED JOURNAL

If you're getting a copy of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 ($15 contribution or more), you're also getting a copies of issue #2 and the SIREN'S ODYSSEY, too!

Once again, to everyone who has sung this siren's song immaculate...

Again, with YOUR HELP, we hit our $2,000 initial goal, our $3,000, stretch goal, our $4,000 stretch goal, AND our final $5,000 stretch goal! Our initial goal was hit in two days, and we got from $4,500 to $5,000 in less than an hour because of our two severely limited "main character" perks!

Lauren & I will be keeping all of our backers and anyone who is following SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR updated regularly via the updates tab as well as the "UPDATES!" section below. If you're not a backer and would like to follow the progress, all you have to do is click the heart button to the left to follow us.

Also, be sure to give this horror noir a "Like" over on the Facebook page and on Instagram, and join the conversation on Twitter by checking in with #SirensCalling!

TUESDAY, 10/20/2015:

FINAL NEW (LIMITED) PERK (for one UN-lucky DOLL):

Without giving too much away about what goes down in issue #2, I will say that there is a FEMALE CORPSE involved, and it could be YOU!  This is a "ladies only" perk –– a "femme fatale special," if you will –– so sorry, gents (but hey, you could always pick this perk up for that special vixen in your life :-)

MONDAY, 10/19/2015:

TWO NEW (LIMITED) PERKS (for one lucky GUY and one lucky DOLL):


SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #2 introduces two new main characters (the female one I can't say right now, but the male is a big Hollywood producer named MR. WILDSTEIN –– I wonder where I got that name from :-) and these perks make YOU the person Lauren models these two characters after!

PLEASE NOTE: These two perks guarantee a first appearance in issue #2. but not subsequent appearances throughout issue #6 UNLESS SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR gets picked up by a publisher and Lauren & I can complete the full story. In that event, you certainly will be see in the remaining issues up until issue #6 or the character is killed off, whichever comes first.

And you'll also get signed copies of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 & #2, of course, so you can see yourself in glorious print! 

SUNDAY, 10/18/2015:

NEW PERK (as a sort of a "hat tip" to you all): 

While it's true I'm not giving away myself for this (hopefully) modest amount, I am offering up one of my hats –– my very first hat, to be exact, and the one featured in my very well-known profile pic many have dubbed "Trig Noir" (photographed by the renowned and talented Tatsuro Nishimura) which I will sign with a silver Sharpie and inscribe to you or to someone special if you'd like to give this hat as a gift.

And you also get a signed print copy of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 and the set of five postcards, too.


FRIDAY, 10/16/2015:

Without further adieu, here's the BRAND NEW PERK you helped us to unlock:

SIREN'S ODYSSEY: AN ILLUSTRATED JOURNAL will be a PRINT BOOKLET filled with sketches, script pages, story notes, and a brief history of how Lauren & I got SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 to print –– four years in the making!

This is a stand-alone exclusive perk, which means it doesn't include any other prior perks. Consider it a companion piece to the first issue of our horror tale, so we urge you to pick up a print copy of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 and make a second contribution to get this behind-the-scenes look at how this premiere issue was made. 

Again, if we make it to our $4,000 stretch goal, we'll be able to print not only SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1, but also #2!

THURSDAY, 10/15/2015:

It was here, but now it's gone!

SCREENWRITERS, pounce on this one 'cause there's only two available, and I'd love to help you get YOUR STORIES turned into what they're destined to be!


TUESDAY, 10/13/2015:

From today (10/13/2015) until Saturday, 10/17/2015, we're looking for strong sirens to sing the praises of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR and help us get to our stretch goal of $4,000 by luring (or referring) their friends and getting them to give a little bit of themselves to our Indiegogo. Here's how it works:

Again, you MUST be signed into your Indiegogo account and you MUST use the share tools from a desk- or laptop computer (not from a smart phone or tablet) in order to participate in this referral contest. Then, check back daily to see the most current numbers on the leaderboard below:

[Above (FINAL) list updated 10/18/2015 at 12:35 PM EDT.]

So start singing all you social sirens, so you can earn some more perks, and thanks in advance for spreading our song further out into the seas of success!

THURSDAY, 10/08/2015:

NEW PERK (And this time, it's personal!):

Okay, so admittedly it is a bit morbid, but hey, that's how the sirens of yore got personal with their victi–– er, backers: They would lure strong sailors passing by in their ships onto the jagged rocks of their island home, and the outcome was always the same. 

And this new perk includes a copy of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1, too. (In case you didn't get one yet, or you want to gift one to a friend.)

FRIDAY, 10/02/2015:

Thanks to all of YOU, we have hit our goal of $2,000 in only two days! As a special thank you, we are unveiling this brand new, severely limited edition perk:

There are only five of these being offered by Halftone Crew, are available in women's and men's sizes, and come in beautiful noir! Pick yours up before they're gone!


  

SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR is a creator-owned graphic novel by John T. Trigonis & Lauren Clemente that spins a sordid story of Lorie Lye, a mythical siren from the sea who, fed up with her man-eating ways, chooses to leave it all behind her for a shot at the glitz and glamour of starlet life in Hollywood, California, 1947. 

Lorie’s biggest obstacle won’t be landing auditions and securing roles, but keeping a firm hold over her natural craving for human flesh and blood, because lurking beneath her alluring physique lies an ancient creature too terrible for even the lights and cameras of Tinseltown to capture. 

SIREN'S CALLING is a horror comic that blends nuances of film noir into a deeper tale told of a young woman who must find the strength to fit into an all-too-human world while fighting off the urges of the demonic femme fatale within her.

Words by John T. Trigonis. Art by Lauren Clemente. Letters by AW’s D.C. Hopkins. Production by Deron Bennett.


For Lauren and I, SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR marks our first attempt at a graphic novel. It's been nearly a four-year process to get us from script and sketches to the final lettered product, and we can't wait to share with all of you.

Originally, we were going to sell issue #1 digitally through ComiXology and in PDF form; but the more we looked at our finished product, the more we wanted to hold a copy of it in print, a format Lauren and I both prefer. I still visit Midtown Comics every Wednesday to pick up my stash.

So we figured that if we wanted to hold a copy in our hands, maybe some of you would, too.


With your support, Lauren and I looking to produce a small high-quality print run of 500 copies of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1, if we can hit our goal of $2,000.

Why are we coming to you, our readers, to make this print run a reality? We want to make sure there's an audience for our horror noir before we print them, so we're setting the price lower than most crowdfunding campaigns for print comics because we want to pre-sell it to as many of you who want it as possible.

Hemlock Printers USA
Now, just because the price is lower doesn't mean the quality will be less than standard. On the contrary, it'll be more. We will not be using the traditional printers most indie comic creators use. Instead, we've chosen to team up with Hemlock Printers USA, which uses the highest quality recycled paper and prints a plethora of the most popular print magazines in the world like Collective Quarterly, Chick Pea, and Cherry Bombe, as well as my fiancée’s magazine Eighty. 

And they’re just truly awesome to work with. (Here’s looking at you, Brad and Frits!)

Here's the breakdown of what we need help with, funding-wise:          



There's a much larger plan in the works here. This isn't just about making a print edition of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 a reality. Here's the deal:

With your help, we'll get a print edition up and running. And with your help, we'll get a bunch of people to download the full first issue on Halloween (Saturday, 10/31). Then, I'll take take our print issue, data on both the digital (via ComiXology) and print (Indiegogo) sales and package those together with a proposal and pitch SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR to the big three indie comic publishers: Image Comics, Dark Horse Comics, and Boom! Studios/Archaia Entertainment.

The goal here is to get one of these three publishers, of which I have contacts at two of the three, to help us bring to you, our readers and faithful supporters, issues #2 - #6 of the first complete story arc and bring it to an even wider audience. That's been the plan for almost four years now. We just needed the product. 


John T. Trigonis makes stories (poems, novels, and films) when not mentoring others on how to fund the making of their own cinematic tales. He is the co-creator and writer of Siren’s Calling: A Horror Noir, a nostalgist, noirchitect, and TEDx talker. He was raised right on coffee, comics, and red wine, as well as having literally written (and re-written) the book on Crowdfunding for Filmmakers. 

Lauren Clemente is an Art Director and Illustrator based in New York City. She has experience in editorial publishing, marketing, and is the illustrator and co-creator of Siren’s Calling: A Horror Noir. With a retro spirit, you'll find her sipping coffee or cocktails, taking photos with her iPhone, geeking out about Harry Potter, planning her next travel adventure, breaking bread with good friends, and doting over animals (especially dogs!).


If you love not only the look but the feel of comic book pages between your fingers while you read them; if you love print anything; if you want to immerse yourself in a horror story that transcends the boundaries of the genre itself and tells a more profound story, then Lauren and I invite you to heed the call of our Lorelei and pick up a print copy of a signed SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 for just $15. 

Not sure? DOWNLOAD THE FREE SIX-PAGE PREVIEW HERE and we're sure Lorie  will lure you deeper into her stark world.

And take a look at some of the other perks on offer, from postcards and exclusive prints to being drawn onto our back cover with Lorie, and even being drawn into issue #2 as a background, cameo, or main character! 

This is a grassroots effort on all our parts, so I only ask one other thing after you pre-purchase issue #1 at whatever level suits you best: share this Indiegogo with anyone you know who loves a good graphic novel, and let’s get #SirensCalling printed and pushed out to the world!

Thanks so much, everyone!


Q: Most of the perks say they'll be delivered by November? What if November comes and goes and I still don't get my perks?
A: That won't happen, because if for whatever reason we run behind with our perk fulfillment, you can rest assured you'll know long before the end of November.

Q: The "Extended Plan" sounds swell, Trig, but... what if you get rejected  from all three of those publishers? Is SIREN'S dead in the water?
A: Absolutely not! There are lots of other publishers out there (Top Shelf, Titan Comics, Alterna, Black Mask, and Zenoscope, just to name a few), and if we meet with rejection from my top three choices, then we'll keep pitching to anyone who accepts submissions. I'm just a believer that you start from the top and work your way from there (hey, it's worked out well for me so far!) 

Q: Why are Image Comics, Dark Horse Comics, and Boom! Studios/Archaia Entertainment your top three?
A: 'Cause hand down, they're publishing the best creator-owned comic books on the market today.

Q: Why isn't DC and Marvel on the list?
A: They're not comic publishers anymore; they're movie studios.

Q: Back to crowdfunding: What if you don't hit your $2,000 goal?
A: We're still gonna make this print run happen somehow. We're running a flexible fundraising campaign here on Indiegogo, and that means we keep what we raise. So one way or another, we're gonna owe some hardcore fans a print copy, and one way or another, we'll deliver.

Q: What if you go above your goal? Like, way above your goal?
A: We have a plan for that, which if we're fortunate enough go far enough beyond our initial goal of $2,000, and we'll talk about that if and when we get there. I promise.

SCREENWRITERS, pounce on this one 'cause there's only two available, and I'd love to help you get YOUR STORIES turned into what they're destined to be!
TUESDAY, 10/13/2015:
From today (10/13/2015) until Saturday, 10/17/2015, we're looking for strong sirens to sing the praises of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR and help us get to our stretch goal of $4,000 by luring (or referring) their friends and getting them to give a little bit of themselves to our Indiegogo. Here's how it works:
Again, you MUST be signed into your Indiegogo account and you MUST use the share tools from a desk- or laptop computer (not from a smart phone or tablet) in order to participate in this referral contest. Then, check back daily to see the most current numbers on the leaderboard below:

[Above (FINAL) list updated 10/18/2015 at 12:35 PM EDT.]So start singing all you social sirens, so you can earn some more perks, and thanks in advance for spreading our song further out into the seas of success!
THURSDAY, 10/08/2015:
NEW PERK (And this time, it's personal!):
Okay, so admittedly it is a bit morbid, but hey, that's how the sirens of yore got personal with their victi–– er, backers: They would lure strong sailors passing by in their ships onto the jagged rocks of their island home, and the outcome was always the same. And this new perk includes a copy of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1, too. (In case you didn't get one yet, or you want to gift one to a friend.)FRIDAY, 10/02/2015:
Thanks to all of YOU, we have hit our goal of $2,000 in only two days! As a special thank you, we are unveiling this brand new, severely limited edition perk:




There are only five of these being offered by Halftone Crew, are available in women's and men's sizes, and come in beautiful noir! Pick yours up before they're gone!

  
SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR is a creator-owned graphic novel by John T. Trigonis & Lauren Clemente that spins a sordid story of Lorie Lye, a mythical siren from the sea who, fed up with her man-eating ways, chooses to leave it all behind her for a shot at the glitz and glamour of starlet life in Hollywood, California, 1947. 
Lorie’s biggest obstacle won’t be landing
auditions and securing roles, but keeping a firm hold over her natural craving for human flesh and
blood, because lurking beneath her alluring physique lies an ancient creature
too terrible for even the lights and cameras of Tinseltown to capture. SIREN'S CALLING is a horror comic that blends nuances of film noir into a deeper tale told of a young woman who must find the strength to fit into an all-too-human world while fighting off the urges of the demonic femme fatale within her.




Words by John T. Trigonis.
Art by Lauren Clemente. Letters by AW’s D.C. Hopkins. Production by
Deron Bennett.


  
 

For Lauren and I, SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR marks our first attempt at a graphic novel. It's been nearly a four-year process to get us from script and sketches to the final lettered product, and we can't wait to share with all of you.
Originally, we were going to sell issue #1 digitally through ComiXology and in PDF form; but the more we looked at our finished product, the more we wanted to hold a copy of it in print, a format Lauren and I both prefer. I still visit Midtown Comics every Wednesday to pick up my stash. So we figured that if we wanted to hold a copy in our hands, maybe some of you would, too.



 

With your support, Lauren and I looking to produce a small high-quality print run of 500 copies of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1, if we can hit our goal of $2,000.
Why are we coming to you, our readers, to
make this print run a reality? We want to make sure there's an audience for our horror noir before we print them, so we're setting the price lower than most crowdfunding campaigns for print comics because we want to pre-sell it to as many of you who want it as possible.
Hemlock Printers USANow, just because the price is lower doesn't mean the quality will be less than standard. On the contrary, it'll be more. We will not be using the traditional printers most indie comic creators use. Instead, we've chosen to team up with Hemlock Printers USA, which uses the highest quality recycled paper and prints a plethora of the most popular print magazines in the world like Collective Quarterly, Chick Pea, and Cherry Bombe, as well as my fiancée’s magazine Eighty. 
And they’re just truly awesome to work with. (Here’s looking at you, Brad and Frits!)
Here's the breakdown of what we need help with, funding-wise:          


    




 There's a much larger plan in the works here. This isn't just about making a print edition of SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 a reality. Here's the deal: With your help, we'll get a print edition up and running. And with your help, we'll get a bunch of people to download the full first issue on Halloween (Saturday, 10/31). Then, I'll take take our print issue, data on both the digital (via ComiXology) and print (Indiegogo) sales and package those together with a proposal and pitch SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR to the big three indie comic publishers: Image Comics, Dark Horse Comics, and Boom! Studios/Archaia Entertainment.The goal here is to get one of these three publishers, of which I have contacts at two of the three, to help us bring to you, our readers and faithful supporters, issues #2 - #6 of the first complete story arc and bring it to an even wider audience. That's been the plan for almost four years now. We just needed the product. 

    
 

John T. Trigonis makes
stories (poems, novels, and films) when not mentoring others on how to fund the
making of their own cinematic tales. He is the co-creator and writer of Siren’s Calling: A Horror Noir, a
nostalgist, noirchitect, and TEDx talker. He was raised right on coffee,
comics, and red wine, as well as having literally
written (and re-written) the book on Crowdfunding for Filmmakers. 
Lauren Clemente is an Art Director and Illustrator based in New York City. She has experience in editorial publishing, marketing, and is the illustrator and co-creator of Siren’s Calling: A Horror Noir. With a retro spirit, you'll find her sipping coffee or cocktails, taking photos with her iPhone, geeking out about Harry Potter, planning her next travel adventure, breaking bread with good friends, and doting over animals (especially dogs!).



If you love not only the look but the feel of comic book pages between your
fingers while you read them; if you love print anything; if you want to immerse yourself in a horror story that transcends the boundaries of the genre itself and tells a more profound story, then Lauren and I
invite you to heed the call of our Lorelei and pick up a print copy of a signed SIREN'S CALLING: A HORROR NOIR #1 for just $15. 
Not sure? DOWNLOAD THE FREE SIX-PAGE PREVIEW HERE and we're sure Lorie  will lure you deeper into her stark world.And take a look at some of the other perks on offer, from postcards and exclusive prints to being drawn onto our back cover with Lorie, and even being drawn into
issue #2 as a background, cameo, or main character! 
This is a grassroots effort on all our parts, so I only
ask one other thing after you pre-purchase issue #1 at whatever level suits you best:
share this Indiegogo with anyone you know who loves a good graphic novel, and
let’s get #SirensCalling printed and pushed out to the world!
Thanks so much, everyone!



Q: Most of the perks say they'll be delivered by November? What if November comes and goes and I still don't get my perks?

A: That won't happen, because if for whatever reason we run behind with our perk fulfillment, you can rest assured you'll know long before the end of November.Q: The "Extended Plan" sounds swell, Trig, but... what if you get rejected  from all three of those publishers? Is SIREN'S dead in the water?
A: Absolutely not! There are lots of other publishers out there (Top Shelf, Titan Comics, Alterna, Black Mask, and Zenoscope, just to name a few), and if we meet with rejection from my top three choices, then we'll keep pitching to anyone who accepts submissions. I'm just a believer that you start from the top and work your way from there (hey, it's worked out well for me so far!) 
Q: Why are Image Comics, Dark Horse Comics, and Boom! Studios/Archaia Entertainment your top three?

A: 'Cause hand down, they're publishing the best creator-owned comic books on the market today.Q: Why isn't DC and Marvel on the list?
A: They're not comic publishers anymore; they're movie studios.Q: Back to crowdfunding: What if you don't hit your $2,000 goal?
A: We're still gonna make this print run happen somehow. We're running a flexible fundraising campaign here on Indiegogo, and that means we keep what we raise. So one way or another, we're gonna owe some hardcore fans a print copy, and one way or another, we'll deliver.Q: What if you go above your goal? Like, way above your goal?
A: We have a plan for that, which if we're fortunate enough go far enough beyond our initial goal of $2,000, and we'll talk about that if and when we get there. I promise.

story:
Sophie goes on tour!

Hello Everyone! My name is Sophie Labelle, the French-Canadian artist behind Assigned Male, a webcomic about a bunch of sarcastic trans and queer teenagers that has been running since 2014. I've also been giving talks and doing events all over the place in the past few years! In 2020, it's reaching new heights with my first actual World Tour, for which I've been receiving invitations on every continent of the world.

As a trans woman, I feel very privileged to be able to do this. In the past, every speaking tour I did allowed me to meet members from trans, queer and feminist communities of so many various backgrounds that every time, I've been learning and growing so much from these encounters.  And this time, I'd like to share that experience with everyone!

That's why I'll be consigning stories from my world tour into illustrated letters, which I'll send you, the backers, by physical mail or email. Then, at the end of the tour, I will turn these letters into chapters of a tour book, with more drawings!

How will it work?

Obviously, the funds raised will mainly go toward the printing of the book, which is estimated to be about 200 pages at the end. I have self-published more than a dozen books already, and estimate the costs to be around 10ca$/unit. I'd like to print at least 1000 of them, so that's why 10,000ca$ (7,500us$) is the minimum.

The rest of the funds will help fund the tour itself, since many trans organisations who will be hosting me don't have the means to pay for the traveling part. I am doing all this by myself, with no agent, and working closely with each organisation that invite me.

You will receive 12 letters/emails from February to June, each corresponding to a country or region I'll be visiting during the tour. These different parts are each described in the Chapters section!

If we reach the second goal, which will be announced in an update once and if the first goal is reached, everyone who signed up for a book will get it hardcover!

So is it like a travel guide?

My goal with this project is to share the stories I'm collecting from my point of view as a traveling trans artist.

When I was a teenager, the idea of traveling while trans seemed to be a risky one, and the risk is real. Violence exists everywhere, but so do we. 

This project isn't a travel log, and even less some ethno-sociological study. It's an art project, which will revolve around encounters and anecdotes, and will remain entirely subjective to my own experiences, perceptions and emotions. 

It will also be limited by which organizations invited me for this tour, which, sadly, need an internet connection, access to specific social media in order to be familiar with my work online, and to be located in a country without laws that forbid their existence.

This tour doesn't include any country of the Americas, which I will tour later in the coming year. If this campaign is successful, I'll consider making a similar project then!

Other Ways You Can Help

Pledging isn't the only way to help! Sharing the campaign on social media goes a long way. You can also show up at the events - most of them will be pinned on my Facebook page, at www.facebook.com/assignedmale .

Chapter list

As mentioned earlier, this list doesn't include any country or region from the Americas, which will come later - you can however already message me about it!

In this list, you will find the subjects of the letters I will write and send you, in order :

1. Australia

2. New Zealand

3. South Africa

4. Hong Kong / Taiwan

5. Thailand

6. England

7. Isle of Man / Ireland

8. Germany / Switzerland

9. Denmark / Sweden

10. Belgium

11. France

12. Epilogue

story:
Who the What now?

There are some talented people out there - we all know it.

The (very pleasant) surprise came when we realised just how much talent was sitting around the table at our monthly ACT (Australian Capital Territory) Comic meetups.

 

The decision to collaborate on a project was easy.

We all have individual projects and commitments, so the decision to produce a high-quality, finished, long-lasting product was unanimous. An anthology made the most sense - and it gave us an excellent excuse to collaborate with each other!

 

Once we'd decided on a full-colour anthology, we realised that for most of us, being in the ACT was an accident of employment, or education, or (in some cases) romance. Australia is a big place, and where most of us had come from, we would never have met each other. So, rather than being exclusive about it, we opened up a call for submissions artists and writers and comic creators around the country.

And I'm so glad we did!

 

As at today, anthology will feature contributions by authors and artists including (but not limited to, and in no particular order):

  • Ryan K. Lindsay
  • Shane W. Smith
  • Ele Jenkins
  • Tom Dullemond
  • Ben Rosenthal
  • Eleri Harris
  • Sam Cavanagh
  • Katie Ryan
  • Nate Soehardi
  • Alisha Howard
  • Gavin Thomson
  • Emma-Jean Stewart
  • Mike Perry
  • Lisa McDonald
  • Stu Barrow
  • Lani Fernance
  • Robert Perrie
    Spae
  • Darren Close
  • Alice Farquharson
    Luke Pickett
  • Jason Franks
  • Martin Trafford

(A word of warning: while the Anthology will be PG-rated, some of these links contain words and images that are more suitable for more mature audiences!)

 

The Book Itself

The anthology will be

  • Sized to fit into a handbag/satchel/suit pocket (A5 sized).
  • One hundred glossy pages.
  • Full colour.
  • A collection of stories about beginnings.
  • In a variety of genres - action, romance, autobiographical, super-hero, mythological.
  • Family friendly (though not specifically aimed at children or young adult).

 

The book will be printed locally, minimising the environmental impact and helping the local economy.

 

What We Need (and why) & What You Get

Your contribution is helping to tell stories to the world.

 

We will be doing a small print run and making each book as beautiful as we can - rather than doing a larger print run and compromising on quality or features.

 

In addition to awesome wearable art (badges!) and electronic and physical art (avatars! prints! sketches!), we have received some exceedingly generous donations for perks. Currently available is a piece of original artby Steven Sanders, from the 'Five Fists of Science' original graphic novel!

 

(Claimed perks are listed below.)

 

All our perks will be sent as soon as available - badges, electronic art, and professional development perks will be available immediately; pre-ordered books will be filled as soon as the printing (and hand numbering) is complete!

 

No matter the size of the contribution, if you send us your twitter details, we will give you a shout out, and if you send us your URL, we will put you up on our blog as a supporter and link to your site.


Contingencies

If we reach our goal of $2000, our books will come out in March 2012. We will have a book launch and exhibition of original art from the anthology in Canberra, and we will have a table at Sydney and/or Melbourne Supanova Expo.

 

If we exceed our funding goal, we will consider a larger print run based on pre-orders. We will have a book launch and exhibition in Canberra; and we will attend more conventions across Australia.

 

If we do not reach our goal of $2000 through crowdsourced funding, we will still fill our pre-orders and provide all perks, and use online marketing and print-on-demand to get this book out to the world. We will aim to meet our deadline of March 2012

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Y'see, we Australians are shy types, not given to boasting, and reticent to put ourselves forth. We prefer to let other people do our boasting for us.

 

So, even if you can't donate, you can help us spread the word:

  • Tweet or blog about us!
  • Tell a friend using the share tools!
  • Watch our campaign and get our weekly updates!
  • Talk about us on a first date - it's sure to be memorable!
  • Follow us on twitter for giveaways and promotions!
  • Visit our website - we'll be giving away web banners, avatars and desktop wall papers, and hosting online events throughout the campaign!

And if you are interested in contributing in a practical way to the anthology, send us an email and let us know!

 

 

Claimed Perks

* Justin Greenwood, artist on Oni's Resurrection and Wasteland, has offered a 9 x 12 commission sketch of a character of your choice!

 

* An art portfolio critique by Steven Sanders, artist for Marvel's S.W.O.R.D., Generation Hope, and Image's Five Fists of Science!

 

* A 22-page comic script analysis Justin Jordan - the writer of The Strange Talent of Luther Strode from Image Comics!

 

* A 10-page comic script analysis by Kurtis Wiebe, the writer of Green Wake and The Intrepids for Image Comics!

 

* A 45-minute professional development chat (via Skype) to discuss the nuts and bolts of writing, comics-writing in particular and work management with Kelly Sue DeConnick - the writer of many many comics for Marvel, IDW, Image, DC and Tokyopop!

 

* Lettering for your six-page comic, by Ed Brisson!

 

* A 10-page script analysis by award-winning author Mark Andrew Smith - the writer of Image Comics's Gladstone's School For World Conquerors and Amazing Joy Buzzards  and co-creator of the Popgun Anthologies.


* A script analysis of up to 22 pages by writer of American Vampire, Swamp Thing, and Batman - Scott Snyder! (Read more...)

story:
OK... here we go.... For the past few months, I have been slaving over our latest book, Kingdom of Loathing #4. I have been invited (and am going regardless!) to KoLCON 2013 in Mesa, Arizona. Our bags are packed and we're ready to go... but as an artist, I don't have a lot of $ to spare...

 So as such, I turn to you, our loyal fans and others to help a guy out. This trip won't put us in the poor house, but I got mouths to feed. I'm asking for $500 to help with the trip (airfare, lodging, beer... whatever). I know it's short notice, but I figure it's worth a shot. 

For all the hard earned cash you toss at me, I will give you things in return. Maybe we'll hang out at CON and also I am an artist... so you can get art and not just some intangible download my friends, but real hang-on-the-fridge-art! I'm willing to bust out my skillz in return for your help. So any help we can get would be great. Share this with everybody. Thanks in advance! And we'll see you at KoLCON.

story:
Welcome to "The Super Improbability of Marcus Egan's Heartbreak".

What happens when your ex meets your one night stand? Or when you find out that they also have a past together? And what if they were once sworn enemies in the current world of Superheroes and Super-villains? Yeah, it's awkward. 


Meet Marcus Egan. He's the average American 20-something gay man. He works as a reporter for one of Boston's top online zines, and hasn't had much luck in the love department since his "Big Ex" Jason kicked him to the curb and moved away without warning. But after some encouragement from his dodgeball teammates, he decides to put himself out there once again and ends up having his first one night stand.  There's only one problem; the guy he meets, Calvin, is the newest Superhero protecting the streets of Boston, and to make matters worse, he has a history with Marcus' "Big Ex" who's just moved back to town. Both in a romantic sense AND a super-villain sense. Now Marcus must decide if he should embrace an uncertain future with Calvin, aka The Knight Sky, or if he's willing to forget the past and rekindle his relationship with Jason, aka Doom's Day. 


I've been reading comic books for as long as I can remember. I used to have my sisters take me to the 7-Eleven around the block from my Grandmother's house in Brooklyn so I could buy the latest issue of the "Sabrina, the Teenage Witch" comic. Since then I've graduated to the X-Men, Avengers, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, and practically every other world saving, super-powered being you could think of in the current comic universe. I've also always had a special place in my heart for silly cartoons about people with everyday, mundane problems like dating, self confidence, and friendship. My ideal comic could be described as something that combined my two favorite genres into one mega-comic that I could obsess over.

Then, Scott Pilgrim's Precious Little Life came along, and my world was forever changed. Where else could you find a story about an up-incoming indie band, video game boss battles, and the desire to escape your past heartbreaks in the hopes of becoming a better person? After reading all six volumes, I knew this was the type of comic I wanted to create. Imagine if HBO's "Looking" and the Scott Pilgrim series had a baby, and that love-child went to write one of the greatest contemporary love stories the independent comic book world has ever seen (Okay, I may be exaggerating a bit). Marcus Egan's Heartbreak is just the first part of an even bigger story that's about to unfold, but it all starts here, and we need your help!!!




In order for this graphic novel to be a success, we'll need a few things. The money raised here will go towards artists fees, printing costs, promotion materials, and eventually, shipping the finished products. 

Whether you donate $1 or $100, we will have unique perks for everybody who contributes. Most donation perks include a digital copy of our story's first "Chapter" before any physical copies are sent out, and other perks will vary from a signed copy of the completed graphic novel itself to even being able to name a character in our book or make an appearance yourself!

Even if we don't meet our goal, we still want to make this the best possible story it can be. Granted, it may take a little longer than anticipated if we don't meet the initial goal, so the sooner we get enough funding, the faster we can get a finished product out into the world!  


The world of comic books and superheroes is rapidly expanding, and with that comes incredible change. During the Golden Age of comics, characters like Marcus Egan, The Knight Sky, or even his dodgeball teammates, The New Dodgevengers, would never have gotten stories of their own. Over the past decade though, great strides have been made in the LGBT+ community, and I've always wanted to see a story like this brought to life, with a diverse cast of characters from all different walks of life. I want readers to not only see themselves in these characters, but their friends and family members as well.


Representation is important, and that's one of my main goals with Marcus Egan's Heartbreak. Along with the over-arching love story in this graphic novel, I also want to build a story around the ever-changing landscape of LGBT+ visibility in modern media, especially for a younger audience. I've seen countless comics surrounding the love lives of queer men and women, but they're always so overly sexualized and not enough emphasis is placed on the reality of these characters. You don't need a six pack and bulging biceps to fall in love, and you definitely don't need to show gratuitous crotch shots in ever issue. I want this story to appeal to younger audiences as well as an older demographic, and not many teenagers will be able to buy this graphic novel if they'd feel too embarrassed of their parents finding an NC-17 rated book underneath their mattresses. Marcus Egan's story is a love story, but it's also about the everyday trials one has to face then transitioning from your early-twenties into adulthood(ish).

Even if you can't contribute much, a dollar goes a long way! Spread this campaign around to your friends, your coworkers, your classmates... I'm sure you know somebody who would absolutely love this story. The more eyeballs we can get on this project and the more people donate, the better the finished product will be. And, the faster it'll get to you! 

If you share this campaign on social media, be sure to use the hashtag #MarcusEgansHeartbreak so we can see! 

Neil is an admitted social media addict. Adam, not so much, but he at least has a Twitter account. Make sure to follow both of us for the latest updates on the projects, and any additional news about what's to come! 

Neil
Twitter: @Neil_McNeil
YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/geekingoutneil
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/neilmcneilmcneil
Tumblr: http://my-name-is-really-neil-mcneil.tumblr.com/

Adam
Twitter: @AdamFaySketch
Tumblr: http://adamfay.tumblr.com/
http://adamfayillustration.com
story_txt:
Welcome to "The Super Improbability of Marcus Egan's Heartbreak".

What happens when your ex meets your one night stand? Or when you find out that they also have a past together? And what if they were once sworn enemies in the current world of Superheroes and Super-villains? Yeah, it's awkward. 



Meet Marcus Egan. He's the average American 20-something gay man. He works as a reporter for one of Boston's top online zines, and hasn't had much luck in the love department since his "Big Ex" Jason kicked him to the curb and moved away without warning. But after some encouragement from his dodgeball teammates, he decides to put himself out there once again and ends up having his first one night stand.  There's only one problem; the guy he meets, Calvin, is the newest Superhero protecting the streets of Boston, and to make matters worse, he has a history with Marcus' "Big Ex" who's just moved back to town. Both in a romantic sense AND a super-villain sense. Now Marcus must decide if he should embrace an uncertain future with Calvin, aka The Knight Sky, or if he's willing to forget the past and rekindle his relationship with Jason, aka Doom's Day. 


I've been reading comic books for as long as I can remember. I used to have my sisters take me to the 7-Eleven around the block from my Grandmother's house in Brooklyn so I could buy the latest issue of the "Sabrina, the Teenage Witch" comic. story:
Book 6? Let's DO THIS!

Hello my faithful readers and soon-to-be readers! I'm Irma Eriksson and I create the comic "Imy" which I've been publishing on my website (http://www.imycomic.com) twice a week since November 2007.

A lot has happened for "Imy" in the past 8 years. Five books, tables at New York Comic Con for 5 years, the Stockholm Comics Festival for 6 years, and London MCM Comic Con in May 2014. In addition to that, "Imy" was published in Swedish in the Gothenburg newspaper Göteborgs-Posten in May 2013 and was very recently published in Swedish in the Svenska Serier comic magazine.

And now the 6th book is being made and this is your chance to get it!


In order to get the 6th book ready and printed up in time for October, I've decided to launch this Indiegogo, just as I did for books 4 and 5.

"Imy Vol. 6.0" will be printed in full, vibrant color, and will contain strips #501-#600, an extra exclusive story all about Imy's adorable new adoption, Luna the cat, and some extras!


This Indiegogo campaign is your best chance to grab your own copy of "Imy: Vol. 6.0." I don't keep a large stock, so take advantage of this opportunity so you don't get caught without this book in your collection! So consider this an official pre-order for your copy of the book!

And even if you don't want a book, there are some other great incentives you can choose from!

Or you can just drop a simple donation of any amount my way. I appreciate any help you can give me!

And one of the best things you can do for me is to spread the word to your Twitter and Facebook followers!

Now, let's move on to the goodies...

So, which perk do you want?








Stretch goals! YEAH!

If I end up surpassing my goal, I have stretch goals ready to go!

  • At $900 - I will get new bookmarks printed, and I will include a bookmark in every shipped order! 
  • At $1500 - New con display materials to make my table look more professional and approachable.

When will you receive your goodies?

You can expect your stuff by January 2016. Anything digital, like PDFs, will most likely come to you earlier. But plan on January for your merchandise.

Have you never read my comic before?

That's fine! You can go to the site and read them all! Enjoy! And THANK YOU!

http://www.imycomic.com
