story:
October 30th, 1938. CBS Broadcasts Orson Wells' The War of the Worlds. A small Washington town reacts poorly.



Did you like the video?  Well, then you are going to LOVE the comic book.

Concrete Martians written by Mitch Cook, illustrated by Keith Grachow - October 30th 1938, Orson Wells produces a radio show for Halloween. The Mercury Theatre Presents, H.G. Wells The War of the Worlds.
The tiny lumber/concrete town of Concrete, Washington, becomes the epicenter of Martian Invasion Hysteria when, at just the point when the Martians in the radio play attack, the power goes out and so do the phones.
The power that radio displayed in those early days of mass media showed us that, even without meaning to, the theatre of the mind can and often does wreak havoc amongst the masses. Local sheriff Ted "Teddy" Wilson has his hands full when a radio play combined with a powerful electrical storm stirs up Martian invasion fever amongst the residents of Concrete, Washington.  As the rains progress an overburdened power substation decides to quit. Of course this only fuels the hysteria and "proves" that the Martians are indeed invading with cruel intent.
In the end, the story is revealed to be merely a radio theatre play .

Most, if not all of the town’s people felt understandably embarrassed and went on to live their lives. However what happened on that day was never fully documented, and that's where our story takes us. This story is to be presented in two installments (52 pages total) but can be combined into one graphic novel. It isn't a terribly long story as the events take place in a matter of hours and just one stormy night.
Interspersed within the narrative is a retelling of the Mercury Theatre’s War of the Worlds broadcast. Up until the power goes out anyway.
The events depicted are based on anecdotal evidence by people who experienced them. Newspaper reports from Concrete, Washington have aided in telling this story.　 Many such events occurred across the country that night.　

Goals, Stretch Goals, and Rewards
We need to raise a minimum of $2500 to produce the first issue, 22 pages of limited color digital art. With this amount we will be able to create a digital copy that we can send out to all of our donors as well as apply to digital web comic sites like Comixology.
Each page costs $200 to produce, so, for every $200 contributed, we add another page. It would be nice to provide full color, or even a full 52 page graphic novel. So we are relying on you.  Every little bit helps. We are limiting the type of rewards offered for donations because the costs associated with fulfilling the rewards, producing, shipping, etc, defeats the purpose of the donations.

We do have stretch goals if we get over the $2500. Really this is just the start.

$3500- If we reach $3500 we will include actual printed copies of the completed book at specific donation levels. Reaching more donations means completing more of the book. 

Beyond $3500- So a 52 page complete story in limited color, printed and shipped will cost a much larger amount. So anything beyond $3500 would be a great help!

We have received a generous gift already and that has allowed us to get started on this project and keep the remaining costs down.  That is why our asking price isn't HUGE!
(Shipping copies is $6 US and Canadian addresses and $20 International.  FYI) 

 






 

 

Who are we?
Mitch R Cook
Writer – Bio

I am so glad that evidence of my past comic book experience is buried in a municipal waste site somewhere in Washington State. It would be embarrassing indeed to have that cassette tape of me reading an old Fantastic Four book out loud come to attention. 　(Yes, I read it out loud to a cassette tape recorder. Yes, I did all the voices; ALL the voices. Nope, not proud of that achievement. It was a good book though.)

Flash forward 30 years. (Yeah, it took 30 years to get to this point)　With a public school education, Community College radio shifts, The Edward R Murrow School at Washington State University, a marriage, a graduate degree, a divorce, another marriage, a TV job in Seattle. . . all a part of my history. Now, finally, I return to writing. I just never thought it would be a comic book.

The comic book format has been a part of my life for as long as I can remember. My brain has clearly been influenced by the pace of that form of storytelling. I never can tell a story to a group of people quickly.

I have been working on and off as a Broadcaster since 1991 as a student employee at KWSU and Prime Sports.  I had been the Production director(s) for Green River Community College’s Newspaper AND KGRG simultaneously.  I even spent a year in Yuma, Arizona as a Creative Services Producer/Director.  In 2006 I got back into Radio at CBS Radio Seattle in Promotions.  Yeah, I was the old man of the crew, but I enjoyed the work.  Then KOMO Called and the rest is history.  It was with Fisher that I discover the story of how the WOTW Broadcast effected the tiny town of Concrete Washington.  I HAD to tell their story.



Keith Grachow　
Illustrator -　Bio
Growing up with art through his father's advertising agency, led to a BFA with a focus in graphic design. He's worked as an artist doing concept designs for a dance club to being the in-house artist for Play Along Toys. They are the toy company that made the Britney Spears' dolls and produced licensed toys such as Care Bears. He's also worked on two Disney movies through the animation company Yowza, digitally inking and painting on the traditionally animated films "The Princess and the Frog" and "Winnie the Pooh". He's traveled to many parts of the world and stayed in Japan for a few years, where he taught English. He runs a studio that he's the co-owner of, JnK Imagery, creating personalized illustrations for his clients while his wife does wedding and boudoir photography.
Currently, he's working on the graphic novel Concrete Martians and the second book in the children's book series, On a planet named Up-In-the-Sky, called What would Slog Do? He just finished illustrating the 2nd graphic novel in the Arcane Awakening trilogy which will be out in October of this year.

Risks and challenges
The cost to produce (time and material for the artist) as well as publishing costs including shipping for this project have created limits on how many pages we can create. The minimum costs cover a basic issue of 22 pages in black and white, with sepia toned shading, and that is what we are starting with but we do NOT want to limit ourselves to this. A full 52 page, graphic novel is what we hope to do with this campaign but that requires a much larger commitment from you. We have given ourselves plenty of time to produce both the minimum number of pages as well as the full 52, so we do not foresee any real problems with producing this book.

Keith explains how we are technically producing Concrete Martians:

I'm doing all of the art as digital illustrations, which is to say that I'm using traditional drawing techniques but with a Cintiq, which uses a pressure sensitive pen on a tablet screen. Most of this is being drawn in Photoshop with a brush I use to get traditional looking results. There is no "original pieces" which means nothing is drawn with paper and pen. This is not to say that I'm doing any kind of photo manipulation or magically creating it in Photoshop using tracing. This is years of experience having learned how to draw with traditional medium, but adapting and using digital as a tool.


 New Reward Added - MY FAVOURITE MARTIAN

story:
The idea

Hello! My name is Pablo Ientile and I´m an illustrator from Argentina, currently living and working in Madrid and Berlin. I started a project 2 years ago called “Illustration Around the World.”

My dream was to one day make an illustrated book that showcased my work, but - like many creators and artists - I was in need of some inspiration and a story that would be the impetus for the book.

I spent a lot of time thinking about this and one day, I thought, “Why should I tell a fictional story when I can be the main character of my own story? I can combine my 2 favorite activities, traveling and drawing, and in this way meet other artists along the way and learn from their experiences!” 

The adventure

That was the premise for my project, and after saving up a lot of money, doing research, and convincing myself that this was a great idea, I began my 6-month trip around Asia, a continent that was previously unknown to me. 

I traveled around Japan, Korea, China, Taiwan, The Philippines, Malaysia, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Indonesia. I ended up filling my sketchbooks with drawings. 

I met a lot of artists, such as Devilrobots, Aki, Dan Matutina, Kenny Wong, Diela Maharanie – plus many more!


It was Awesome!

The main character on this journey was Pablo Bear and he became the storyteller for this amazing adventure.

I posted about the trip on my blog, and you can read all about it here: http://illustrationaroundtheworld.com

The Book

After returning from my trip around Asia, I started to design the book. It took me 2 years of hard work to finish it.

The book has 170 colorful pages in size A5, and each page is full of travel stories and encounters with fellow artists. It also features cultural sights, food experiences, surprising presentations, and tips for travellers. I started this campaign in order to cover the cost of printing the first edition, and you will be the first one to read it!

It will be printed in Berlin, Germany, and sent to you (wherever you are), so check out the different options and choose the one you like best. The goal of the campaign is to cover the initial print run of 500 books, and – depending on the demand – maybe we can even reach the goal of printing 1000 copies!

The book is written in English, since this was the language I used on my journey. Eventually I want to translate it into Spanish, German, and – hey – why not Chinese? Again, depending on demand, I hope to get it translated and offer you the option of downloading it in your language as a digital book in the future!

PARA LA GENTE DE HABLA HISPANA: Si no pueden leer el libro en inglés a todos los que lo pidan les enviaré una versión digital en español para que puedan leerlo acompañado con el libro impreso original, ¿que les parece la idea? Dependiendo del tiempo que me lleve imprimirlo espero poder enviarles la versión digital para finales de este año. !Muchas gracias!

The perks

This campaign is a way to pre-order the book, but it’s also a way for you to get some of my artwork if you’d like to have original drawings and paintings.

My plan is to make it possible for everyone to pre-order the book, but I realize for some countries it will be expensive to get just one copy, so I thought it would be a good idea to offer the option of pre-ordering 5 or 10 copies, that way the price per copy is lower and you can share/resell copies to your friends and family.

If you love to travel, but also like knowing beforehand a few things about the countries you're going to visit, this book can serve as a guide (and as a motivation to visit the countries I went to).

If you’re an art lover, you’ll be able to get original drawings and paintings and to have some gorgeous “destinations” hanging on your wall.

Examples

Preview of the Printed Book ( A5 - 170 pages - Color - Softcover  ) not the final version!

A5 Original drawing ( DRAWING TRAVELER)

POSTCARDS & A5 prints and also the inspiration for CANVAS


Your support

This project started as a way to get out of my office and meet artists around the world. I met so many people that helped and supported me. And if you want to support me, too, please share this campaign and help me spread the word about the value of travel, getting to know new cultures, and discovering amazing countries. You can share it on Facebook, Twitter, and any other social media sites – and then you will become a part of this dream as well!

Thank you for the help and I wish you...

Happy Travels!

PS: Thanks also to Michelle and Joni for the text correction and Martin/Michel for the sound of the video, and to Caro for her constant support.

Perks description:

NICE traveler: Thank you for the donation! everything helps! :) / approx. 2.70 USD

GRAPHC traveler: The Pablo Bear Graphic package including Postcards, sticker and 1 x A5 color print. Your name as a supporter on the webpage. / approx. 16 USD

DIGITAL traveler: A digital copy of the book in PDF format! Your name as a supporter on the webpage. / approx. 20 USD

SELFIE traveler: THE PRINTED BOOK for self pick-up! (BERLIN ONLY) If you are in BERLIN you can pick up the Book from my studio when it´s ready. Your name as a supporter on the webpage / approx. 30 USD

BOOK traveler: THE PRINTED BOOK! you will get a copy of the printed book, shipping costs included. Your name as a supporter on the webpage / approx. 32 USD

traveler with NAME: THE PRINTED BOOK! you will get a copy of the printed book + you will get your name written by me on the first page! shipping costs included. Your name as a supporter on the book´s "thank you" page / approx. 48 USD

HAPPY traveler: THE PRINTED BOOK! you will get a copy of the printed book + you will get your name written by me on the first page! shipping costs included. Your name as a supporter on the book´s "thank you" page + 4 x A5 prints / approx. 70 USD

SMALL GROUP traveler: 5 x copies of the BOOK to keep for yourself or share with/resell to your friends including shipping! 1 copy with your NAME! + A5 prints + Your name as a supporter on the book´s "thank you" page / approx. 125 USD

BIG GROUP traveler: 10 x copies of the BOOK to keep for yourself or share with/resell to your friends including shipping! + 1 copy with your NAME! + A5 Prints + Your name as a supporter on the book´s "thank you" page / approx. 220 USD

DRAWING traveler: 1 X Original A4 DRAWING of a sight of your choice in BERLIN + 1 x copy of the BOOK with your NAME on the first page + YOUR PORTRAIT (drawn by me) on the THANK YOU page of the book! / approx. 350 USD

ART traveler: first of all thank you VERY MUCH! You will get an original PAINTING on CANVAS (approx. 50 cm) of the image you want (it can be your favourite building or your cat) + 5 copies of the Printed BOOK + YOUR PORTRAIT (drawn by me) on the THANK YOU page of the book! / approx. 700 USD

BIG ART traveler: first of all thank you VERY MUCH! You will get an original PAINTING on CANVAS (approx. 80 cm) of the image you want (it can be your favourite building or your cat) + 5 copies of the Printed BOOK + YOUR PORTRAIT (drawn by me) on the THANK YOU page of the book / approx. 1000 USD

WORLD traveler: first of all thank you VERY MUCH! I will VISIT you and do a DRAWING/PAINTING of your HOUSE/VILLA/BUILDING done live!! (the cost of the trip would be funded by you) + YOUR PORTRAIT (drawn by me) on the THANK YOU page of the book + I will personally bring you a copy of the PRINTED book / approx. 1400 USD
story_txt:
The idea
Hello!
My name is Pablo Ientile and I´m an illustrator from Argentina,
currently living and working in Madrid and Berlin. I started a project 2 years ago
called “Illustration Around the World.”
My
dream was to one day make an illustrated book that showcased my work,
but - like many creators and artists - I was in need of some
inspiration and a story that would be the impetus for the book.
I
spent a lot of time thinking about this and one day, I thought, “Why
should I tell a fictional story when I can be the main character of
my own story? I can combine my 2 favorite activities, traveling and
drawing, and in this way meet other artists along the way and learn
from their experiences!” 

The adventure

That
was the premise for my project, and after saving up a lot of money,
doing research, and convincing myself that this was a great idea, I
began my 6-month trip around Asia, a continent that was previously
unknown to me. I
traveled around Japan, Korea, China, Taiwan, The Philippines,
Malaysia, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Indonesia. I ended up filling my
sketchbooks with drawings. 
I met a lot of artists, such as Devilrobots, Aki, Dan Matutina, Kenny Wong, Diela Maharanie – plus many more! It was Awesome!The
main character on this journey was Pablo Bear and he became the
storyteller for this amazing adventure.I
posted about the trip on my blog, and you can read all about it here: http://illustrationaroundtheworld.comThe Book


After
returning from my trip around Asia, I started to design the book. It
took me 2 years of hard work to finish it. 

The
book has 170 colorful pages in size A5, and each page is full of
travel stories and encounters with fellow artists. It also features
cultural sights, food experiences, surprising presentations, and tips
for travellers. I started this campaign in order to cover the cost of
printing the first edition, and you will be the first one to read it!It
will be printed in Berlin, Germany, and sent to you (wherever you
are), so check out the different options and choose the one you like
best. The goal of the campaign is to cover the initial print run of
500 books, and – depending on the demand – maybe we can even
reach the goal of printing 1000 copies!

The
book is written in English, since this was the language I used on my
journey. Eventually I want to translate it into Spanish, German, and
– hey – why not Chinese? Again, depending on demand, I hope to
get it translated and offer you the option of downloading it in your
language as a digital book in the future!

la versión digital para finales de este año. !Muchas gracias!The perks

story:
*publisher TBD

I've teamed up with Ron McCain to create an exciting new heist/thriller called, The Knox.

Hello, We're Andrew Anderson and Ron McCain.

We're comic creators. Ron's been in the business for a while, and Andrew read some of Ron's books he worked on while he was growing up. Years later Andrew would break into the industry doing indie books, and making friends with people he idolized growing up. 

Andrew and Ron meet in a private professional group on Facebook and hit off on their love for the medium, and came together to work on The Knox. The Knox announcement was well received at C2E2 and the Diamond retailer summit. Andrew and Ron plan on releasing it in the summer of 2019. 
 

This is the first of many works Ron and Andrew have planned.

The Story

The Knox is about a squad of soldiers who have had a string of bad luck since returning from Vietnam. One lost his legs, the other lost his store, the others aren't doing too well either. They hatch a plan to rob Fort Knox. The robery was the easy part, getting away with it is the hard part. Cutting deals with the mob isn't the easy street that it sounded like.  Betrayal is around the corner for all.

 

Bonus Perk:

I made guitar picks to randomly give away!

story:
My name is J.S. Earls and I am a professional comic book writer. Recently, I had the opportunity to script the graphic novel adaption of the best-selling book MEG, which the current blockbuster film is also based on. Over the last 10 years I’ve had the opportunity to write a number of comics and graphic novels, but none have been as important or as personal to me as this one.

          The idea for THE CRY came to me several years ago, when I was a young father and we had a rash of child abductions and murders in Florida. I was absolutely outraged by what happened to these children and I remember thinking of those kids and how terrified they must have been. I wished there was someone or something that could get to them...no matter what trunk or cage they were in.

          That’s when I pictured a child’s tear falling and then suddenly growing and morphing into a liquid monster that would fight the abusers and free the children. Hopefully, it would frighten their abductors so badly they’d never try anything like that again.

          Although I’ve had many ideas, THE CRY has really stuck with me and—now that I’ve found Pablo Ayala, the perfect artist to bring my vision to life—that’s exactly what I need your help to do. With your support I can pay Pablo what he deserves and I can finally pay to get this passion project printed.

          Depending on your pledge level, you’ll get either a digital version of THE CRY 24-pg comic, a printed version of THE CRY 24-pg comic or a 66-pg deluxe version of THE CRY which includes the 24 comic pages + the original comic script & over a dozen pages of sketches & more.

          Another thing Pablo and I want to do is use this opportunity to give to Protect.Org, the most effective pro-child, anti-crime group around. Now, THE CRY is not affiliated with Protect.Org and this is not a charity comic, but—for every $2 we raise—we’ll use $1 for our comic & Pablo & I will donate the other $1 to Protect.Org. So not only will your support affect our lives, but more importantly, the lives of countless children.

          Even if you’re financially unable to support THE CRY at this time, we’d love your help getting the word out.  Please post or share this campaign with as many people as you possibly can. We really can't do this alone. 

          From the bottom of our hearts...thank you. 

 

          — J. S. Earls

          earls.js@gmail.com

story:
Welcome to Metropo with its gleaming spires and forgotten depths. A city so vast and dense it almost feels alive. Artificial or otherwise, its denizens struggle with familiar heartache and tackle questions we are only beginning to ask.

This ‘slice of cyberpunk life’ collection takes us into the hearts and minds of these denizens, presenting eight stories from the lives of those in the unending city.


 

METROPO eight stories from the unending city includes these stories:

Raindrop Hatch (comic)
The Fierce Code (prose)
Temporal (prose)
Automobile (comic)
Walkways (comic)
Drowning (prose)
Every Moment is a Moment Forward (comic)
Sunrise (prose)

 

PRE//ORDER

METROPO eight stories from the unending city was successfully funded through Kickstarter in January 2018. Due to a high demand of people, and androids, reaching out to us who missed the Kickstarter campaign but would like to pre-order, we decided to make this IndieGoGo to run a 14-day pre-order campaign.

The more pre-orders we get, the brighter the future for the book. As 2018 evolves we will be pitching the book to publishers, hoping to do a regular edition in 2019/2020 with wide distribution. The better this initial limited edition version of the book fares, the higher our chances.

This 14-days window will not delay the printing and shipping of Metropo, which is set to release/ship in April 2018.

So if you missed out, or some of your science fiction friends did, here's your chance to enter the unending city and become a citizen!

 

//PERKS

All perks include shipping.

FOR APPAREL//MERCH, PLEASE VISIT DESIGN FROM THE UNENDING CITY:

 

TASTE//INSPIRATION

 

Metropo is inspired by the tech (r)evolution we live in, and the ever-present scientific and philosophical discussions on what life will be like in the near future. It is inspired by a breadth of science fiction, from Brave New World to Deus Ex to Her. Touching on ideas about artificial intelligence, architecture, class and the notion of the self and consciousness (human and otherwise) in a world saturated by technology. But most importantly, a heartfelt, poetic, fun and aching journey through the walkways, airlanes, rooms and rooftops in the thick of Metropo.

 

PRINTING//SHIPPING

We're partnering with a tried and trusted megacorporation from Sector 5 in Metropo—KrakenPrint. Our HQ have used them for both printing and fulfilment for the Spiral Kickstarter campaign, as well as printing the Earthlock one-shot comic. With more than satisfactory results.

SOCIAL//MEDIA

All Metropo visitors and citizens, artificial or otherwise, are encouraged to join the construction of the unending city on our newsletter & social media sites.

 

//CREATORS

 

Magnus Aspli // A robot from Norway who has written comics and screenplays for nearly a decade. Magnus is currently working on building Metropo on several fronts, while also being involved in a few film and TV projects, plus a game. He’s been shipped and updated at universities in both Brisbane and London, but now lives in Trondheim with his family, raising kids and raising hell.

Vivian Truong // Vivian says she’s a short Chinese artist from London, but as you can tell, she might be a digital self-representation of a cartoon character. Rumour claims she’s a rogue AI, but the fun and benevolent kind. Vivian has a Patreon you could hack into to discover more of her work.

Mary (Cryoclaire) Safro // Mary is a Russian cyber-junkie comic artist, saving the Queen in the UK. She’s the co-creator of Drugs & Wires. A retro-90s Eastern cyberpunk webcomic about everything going wrong. It updates on Mondays and you should head back to the 90s to check it out.

John Jamtli // John is our cover artist. He’s a wide-ranging illustrator mainly working in comics. His most recent work is Sabotør [saboteur]—a historical romp behind the scenes of a controversial part of the resistance movement in Norway during the Nazi Occupation of WWII—which’ll be out in spring 2018. Unfortunately, for most of you, it’s in Norwegian. Fortunately, for all of you, it looks absolutely stunning. Follow John on Instagram for more.

Emerson Dimaya // Emerson is our spot architect, putting the spice in our Metropo book soup. He has traveled the megalopolis and made some sketches from his dronetaxi and on foot. Emerson’s an illustrator and comic book artist from the Philippines. He’s the artist on Spiral and the Earthlock comic book.

Rob Croonenborghs // Rob is from Belgium and one of the builders of Metropo. His rough and organic style a lovely and ironic juxtaposition to the perfect system in his story Automobile. (We suspect Rob is actually a generative design AI prototype.) You can find more of Rob’s comics on Comixology and more of his art on DeviantArt.

Naomi Franquiz // Naomi, according to her neural net, is a freelance illustrator, comic artist, and reprobate. (We’re still not sure if she’s an android or not.) She built Every Moment is a Moment Forward—the final short comic in Metropo—with her brilliant flavour and style. Make sure to check out her comic Misfit City, published by Boom! And do point your cybernetic eyes on her tumblr!

Dan Hill // Dan is the hidden architect behind the facade of Metropo. A writer and editor, Dan is making sure all is well with the book and that every story, every sentence, every word, is its best hologram of the intended idea.

Dan has edited titles such as Deer Editor, Headspace, Mitch Hammer and Black Canvas from Black Mask Studios. His one-shot comic Go Home, together with Andrew Herbst, about how war haunts us, is available on Comixology. You can find Dan on Twitter and you can jump on his newsletter A Pleasurable Headache here.

 

SPECIAL//THANKS

A special thanks to the Norwegian Arts Council for initial funding and to Kickstarter and our backers there who made us reach our full funding goal. To my collaborators in this book. To Jacob & KrakenPrint. To Aaron Marshall for the music. To Sander and Pekka for being part of building another quadrant of Metropo. To Breach VR for curiosity and possibly a unique future. To WorkWork for a creative environment and inspiration. To my family for patience, love and gravity. To all those of you who have assisted in wiring and adjusting this book into one piece, with feedback and sharp minds. You know who you are.

 

RISKS//CHALLENGES

The book is finished and heading to print. We're working with KrakenPrint, a professional printing and distribution superintelligence, so everything will run smoothly and efficiently.

Delays in shipping with both printing and distribution of rewards might occur due to elements outside of our control, of course. Malevolent hackers, a buggy automated shipping vessel, a global EMP bomb, or worse. If any problems do occur we'll do our best to fix it as soon as possible. By human brainpower and artificial superintelligence combined.

John Jamtli // John is our cover artist. He’s a wide-ranging illustrator mainly working in comics. His most recent work is Sabotør [saboteur]—a historical romp behind the scenes of a controversial part of the resistance movement in Norway during the Nazi Occupation of WWII—which’ll be out in spring 2018. Unfortunately, for most of you, it’s in Norwegian. Fortunately, for all of you, it looks absolutely stunning. Follow John on Instagram for more.

Emerson Dimaya // Emerson is our spot architect, putting the spice in our Metropo book soup. He has traveled the megalopolis and made some sketches from his dronetaxi and on foot. Emerson’s an illustrator and comic book artist from the Philippines. He’s the artist on Spiral and the Earthlock comic book.

Rob Croonenborghs // Rob is from Belgium and one of the builders of Metropo. His rough and organic style a lovely and ironic juxtaposition to the perfect system in his story Automobile. (We suspect Rob is actually a generative design AI prototype.) You can find more of Rob’s comics on Comixology and more of his art on DeviantArt.

Naomi Franquiz // Naomi, according to her neural net, is a freelance illustrator, comic artist, and reprobate. (We’re still not sure if she’s an android or not.) She built Every Moment is a Moment Forward—the final short comic in Metropo—with her brilliant flavour and style. Make sure to check out her comic Misfit City, published by Boom! And do point your cybernetic eyes on her tumblr!

Dan Hill // Dan is the hidden architect behind the facade of Metropo. A writer and editor, Dan is making sure all is well with the book and that every story, every sentence, every word, is its best hologram of the intended idea.
Dan has edited titles such as Deer Editor, Headspace, Mitch Hammer and Black Canvas from Black Mask Studios. His one-shot comic Go Home, together with Andrew Herbst, about how war haunts us, is available on Comixology. You can find Dan on Twitter and you can jump on his newsletter A Pleasurable Headache here.

 
SPECIAL//THANKS
A special thanks to the Norwegian Arts Council for initial funding and to Kickstarter and our backers there who made us reach our full funding goal. To my collaborators in this book. To Jacob & KrakenPrint. To Aaron Marshall for the music. To Sander and Pekka for being part of building another quadrant of Metropo. To Breach VR for curiosity and possibly a unique future. To WorkWork for a creative environment and inspiration. To my family for patience, love and gravity. To all those of you who have assisted in wiring and adjusting this book into one piece, with feedback and sharp minds. You know who you are.

 
RISKS//CHALLENGES
The book is finished and heading to print. We're working with KrakenPrint, a professional printing and distribution superintelligence, so everything will run smoothly and efficiently.
Delays in shipping with both printing and distribution of rewards might occur due to elements outside of our control, of course. Malevolent hackers, a buggy automated shipping vessel, a global EMP bomb, or worse. If any problems do occur we'll do our best to fix it as soon as possible. By human brainpower and artificial superintelligence combined.

story:
Short Summary

We're just about ready to go to press, but we need your help. Not exactly looking for handouts, just asking folks to pre-purchase your copy of Lunaria # 2 here!

What We Need & What You Get

Southern Earth Industries and Jensen Entertainment, with thanks to Red Starr Productions will be bringing issue #2 of the bi-monthly comic book Lunaria to stores at the end of February! We need your help to cover printing costs, simply by pre-purchasing your copy at cover price!

The Impact

Lunaria is a live-action series currently in production and a comic book already in stores from Southern Earth Industries and Jensen Entertainment. When you pre-purchase your copy of Lunaria #2, you'll recieve both a print copy via mail AND access to the digital version!
 
This helps us continue to spread the word about the adventures of this exciting new female superhero from award-winning artist Brandon Scott Jensen and "Prowl" writer Blake Acker.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, please at least help us by liking our facebook page at facebook.com/LunariaWorld. You can get access to contests and prizes and it doesn't cost you a dime!
 
facebook.com/lunariaworld

story:
Perks Getting Prepped!


Paper is coming for prints, magnets are on their way, the copies of my previous books are on their way, bags are on order!

The format and release date of THE GARLICKS trade is still being decided. As soon as I know, I'll post/send an update. This affects the sketchbook, too, they'll be mailed at the same time.

In the meantime, mailable incentives will be mailed: sketch sets, magnets, sketches, prints.

Speaking of magnets, here's the art for those:

Thanks, as always, for your support!

FOOD, FOLKS and FANGS!

Lea

 

AND WE'RE DONE!

Thank you, this has been INCREDIBLE! (Which means, "Swooping and yawing from despair to 'HELL YEAH I'M A GENIUS!"')

I want to tell you: doing an indiegogo/Kickstarter campaign is harder than you think. I did two in six months because I believe in my vampire kids, and I'm also a fan of that winning feeling. Oh, how I love that feeling.

More people to thank in no particular order!

Jill Thompson, who's writing the intro for THE GARLICKS Book One and wow!

Samax Amen from Ghettomanga, Brian Truitt at USA Today, Henry Barajas at The Beat. Adam Warren helped me edit for near-maximum awesomeness. NYT bestselling author of Seraphina Rachel Hartman because she is AWESOME. 

My daughter, Summer. My son, Fox. My boyfriend David. My best friend Lisa Jonte. 

Kurt Busiek gets mentioned one more time for helping me re-tool THE GARLICKS so it could have a successful campaign. He did it because he's selfish, but full marks anyway.

ALSO @NeilaK20 and @Cattype for going way far out to support THE GARLICKS on Twitter. Ladies.

Everyone, just EVERYONE. YOU GALS AND GUYS.

AND HERE WE ARE.

When incentives other than books are ready to mail, there'll be updates. 

I'll make you the BEST DARN BOOK about vampire baristas, vampire graphic novelists, Italian butchers and fishbats EVER, and for girls. 

FOOD, FAMILY AND FANGS FOREVER!

See you Monday!

 

NEW PERK!

For an additional $250 added to your pledge, or a NEW $350. pledge, you will receive the ORIGINAL ART for the Kurt Busiek Eats a Bug print!

With the art comes either--

--FOUR signed and sketched copies of THE GARLICKS, four of each print, four magnets, an ebook, and acknowledgement in the book!

OR

--Two of the following three perks: Pandora's Library, Pandora's Kit, Fishbat Plush.

BUT WAIT!

$100. of this perk will be donated to Kitty Bungalow Charm School for Wayward Cats, a charming Los Angeles non-profit that traps, neuters and releases feral cats and tames and adopts feral kittens.You'll be getting a unique piece of original art, an armload of books, and helping wonderful cats live good lives.  

How do you get it?

If you've already pledged, just add $250., if you're a new contributor, choose "Pandora's Dream Bag" and add a note that's it's for the Kurt Busiek Eats a Bug original art.

 

HI, I'M LEA HERNANDEZ

I'm raising money for the production and printing of Book One (of four) of my sixth graphic novel, a full-color vampire comedy called THE GARLICKS, and I need your help to bring it to life (and print)!

THE GARLICKS is told from the point of view of Pandora Garlick, a teenage vampire with zero vampire abilities. 

Me, I'm an award-winning cartoonist who's worked on comics like The Little Mermaid (for Disney), Girl Comics (for Marvel, and starring Magneto and Wolverine), Star Wars: Droids (for Dark Horse) and created three graphic novels for Young Adults: Cathedral Child, Clockwork Angels and Rumble Girls.

 

THE GARLICKS, THE BOOK

 

"Lea's stuff is terrific."-- Neil Gaiman (Coraline, The Graveyard Book)

Our supernatural hero, Pandora Garlick, is the big sister of baby Pamila (who's usually called Ham), who seems to have gotten everything Pandora didn't, like being able to shapeshift into a winsome (and annoying) flying fish and a taste for meat. 

Here's what The Garlicks is going to look like in color:

And here, for your readng pleasure, is The Garlicks' six-page "pilot" story:

 

 

 

 

Pandora, with no answers for why she isn't a proper vampire, turns to her passion, making comics, and chooses her family as her muses: the exhausting Ham, her vampire father Vourdain Garlick (a flower-eating barista), her human mother Olive Garlick (a baker-turned-butcher), and their home/business, Orange Espresso and Meats.

 

Olive Garlick (human, butcher) and Vourdain (vampire, barista):

 

When Pandora steals a blanket (and granny panties) to hide fishbat-Ham after yet another chase through their neighborhood, she brings herself and Ham to the attention of not only Maxim, a friendly boy who can see monsters, but also three rock-stupid, very dangerous, demon-hunting angels.

Pan quickly finds out that the only thing worse than having no time to draw stories is having entirely too much material to draw from. How will Pandora, with supposedly no supernatural abilities, save her family from a supernatural threat?

"...funny, human, silly, gorgeous, sweet and smart," --Kurt Busiek (Astro City, Marvels)

 

READ THE GARLICKS AS IT'S DRAWN FOR THE GRAPHIC NOVEL!

I'll be serializing THE GARLICKS Book One (of four), three color pages a week, over the next four or five months as a webcomic at thegarlicks.net and pages will appear here in updates.

When Pandora's first story is complete and still piping hot, it'll be collected into full-color print trade of 60 pages, with an introduction by Jill Thompson, incredible creator of the Halloween classic SCARY GODMOTHER! (Who better, right?)

"Lovely work."--Jim Lee (artist of Justice League, co-publisher, DC Comics)

 

GOODIES. GOOD GOODIES

I've concocted some fine incentives for you: at just $10., you'll get a PDF copy of the book and a custom magnet of Fishbat. At $25., a signed copy of THE GARLICKS and a print of Astro City writer Kurt Busiek (a huge supporter and friend of The Garlicks) eating a bug (as he has promised to do to help THE GARLICKS see print) or a print of Fishbat and Pandora Garlick!

 

KURT BUSIEK EATS A BUG PRINT:

 

 

FISHBAT AND PANDORA GARLICK PRINT:

 

FISHBAT PLUSH!

 

PANDORA'S ART KIT (scope this pic!):

 

PAN'S DREAM BAG (the gloriously extravagant custom messenger bag stuffed with books and goodies):

Even a chance to appear in THE GARLICKS as a character!

 

NOW, I DRAW! (AND PRINT AND MAIL...)

The money raised for THE GARLICKS will go towards the production and printing of the first of four planned volumes and to make and mail out incentives. I'll be writing, drawing, and assembling THE GARLICKS full time for about five months, then shepherding it through printing, THEN signing and mailing them for another two months! (It takes a LOT of hours to address and stuff and post books. I have to start making packages in November to be ready when THE GARLICKS is printed next year!)

SHARE!

Even if you can't contribute money, or if you want to do more (oh please do more!) you can still be part of Team Garlicks (or Team Fishbat or Team Pandora or Team Rock-Stupid Angels), by spreading the word about THE GARLICKS via Twitter, Facebook, tumblr, and Pinterest. Everything helps, and I will be very grateful!

The music for my video is "Self Motivation (Dance to Success Mix)" by Borja.

story:
Welcome to our Fundraiser page!

'Star Wars: The Search for Windu' is a non-profit fan based graphic novel set in the Star Wars universe. The comic is a 4 part series about 65 pages in length. Its got action, drama, the return of iconic Star Wars characters, and a bit of humor as well. Its a Parody that pokes fun at Star Wars as well as a heartfelt a story written by SW fans for SW fans in honor of the incredible universe George Lucas created.

Right now the script is finished, comic panels designed, concept art on the way, and artists are ready and itching to begin production. All we need now is the funds to produce the comic.

The comic is set between 'The Empire Strikes Back' and 'Return of the Jedi'. Its about Luke Skywalker who is sent by Obi Wan's spirit to find a new master. His search for this new teacher takes him to the heart of the Empire on Corosant where Luke discovers that the Jedi Master he seeks is none other than Mace Windu who miraculously survived the events of Episode 3.

Unfortunately the aged Windu has become jaded by the events that have transpired since the rise of the Empire. He's given up on the Jedi ways and lives a simple life running a saloon in the Coruscant red light district. Its up to Luke to not only convince Mace to train him but also restore the old man's hope for a better galaxy.

'The Search for Windu' is a story that deals with profoundly deep themes. At its heart the comic is about redemption and hope. Its also about taking up crusades and not being afraid to take risks no matter what might happen. Its because of these universal ideas at the core of our story that we believe others will gravitate to our comic.

While our fundraising goal is set to $4,500, that's just the minimum we need in order to get our project off the ground and started. People don't realize how costly it is to produce a profession grade comic book. Some can cost up to $100 to $300 per page to produce. Sometimes more..

We are hoping our fundraiser will surpass the $4,500 mark and reach at least $7,500.

Such an ambitious project will be a monumental task. Not only are we producing a full sized graphic novel but we'll also need the funds to set up a website so that this comic can be shared with the world.

The minimum goal of $4,500 will help us to:

-Cover production costs for Chapters 1 and 2 of the book.
-Provide the rewards for those who pledge.

The ideal goal of $7,500+ will help us to:

-Cover production costs for Chapters 1, 2, 3, and 4.
-Provide the rewards for those who pledge.
-Set up the website for the comic.

So why should you back our project?

Well first off you'll get the satisfaction of knowing you helped make our dreams a reality. Isn't that reason enough?

No?

Well we've also come up with a long list of rewards to thank our backers for pledging.

We'll be giving away things like 8"x11" concept art prints, comic book chapters in PDF form, custom illustrations made just for you, and exclusive Star Wars gift baskets for those awesome backers who donate the maximum amount possible.**See Gift Basket Images Below**

***Backers outside of North America will need to add extra to help cover shipping costs. $15 extra for rewards less than $100. $25 for rewards more than $100***

We hope you will join the passionate group of artist and Star Wars fans who are working to make this story become a reality. Your support will fuel our dreams and vision.

Every little bit helps and everything you give will go right into making this the best graphic novel it can possibly be.

Even if you can't donate, you can still SHARE our project with your friends and family.

Help us Indiegogo backers! You're our only hope!

Thank you and May the Force be with You!

-Nick Lopez
Director of 'Star Wars: The Search for Windu'
https://www.facebook.com/StarWarsTheSearchForWindu

Darth Vader 11"x17" pop art poster for our Level 4 Reward
